title: Software minimization
description:
Reduce the the amount of software that Software has to care about, in order to reduce complexity and make it better suited to immutable operating systems.

https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/1968

https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-software/issues/861

https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-software/issues/862

title: GTK4 UX development
description:
UX development opportunities for GTK3 are limited, so the focus needs to be on GTK4. This includes all the GTK4 bits of https://wiki.gnome.org/Design/Whiteboards/DesignPatternReview :

 - Menus
 - Text styles
 - Split header bars

Probably more.

title: GTK3 widget library
description:
Library containing additional GTK3 widgets. Goals:

 - included in the GNOME runtime
 - referenced in developer and design documentation
 - should only contain high-quality widgets
 - widgets should be used by core GNOME apps
 - library should be maintained

Initial target widgets:

 - lists
 - in-app notifications
 - dropdown lists

There might be other things in libhandy which we want to get in.

title: Unlock/login redesign testing
description:
The new unlock and login experience is in the process of being implemented. We're at the stage where we need to think about testing.

Let's use this issue to

 - Identify what we want to test
 - Figure out how to test
 - Track progress and results

## Questions to test

 - Can people successfully unlock/login?
 - Do we need an explicit prompt: "click or press a key to unlock"?
 - Do existing users like the new design?
 - Would people prefer it if we didn't have the initial clock state and just showed the password entry when the display wakes up?

## How to test

 - VM running Fedora 31, with the shell manually built following [these instructions](https://gitlab.gnome.org/snippets/923) - tested and works if you run on X11
 - JHBuild - no success with this so far; could be due to mitigating factors (Silverblue, Wayland)

title: Please add design for media control buttons to gnome shell
description:
Since by default gnome-shell does not expose any mpris control buttons I would find it great to have some official proposal for an potential implementation in the future. Right now there are extensions that could serve as an inspiration:
https://github.com/JasonLG1979/gnome-shell-extension-mpris-indicator-button

Especially considering the mobile efforts this is some element that is surely important and therefore this would be a great opportunity to bring this feature to the desktop shell too. I think for consistency with mobile the notification area would be a great place, but I am not entirely sure.

title: Portals design review
description:
This isn't a mockups issue per-se, but this seems as good a place to put it as any.

Flatpak has accumulated a good number of portals and it would be good to iterate on the experience so they are all consistent and of a high-quality.

There are three main places where the portals surface, I think:

 - System permission dialogs (specific mockups [here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/tree/master/portals) and [here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/blob/master/system-dialogs/permissions-dialogs.png), there are also [more generic system dialog mockups](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/blob/master/system-dialogs/system-dialogs-1.png))
 - Application settings ([mockups](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/settings-mockups/tree/master/applications))
 - Privacy settings ([mockups](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/settings-mockups/blob/master/privacy/privacy.png))

## Portals overview
Established library API, good adoption:

| Name | Dialogs | Setting in settings? | Notes |
|------|---------|----------------------|-------|
| File chooser | [open mode](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/6c95045ce4a7d045e64eabdfbc426d84/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-14-42.png) [save mode](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/bcdf57a66cdc360d1463a24b182fdfbc/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-14-49.png) | N/A | Standard file chooser dialog |
| Print | [print dialog](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/68b9fa2147419e32af50475cee5451a7/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-17-04.png) | N/A | Standard print dialog |
| Email | [email dialog](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/b0d245ae9cf682d92c9d35b1636f5677/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-17-23.png) | N/A | Standard email dialog |
| Sound input/output | Standard system auth dialog | Y | |
| Open URI | [app select dialog](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/d2ef2f1242423e5f7b935738c441eaca/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-16-10.png) [app select - more](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/fe09d626a425396130896583bef8c5df/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_20-22-17.png) [app select - search](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/7fc2de1657682694106818b4d4cee740/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_20-22-32.png) | N | | Location | Standard system auth dialog | Y | |
| Inhibit | Standard system auth dialog | N | |

No library, not really used:

| Name | Dialogs | Setting in settings? | Notes |
|------|---------|----------------------|-------|
| Screenshot | [dialog - plain](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/6790148a85da71c10494272791bc1a4d/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-16-32.png) [dialog - options](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/15bf3a9cbf6e1764053aa4c5cb7e0f23/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-16-36.png) | ? | |
| Account  | [dialog](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/e0d0f52bf78f9015392f799535b5059e/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-17-09.png) [dialog - editing](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/587aad8ae37939ede17345ec218888c1/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-17-13.png) | ? | |
| Share screen | [selecting monitors](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/7c200b62ba9a41addd6d6a423aea1bb9/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-16-43.png) [selecting monitors or windows](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/ef00a012df97add093ff04291cc2bfc3/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-44-41.png) | N/A | |
| Run in the background | [explicit request](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/68ab8635cbfca5a3fdb39d718f85e53f/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-17-32.png) [notifying about unexpected background activity](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/67ac569282f62beac962f38717764305/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_15-52-22.png) | [WIP](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-control-center/issues/797) | [#249](https://github.com/flatpak/xdg-desktop-portal-gtk/issues/249) |
| Wallpaper | [background preview](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/6ff03b91487a88e49a43ab47aae258cb/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_16-27-12.png) [background and lock preview](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/ad0423e6eae06e487cd68f23d9ddb055/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_16-29-16.png) [permanent auth](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/c1dacf261121937b85e8a2445a4142f9/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_16-42-41.png) [permanent auth, fallback](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/os-mockups/uploads/7be14de74a64c579831e252e92a2850d/Screenshot_from_2019-12-04_16-33-59.png) | [WIP](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-control-center/issues/808) | Permanent access is for apps that want to update the wallpaper themselves, like on a rotation |
| Camera | Stantard system auth dialog | Y | |

## Testing notes

[This branch](https://github.com/flatpak/libportal/tree/build-portal-test) includes the `portal-test` app which can show demos of each of the dialogs. Once it's built, `./build/portal-test/portal-test` will run the test app.

With current text shadow:

![image_2019-11-04_13-10-22](/uploads/80037a9c160122bc457b9dd739e2d16f/image_2019-11-04_13-10-22.png)
![image](/uploads/97667c2a45a2079b2c4b572608c08421/image.png)

With the current text shadow:

![image_2019-11-04_11-52-55](/uploads/e1757b12201b4c8399a816202af6645e/image_2019-11-04_11-52-55.png)

![image_2019-11-04_11-56-41](/uploads/de8367923b2bd82008a8dcd3c853dd62/image_2019-11-04_11-56-41.png)

![image](/uploads/b3d0059e9572b06b06e52e87da0e5aa2/image.png)
![image](/uploads/b7668bfc7b8fa8188f423a66a95392c6/image.png)
![image](/uploads/b341f43575efa3a546bd7fd858b5aef9/image.png)
![image](/uploads/aa0a249ec94d2cdb28f567aad1c01620/image.png)

- IMHO this gives text and unproportionally heavy depth compared to the general look of the theme
- it somehow gives the whole theme a little retro vibe

Closing and restarting the app will pick up the changes.

title: Add reload for icons sets
description: There's no reason to have a reload for one icon view. The icon is created using a GFileIcon, it auto-updates whenever the file changes. That makes sense only for an icon set where we need to re-parse the whole file and re-create the widgets

title: Export classes properly
description:
Currently, librsvg converts hex colors to rgb percentages. `rgb(96.078432%,47.450981%,0%);` instead of `#f57900` nor it preserves the classes. Which makes it very hard to tackle down, I tried to convert that color to an rgb but forgot floats 😒

librsvg issue https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/librsvg/issues/537

title: CLI support
description: We can easily do that by just parsing the file as a project and export it to $dest. This would be useful for icon-dev-kit -> icon-library auto-updates.

title: The Grand Plan
description:
As discussed today, here's my current vision for how all the various icon tools would work together in the future:

- **App Icon Preview** is used to open/start from template, preview and export app icons (hicolor + symbolic). It doesn't integrate with the other apps
- **Icon Library** is used to search for symbolics to use in your app. If you find the icon you need you just save it into your app's data directory, if you want to modify an icon there's a button to "create derivative", which will open the icon in Inkscape and Symbolic Preview
- **Symbolic Preview** is used to preview/export individual symbolics, or sets of symbolics (such as a-i-t/devkit), but also sets of symbolics for individual apps with lots of custom symbolics. It can also be used from the command line (i.e. the svago use case).

From a technical perspective we'd have to do the following:

- The new [Icon Set Preview app](https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/design/icon-set-preview) becomes Symbolic Preview, once we add the individual symbolic preview from Icon Preview
- Icon Set Preview gets templates for both individual symbolics and stencil-style sets
- The symbolic preview mode is removed from Icon Preview
- Icon Preview only does app icons now, so we rename it to App Icon Preview
- Icon Library gains a "create derivative" feature, which opens an icon in Inkscape and Symbolic Preview


Here's a quick illustration of the flows for the primary use cases:

 ![icon-tool-use-cases](/uploads/7f5ffb4f0d2df7430fc1e0b348c8e8ea/icon-tool-use-cases.png)

title: In-app explanation of WCAG contrast
description: It would be good to have some kind of documentation as to how WCAG contrast works inside the app. This could take the form of a primary menu entry, which opens a dialog with a few paragraphs of text and some illustrations.

title: Ask the user where to save the derived icon
description: Currently, the icon is stored in /tmp which is not a great solution. We should instead ask the user where to save and how to name the icon before opening the file

title: Integrate with Symbolic Preview
description: It would be neat if we can easily create a derivative of an icon and open it in symbolic preview.

title: Grid Items need a hover state
description: To indicate that icons in the grid are clickable, they're going to need some sort of hover styling. Potentially this could be button styling.

title: Icon grid container needs a margin
description: When the app window is a narrow width the `icons_container` is touching the sides, it'll need a margin on the left and right (of 12).

title: Issues caused by new ".Source" suffix
description:
The new suffix is causing a few issues, including
- when exporting an icon, the "Source" part is not removed from the file name, so we get e.g. "org.domain.app.Source-symbolic.svg"
- in the grid, the icon is labelled as "Source"

![Screenshot_from_2019-12-23_21-07-43](/uploads/9f7e385bb157051cea690a2626846996/Screenshot_from_2019-12-23_21-07-43.png)

title: Wider default size
description: Currently, we don't set a default width/height. We should set one

title: Wizard: Don't default to ~/Projects/Icons
description:
This default is from way back, when the intended workflow for this app was different. Now, the idea is that you store the icon in your app's git repo with your source code, so a separate `Icons` folder makes no sense. 

![image](/uploads/5b0bac77c3025020625ceb53408a6c14/image.png)

I'm not sure what a better default would be, maybe just `~/Projects`, since that's where your app repo most likely is?

title: Rename the translation module on D-L
description:
The project was rebranded as App Icon Preview, not Icon tool anymore. 

We need to change the module name of https://l10n.gnome.org/module/icon-tool/ to app-icon-preview

cc @piotrdrag
(Is there some place I can open issues/requests to i18n team directly?)

description: the current screenshot if pretty old. We need something new.

title: Release notes items for 3.36
description:
List of potential items to include in the release notes for 3.36. This can include small or big changes that might be interesting to users or developers. If in doubt, suggest it!

## System

### Power off options

Power off / log out options have been reorganised. There's now a visible suspend option, which is easier to use than the previous UI. Log out is now more visible. We think that it looks nicer, too!

## Settings

### About panel

The about panel has been redesigned ( https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-control-center/merge_requests/590 ). This is mostly an aesthetic change, although changing the host name is a bit clearer, and we might have added info about whether you're using X11 or Wayland...

### Privacy

Much expanded privacy settings - https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-control-center/merge_requests/322 . Builds on Portals/Flatpak to make it possible to control application access to camera, microphone, and so on.

title: Cannot see apps in background nor cannot close them unless pkill
description:
When using apps such as Skype, Slack, qBittorrent, etc, they seem to keep running after their window is closed. 
However, there is no way to definitely close them unless the process is killed. There seems to be no place in the UI to see the apps running in the background such as a "tray area" or in the notifications bar. As a user, how could I see which apps are running in the background without opening a terminal?

title: Unable to log into GNOME Chat
description:
I created an account in [GNOME Chat](https://chat.gnome.org/home) (instead of logging in as my LDAP user, which I didn't know I could use at the time) and I set two-factor authentication (2FA). After logging out and in again, I'm getting "User not found or password incorrect" error message, so I'm unable to pass the authentication screen.

I requested password reset, and it seems I successfully reset my password, but I'm still unable to log in. I noticed that my 2FA token was not requested in any of my login attempts.

"rafaelff" is the username created in GNOME Chat. I used it to join a couple of channels, nothing important.

I kindly request:
1. If possible, to be able to use my LDAP user, even if it means to delete the current user.
2. If not possible to use LDAP, to try to recover my username, removing 2FA, resetting password or whatever is necessary.

title: Gnome Pkexec: Not authorized
description:
Gnome shutdown, restart buttons are not working, neither is the backlight slider.

I ran `journalctl -xe` and I saw this
```
dec 19 15:00:51 archlinux pkexec[2256]: andre: Error executing command as another user: Not authorized [USER=root] [TTY=un>
dec 19 15:00:51 archlinux gsd-power[2256]: Error executing command as another user: Not authorized
dec 19 15:00:51 archlinux gsd-power[2256]: This incident has been reported.
```

A more detailed journalctl log:
```

title: Closed Issue #100 still exists. "Write Error bad file descriptor"
description:
My problem is the same as bug #100 shown below.

"ERROR: Write error on target file

Hi I recently switched to Windows 10 and I got Pan Reader to work easily. It worked fine for a couple of days, now no matter where I try to save the files I get a similar error to the one below.

In the directory I will see files like, 8803297.jpg.ERRORS and the contents of the file is: ERROR: Write error on target file C:\Users\xxxx\AppData\Local\Temp\uuFCXE6Z: Bad file descriptor

I tried rebooting, removing the Pan Reader, I tried repairing Pan Reader. I tried different versions. I have tried versions, pan-0.140-217, pan-0.144-305, pan-0.146-306 all now have the same issue. I thought it might be a hard drive issue, I plugged in a usb key and tried saving there and I get the same error. I disabled McAfee protection and still the same error.

I would love to get this resolved, any ideas?

Walter"

However his solution will not work for me. If i save in a different directory the error file just goes there. I'm using windows 10 and I'm not sure what additional information would be helpful.

Thx Ernic

title: Bear River: help file suggestions, and a question.
description:
I've been playing Bear River recently.  The help file states:

>There is never a disadvantage in moving cards to the Foundations.

However, it can sometimes be advantageous to put off moving a card to an **empty** foundation slot.  For example: suppose the base card is, say, 5.  After some play, you expose the 5 of clubs in the main part of the board.  You can move it to an empty foundation.  But, perhaps, you could move the 4 of clubs onto it instead.  This could be a better move if moving the 4-club would open up an empty right-side "hole" pile.  Moving the 4-club might be hard once the 5 is put on the foundation.  Note that this doesn't apply to the 6 of clubs, since it can be moved to the foundation after the 5.  So, it is always good to move a card onto a non-empty foundation pile.

Also, the help file also says:

>Bear River can be won about one third of the time.

My personal percentage of wins is closer to 40%.  I was curious about this so I recently wrote a simple brute-force perl script to play the game.  It just methodically tries all moves, backing up only when the entire board configuration is repeated.  To my surprise, more than half of the games are winnable, about 57 or 58%.  Some wins take a *lot* of moves, however.

Finally, I'm curious about the origin of this game, and the name "Bear River."  A google search doesn't reveal anything.

Thanks!  
 -Jeff

description: Happens more than what would be statistically feasible, I will pull a black 4 off the top of one of the stacks and the next card is the other black 4 (or red ace or black 10, card is irrelevant).  Happens quite frequently.

description:
- Epiphany version: 3.34.2
 - WebKitGTK version: 2.26.2
 - Operating system: Arch Linux (rolling release)
 - I have a laptop with an i3-4005U and a HD Graphics 4400 GPU.

title: Audit async function calls to ensure safe cancellation
description:
I've done a quick check of async function call use in Epiphany to make sure we are properly cancelling async functions when needed. We often aren't.

The following objects have suspicious async function calls that require further attention: EphyPasswordManager, EphySyncedTabsDialog, EphyPrefsDialog, EphyWindow, EphyShell, EphyActionBarStart, EphyCookiesDialog, EphyBookmarkRow, EphySyncService

Additionally, we need to audit ephy-embed-prefs.c and window-commands.c, which will be a bit tricker because these aren't objects. Looks like there's also refcounting error in user_style_sheet_read_cb() where the only ref on output_stream is dropped immediately after starting an async function call.

error: No such ref 'app/org.gnome.Epiphany.Devel/i386/master' in remote gnome-nightly`.

How to install Epiphany Technology Preview or build Epiphany at *nix 32-bit?

title: Add some feedback when opening a new tab in a "full"/crowded tab-bar
description:
Hi!

Apologies for the bad title. This is what I mean:

Open MANY tabs in epiphany, till the point in which you have more tabs open than those that you can actually see on the tab-bar on screen. By "tab-bar" I mean the one that appears below the headerbar when more than 1 tab is open.

Be sure that the last tab shown in the tab-bar is NOT the last tab you have opened.

Load some website in that last tab shown in the tab-bar, and then middle-click (or keep pressed 'ctrl' and click) on some link in that page.

What happens: a new tab is loaded on the right, not shown in the tab-bar, but the user doesn't get any feedback that it's happening.

Can you please consider to add some kind of feedback, maybe a visual feedback, to notify the user about the new tab being loaded? Maybe a similar effect of the download button, when downloads are over?

I find myself in this very same situation quite often, and so I open the same link many times because I'm not sure that I actually middle-clicked the link or some empty area around it.
Maybe this very same thing is experienced by others.

description:
I'm using Debian's 3.34.1

I have multiple accounts for several websites. The autocomplete dialog showing the multiple login options has never worked really well. In the past it used to be shown in the bottom left corner of the window, that was ankward but at least the user names were shown.

Right now the situation changed a bit. The dialog is much nicer (shadows, rounded corners...) and it's centered on the input elements. So far so good. However the problem is that, as shown in the screenshot there is no way to see the user name as it's rendered completely blank. If I start to type a valid user name in the input field I think it starts to filter them out because it shrinks but still, nothing is shown.![multilogin](/uploads/0e8e7440f8464433374c22c92bbd084a/multilogin.png)

    > Here we are again trying to store 64-bit integers into pointers. It's not safe. :/

title: OpenSSL backend allows TLS 1.1?
description:
In GTlsClientConnectionOpenssl, I see:

```
  /* Only TLS 1.2 or higher */
  options = SSL_OP_NO_TICKET |
            SSL_OP_NO_COMPRESSION |
#ifdef SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_1
            SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_1 |
#endif
            SSL_OP_NO_SSLv2 |
            SSL_OP_NO_SSLv3 |
            SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1;
```

which is really weird, because it appears to disable support for TLS 1.0 unconditionally, but allows TLS 1.1 if SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_1 is defined. I don't think that ever makes sense. If a server doesn't support TLS 1.2, it's *almost certainly* not going to support TLS 1.1 either. If compatibility with very old servers is required, then TLS 1.0 would also be needed. So I strongly suspect nobody is using the OpenSSL backend to connect to a server that supports TLS 1.1 but not TLS 1.0.

My recommendation: disable TLS 1.1 unconditionally. (Unless compatibility with older servers is required, in which case TLS 1.0 would surely be required.)

title: Warning on windows
description:
https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/glib-networking/blob/master/tls/tests/connection.c#L2505

The value is a guint64 and we make a conversion from double to uint64 without casting it.
Although I see more problems. Why are we using uint64 when g_usleep requires a gulong?

title: Audit logging statements
description:
I should audit each use of g_tls_log_debug() to make sure the debug message makes sense. E.g.

```
g_tls_log_debug (tls, "TLS handshake thread failed: claiming op failed");
```

Maybe something about "op in progress" would be more descriptive. Or:

```
g_tls_log_debug (tls, "TLS handshake thread failed: %s", error ? error->message : "no error");
```

Printing "no error" on failure is not great.

title: Reconsider OpenSSL DEFAULT_CIPHER_LIST
description:
Currently we GTlsClientConnectionOpenssl and GTlsServerConnectionOpenssl set the following cipher list with SSL_CTX_set_cipher_list() by default:

```
#define DEFAULT_CIPHER_LIST "HIGH:!DSS:!aNULL@STRENGTH"
```

In Fedora and RHEL, the only allowable default cipher list is "SYSTEM", which is incompatible with all other distros because it's a downstream-specific policy. So thinking ahead to a possible future in which Fedora might build this backend, it'd be better for us to avoid calling SSL_CTX_set_cipher_list() by default (the only way to get a default policy acceptable on Fedora without adding a Fedora-specific patch), so we would only call it when G_TLS_OPENSSL_CIPHER_LIST is specified. Is there any particular rationale behind your use of "HIGH:!DSS:!aNULL@STRENGTH"?

For comparison, I just landed some work in 7ab1578608e53831f3943a24b4b1338646d1da62 so we could drop our downstream patch changing the policy for GnuTLS.

title: GLib-Net:ERROR:../tls/tests/connection.c:249:on_server_close_finish: assertion failed (error == NULL): Error sending data: Broken pipe (g-io-error-quark, 44)
description:
Since merging !69, our CI has been flaky here:

```
Bail out! GLib-Net:ERROR:../tls/tests/connection.c:249:on_server_close_finish: assertion failed (error == NULL): Error sending data: Broken pipe (g-io-error-quark, 44)
**
GLib-Net:ERROR:../tls/tests/connection.c:249:on_server_close_finish: assertion failed (error == NULL): Error sending data: Broken pipe (g-io-error-quark, 44)
```

We really shouldn't be seeing broken pipe errors here. It's extremely difficult to debug because I cannot reproduce it locally, even running the tests 10,000 times. It's also not easy to reproduce on CI because the CI sometimes will pass many times in a row before the next failure. So debugging will need to occur via pushes to the CI, which will be a challenge.

For now, I've commented out the assertion with a FIXME.

title: test_client_auth_pkcs11_connection: assertion failed (error == NULL): Could not import PKCS #11 certificate URI: The requested data were not available.
description:
This is causing sporadic CI failures, so we're going to have to fix it. @pgriffis thinks it's an issue in one of our dependencies.

```
GLib-Net:ERROR:../tls/tests/connection.c:1146:test_client_auth_pkcs11_connection: assertion failed (error == NULL): Could not import PKCS #11 certificate URI: The requested data were not available. (g-tls-error-quark, 2)
Bail out!
```

title: Allow to drag photos to the web browser / file manager
description:
## Please describe the problem you are trying to solve
When uploading photos to a website, it is not uncommon to be able to drag & drop files into the web browser window. Likewise, for exporting a set of photos to a USB key, it's handy to drag and drop those photos to the storage device.

Supporting this behavior would make Shotwell more convenient to pick the photos we want to export and send them to a USB key or a website.

## Other solutions you have considered
Currently, I have to right click a photo I want to export, and chose to show it in the file manager (nautilus). I than can drag and drop the file.

title: Why does Shotwell create (large) jpgs for every RAW file imported in native folder?
description:
I'm using the latest shotwell and tried importing one folder with my CR2 raw files.

While Shotwell completed it smoothly, it created quite large JPG files for every Raw out there. To give an example, one raw file is 45mb, but shotwell's jpg is up to 13mbs (around 6.2mb as embedded - but if those are deleted it creates those extra-large ones of ~13mbs)!

Shouldn't the program create only small thumbnails in .cache folder? Is there a way to block creating these large jpgs?

Basically it would be nice if Shotwell would:

1. Create only small thumbnails upon import in .cache dir.
2. Create big JPGs only if any of these files would be enlarged by user, but also put in .cache dir.

Currently it messes up my folders where I just want to keep my RAW files. So when I want to import RAWs in Darktable it sees duplicate images if Shotwell imported it previously (unless I check "don't import jpg" but then I opt-out for all regular JPG files too!). Not to mention that 72 raw files take additional ~360MBs for embedded JPGs!

title: Tumblr publishing plugin munges API URL
description:
## Shotwell version the issue was seen with

0.30.7 - "Celle"

## The expected behaviour

Photographs are published to Tumblr.

## What was actually happening

> Service https://api.tumblr.com/v2/blog/https://foo.tumblr.com/post returned HTTP status code 404 Not Found

Note the addition of a _second_ `https://`. The correct URL is `https://api.tumblr.com/v2/blog/foo.tumblr.com/post` (i.e. minus the second `https://`), so should be an easy fix.

I believe the offending line to be [line 326 of ./plugins/shotwell-publishing/TumblrPublishing.vala](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/shotwell/blob/a8fe9eafef635f75c20b3ecc78cb712491a36ba8/plugins/shotwell-publishing/TumblrPublishing.vala#L326).

## Steps to reproduce the issue

With Tumblr publishing plugin enabled, select photograph(s) and attempt to publish to Tumblr.

title: Search is trying to be too intelligent (finding related/translated words)
description:
Recently, I tried to search my mails for `plates`, which relates to a bug in a car-related application. There should be only one or two mails matching that keyword. I'm German, and most of my mails are in German, some are english.

Anyway, instead of finding these two mails containing "plates", I find hundreds of unrelated mails, which have unrelated words highlighted including 

* "Platte" (German, means "plate"/"flat surface"/"hard drive" singular)
* "Platz" (German: place, available space)
* "Platzhalter" (German, means "placeholder", with "Platz" highlighted)
* "boilerplate"

and also several mails, where nothing seems to be highlighted at all in the order of arrival.

Can we please make the search be less intelligent, or at least give exact matches much higher sorting priority?

I could understand it finding maybe `plate` (although searching in plural should be a hint that I want to search for the plural), but why is it finding German words that just have the same first 4 letters? Is it trying to correct typos? IMO it shouldn't do that, or it should only do that as a last resort (like Amazon does with "We have no products matching "satl", showing results for "salt").

PS: Searching for `"plates"` (with quotation marks) seems to work, but that isn't obvious at all. If that's the preferred solution, I prefer a checkbox "Exact match" or something like that instead. Or it should be documented in a close way, for example near the search button should be a button "How to search" (or something like that), which lists all the options like quotation marks, "from:" and so on. Still, even if that were implemented, it shouldn't find that many false positives (unrelated words) by default.

Sorry for rambling, this is just showing that I find the current search very frustrating, I don't necessarily have a clear solution. Just searching for simple substring matches would be preferred by me over all this pseudo-intelligence, though.

title: Extended search operators
description:
There have been a number of different requests for extended search operators:

* [ ] Quoting in search operators
* [ ] Support "has:" operator (e.g. "has:attachment" or "has:document", etc)
* [ ] Support date ranges
* [ ] Support searching a specific folder

title: Deleting a thread in inbox leaves replies in sent
description:
Well, the title says it all:

1. Go to inbox.
1. Select one thread with emails received and sent.
1. Delete the thread.
1. Go to Sent.
1. All sent mails in that thread are still there.

The expected behavior would be that all messages in the thread go to trash, no matter if sent or received, just like in Gmail web client.

Environment: Geary 3.34.2 from Flathub, Fedora 31, Gnome 3.34.2, Gmail

    Username : the name part of my address (email name without @icloud.com)
    Password : my account password
Sending
    SMTP Server : smtp.mail.me.com
    Login : Use same login as receiving
```

Actual outcome : I receive the error "Account not created : Check your receiving login and password"

Expected outcome : Adding my iCloud account and view my mails in geary.

I've also tried with my complete address in username, with the same error.

Also I can't apply specific port of SSL information since geary doesn't offer this possibility when creating an account.
Would it be possible to :
-Add a default iCloud account configuration just like we have Gmail, Outlook and Yahoo easy configuration?
-Add more fields (port, SSL) for customized account parameters?

title: Post GMime 3 cleanup
description:
This issue collects tasks that might arise from the GMime upgrade from 2.6 to 3.2 (see !382).

* [ ] Check if [the method to create a message without BCC](htts://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/geary/blob/mainline/src/engine/rfc822/rfc822-message.vala#L378) is still required
* [ ] [Use GMime to parse header values](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/geary/merge_requests/382#note_669699) instead of doing this on our own

title: Reduce network bandwidth usage when on a metered connection
description:
Some of the respondents to the [GNOME metered data survey](https://tecnocode.co.uk/2019/03/21/metered-data-hackfest/) explicitly listed Geary as causing them problems when on metered connections. I just grepped the source code (I don’t use Geary myself, sorry), and it doesn’t appear to check `Gio.NetworkMonitor.get_network_metered()` at all.

It would be good if Geary would disable automatic checks for new mail/etc. when the user’s on a metered connection, and allow them to check manually instead. There could be a GSetting (not exposed in the UI) to control this, perhaps. Other bandwidth saving measures could involve not automatically downloading images when previewing a received e-mail, until the user clicks a button to download them, for example; and caching things more aggressively. These are just suggestions to use as the basis of a discussion.

---

If anyone would like to contribute MRs for the following points, they are each small, independent units of work:

* [ ] Disable background folder check and sync
* [ ] When prefetching new mail, only download parts needed for listing in the conversation list
* [ ] Don't download remote images/videos by default if enabled for a sender/email,
* [ ] Increase the polling interval when IMAP IDLE is not enabled

title: Gmail: Autosaved Drafts Do Not Discard When Email Sent Nor Are Deleteable
description:
If I take more than a certain time to compose an email, Geary saves a draft. That's great. However, once the email is sent, the draft is not discarded. In addition, if I try to manually delete said draft from the Drafts folder, it will consistently reappear. The only solution is to remove it on gmail.com.

Thanks.

title: Add Attachment Reminder functionality
description: Who doesn't know that, emails go out and then the attachment in question is missing. Geay/Mail should help me to send everything that belongs to the message.

title: Double-clicking conversations should open a new window with just the conversation
description:
I love that double-clicking on conversations will open them in a new window now! However, it would be nice if the new window contained *just* the conversation, and not the rest of the UI. 

I actually started working on a branch for this, but GNOME/geary!366 should actually make this a lot easier.

title: Archive conversations shortcut is difficult to remember and perform
description:
In ToT Geary, the "Archive Conversations" shortcut was changed from 'A' to Ctrl + K. 

I agree that the single key shortcuts were problematic, but it was really nice to be able to triage my mail using the old shortcut with just one hand (important for users who do Zero Inbox). 

I find that the new shortcut, Ctrl+K, is difficult to remember (the letter 'K' does not appear in "archive" or "conversations"! I get the emacs reference, though). Also on a US ANSI keyboard layout, it is not possible (or rather, ergonomic) to perform this keyboard shortcut with one hand. 

Can we consider Ctrl+Alt+A for archive instead? This is analogous to macOS Mail, for those who are already used to that.

title: drag and drop emails between accounts
description:
**Bug Summary**
When I drag and drop an email over a folder of the same account, I can move it to said folder, and the UI confirms with an undo option. But if I drop it on a folder of a different account, the UI fails silently (no failure UI statement).

**Your installation**

 * Installation method:              Arch package
 * Desktop environment:              manual (GNOME keyring)
 * Email provider:                   gmail, other providers with TLS

Geary version: 3.34.2  
Geary revision: tags/3.34.2-0-g5b5d6d94  
GTK version: 3.24.13  
GLib version: 2.62.3  
WebKitGTK version: 2.26.2  

Distribution name: Arch  
Distribution release: rolling  
Installation prefix: /usr  


**Steps to reproduce**

Having 2 different accounts :
  - open the inbox view for an account
  - unfold the directory tree for the other account on the first pane
  - drag a message from the subjects view (second pane) to  any directory of the other account

**What happened?**
The UI fails silently. There are no stderr logs either.

**What did you expect to happen?**

I suppose the UI could either warn, or implement the feature ?

My proposition would be, warn and tell users to define an archive directory if they want to move the messages in another storage. And implement user defined archive directory (see #112 - as a plugin?).

**Relevant logs and/or screenshots**

Geary Inspector doesn't output anything after repeating steps. It doesn't crash.

What about removing the "d" shortcut completely, and make the "s" to toggle that feature?

title: Remove C1 support?
description:
I added C1 support in [bug 730154](https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=730154), to address the request of _one_ person.

Now I think it was a mistake.

xterm deliberately doesn't support it in UTF-8. Which, in turn, guarantees that hardly any app emits it.

C1 is not without problems:

Supporting it is more cumbersome than I had hoped for. See e.g. 05c680acb and 181752d26. 

Its support encourages others to use it, resulting in problems like [Alacritty 3105](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/3105).

Filtering out potentially dangerous characters (before printing untrusted data) becomes more complex, and makes it necessary to go into the locale business. Let alone security starts relying on the locale being set correctly; if the locale is misconfigured then there's a chance that a "dangerous" character (starting an escape sequence) can make it through to the terminal from an untrusted source. See [mpg123 267](https://sourceforge.net/p/mpg123/bugs/267/).

Shall we change our minds and remove C1 support?

I can only move the window back via keyboard shortcut as the title bar is hidden at this point. Then I need to resize the window so that both the top and bottom of it fit within the maximum vertical dimension.

title: Initial child frequently times out
description:
When starting GNOME Terminal while it is not running, it frequently fails to launch its first child process. The terminal stays black and eventually reports that "there was an error creating the child process for this terminal" and "operation timed out". The child is stuck in `grantpt`, specifically it is deadlocked in `__nss_database_lookup2`. I believe we're seeing [a Glibc bug](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24941) which is triggered when NSS is in use in another thread when a `fork` happens. Looking with GDB, I find libatspi using libdbus using NSS from the main thread. However, the `fork` seems to happen in the gdbus thread. Maybe we can work around this problem by having the main thread do the fork? GNOME Terminal 3.34.2
VTE 0.58.3
Glibc 2.30
Arch Linux

title: gnome-terminal window launched with any DISPLAY value is always displayed on display 0
description:
I have a problem with gnome-terminal. If I set the DISPLAY environment variable, or start gnome-terminal with "--display" switch, or directly from a vnc session on a different display, the newly opened gnome-terminal window is always displayed on 0.
Inside the newly opened gnome-terminal window, the DISPLAY variable has the correct value, but it is always only visible on display 0.
I even have a vnc startup script that shoud open gnome terminal on display 21, and there is no instance of gnome terminal running when this gets executed, but the result is gnome-terminal opening on display 0.

expected result would be gnome-terminal opening on display that is set.

gnome-terminal-3.30.3
Os: gentoo
xorg-server-1.20.5  (wayland is not enabled)
I don't see any log entries in journal, the terminal output is:

title: Add number of tab to tab title, that used in the Alt+<number> shortcut
description:
When number of tabs >4 it is hard to identify correct `Alt+<number>` combination for specific page.

This feature request intersects with #70, but I still considered it, as different request because numbers are changed when you rearrange tabs.

title: [Feature Request] Ability to summon/hide terminal window
description:
Gnome terminal is solid but I would really like to be able to have it hide/summon based on a key combo like "ctrl+spacebar". 

There are terminal applications out there that can do that, but I'd like to stick with just one terminal rather than having to manage having multiple kinds. 

One problem with using the other ones also is that they generally have a locked height. I use the terminal emulator [[Hyper]](https://hyper.is/) on my other linux/mac/windows machines and it has a plugin for summoning the window, and what's nice is that while it has a default height similar to other summoned terminals, it is still able to be resized, which makes it much more flexible. I unfortunately can't use Hyper on my current homemedia server because it has some kind of conflict with the Nextcloud server installation so I'm using the default. And gnome terminal is a pretty good default! I just miss having the ability to summon. 

Thank you.

title: Use the system fixed width font option is gone
description:
Hi guys,

I'm using Ubuntu 19.10 with GNOME Terminal 3.34.2 and I'm not sure whether this is the right place to ask this question, so please advise.

I want to set "Monaco" as default font for terminal in preferences, however option *Use the system fixed width* font is gone and I can't find solution.

Any ideas?

title: Follow GNOME's Night Light setting to trigger Night Mode
description:
GNOME Shell has a “Night Light” feature which changes the display's colour temperature following a schedule (by default, local sunrise/sunset times). GNOME Builder monitors whether Night Light is active (D-Bus name `org.gnome.SettingsDaemon.Color`, path `/org/gnome/SettingsDaemon/Color`, interface `org.gnome.SettingsDaemon.Color`, property `NightLightActive`, type `b`oolean) and switches itself to a dark theme.

I find myself wishing my terminal windows could do the same.

title: Gnome terminal shortcuts do not respect current layout
description:
I don't know if this happens in any other gnome applications but the gnome terminal doesn't respect the current keyboard layout for shortcuts. But does respect it when typing into the window.

I noticed this as the shortcut for exiting telnet `^]` (`ctl+]`) is on one of my keyboard layouts the same as `ctl++` or increase text size.

The same is true when setting keyboard shortucts.

```
Installed Packages
Name         : gnome-terminal
Version      : 3.32.2
Release      : 2.fc30
Architecture : x86_64
Size         : 7.3 M
Source       : gnome-terminal-3.32.2-2.fc30.src.rpm
Repository   : @System
From repo    : updates
```

title: Cannot add songs from DAAP/dlna to a playlist
description:
I'm using Rhythmbox 3.4.3 and have connected to a Raspberry Pi running both dlna and daap. I can easily browse and play music* but I can't add those songs to a playlist.

*I can play but still experience these bugs #1406 #447 #144

title: rhythmbox-3.4.3: no way to open preferences from Gnome 3.32
description:
Since Gnome 3.32 removed application menus I see no way to open rhythmbox preferences

Thanks for your help

title: pulseaudio sink is not released
description:
When the first song start to play, rhythmbox allocates a pulseaudio sink, but it never releases it.

It is not a problem for audio playback itself, but it breaks e. g. amplifier power control. Amplifier does not power off when playback is stopped. It is turned on until rhythmbox quits. Other applications release the client device either immediately or after a small delay.

How to reproduce:

```pactl subscribe```
Watch for sink-input, as it represents active playback.

When application starts:
```Event 'new' on client #215
Event 'change' on client #215
```

When first song starts to play:
```Event 'new' on client #216
Event 'change' on client #216
Event 'remove' on client #216
Event 'new' on client #217
Event 'change' on client #217
Event 'change' on sink #0
Event 'change' on source #0
Event 'new' on sink-input #169
Event 'remove' on sink-input #169
Event 'new' on sink-input #170
Event 'change' on sink-input #170
Event 'change' on sink #0
Event 'change' on sink-input #170
Event 'change' on sink-input #170
```

When song stops to play:
No event.

When next song starts to play:
```Event 'change' on sink-input #170
Event 'change' on sink-input #170
```

When next song stops to play:
No event.

When rhythmbox quits:
```Event 'change' on sink #0
Event 'remove' on sink-input #170
Event 'remove' on client #215
Event 'remove' on client #217
Event 'change' on sink #0
Event 'change' on source #0
```

title: Date format on gdm's lock screen is wrong in German locale
description:
With the German locale, the date on gdm's lock screen reads (today's example): "Donnerstag, Dezember 19". This is a mix of German and English notation. The correct German notation should be: "Donnerstag, 19. Dezember".
This is Ubuntu 18.4., GNOME 3.28.2

title: gdm hangs on fedora 31
description:
Hi guys,

Im having issues with gdm(gdm-3-34.1) on fedora 31 workstation. Im not able to use gdm since it hangs just before login promt and hangs the system. Im not able to get any virtual consoles. Sometimes i can login and see the desktop and then the system hangs. I did not have this issue on any previous fedora release. 

My Workstation hardware:

Motherboard : GA-7PESH2 (rev. 1.0)

CPU: 2 x Intel Xeon E5 2690v2

RAM: 64Gb ECC

GPU: MSI Radeon 5700 XT Evoke

Here are some logs:

title: Add a config option to set the background image
description:
There currently does not seem to be a way anymore to change the GDM noise.png background image at all, every method that can be found online no longer works.

A way to set the GDM background through a configuration file, or a configuration override would be great!

title: Add a Session key to custom.conf
description:
Similar to https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gdm/issues/535, but this is used always.
You can still select a session to override this in the session chooser though.
It's just that user selection **won't** persist, and this preference is used.

title: Show logged in users
description: I think that it would be nice if GDM could display what user accounts are logged in. Currently, there is no indication of this.

title: Support facial recognition via Howdy
description:
As devices with Windows Hello are getting more popular, Howdy is also getting some attention on Linux desktops as an alternative authentication method. It is relatively easy to setup, which makes its userbase quite wide. 

Would it be possible to support it (well, its PAM) as an alternative authentication method in GDM as well?

title: Totem giant controls disable
description:
Using Unbuntu 14.04 and Totem (Videos 3.10.1)
When viewing a video with totem, smt when pressing control, like pause or start or advance, their giant images will fill up half the screen. To make them go, I have to restart the video, always a hassle;(
Why and how do they appear? How can I disable them?

title: Warnings when navigating menu in DVD
description:
```

title: Missing plugin: gstreamer|1.0|totem|DVD subpicture decoder
description:
OS: Fedora; Component: totem.x86_64 1:3.34.1-1.fc31 @anaconda

* Missing plugin: gstreamer|1.0|totem|DVD subpicture decoder
* Reported at https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=855613 as component gstreamer.

```
$ dnf list installed gstreamer1-plugins-base gstreamer1-plugins-good ffmpeg libdvdcss|sed '1d'

gstreamer1-plugins-good.x86_64      1.16.1-2.fc31        @anaconda
libdvdcss.x86_64                    1.4.2-2.fc31         @@commandline
```
Under Gnome on Wayland:

```
$ totem
[...]

(totem:6026): Gtk-WARNING **: 10:04:44.727: Drawing a gadget with negative dimensions. Did you forget to allocate a size? (node slider owner GtkScale)

title: Name of Totem should appear in the applet of KDE Plasma that indicates which app is suppressing the power management
description:
This issue was already reported to KDE devs
https://bugs.kde.org/show_bug.cgi?id=409461

KDE Plasma desktop environment has a applet in systray that indicates which app is suppressing the power management. The screenshot below shows such applet while VLC Player plays a video.
![vlc](/uploads/5d4ba8ed29752ada37ebf94cefb77b0b/vlc.png)

However, as we can see in the screenshot below,  Totem name does not appear in such applet when it suppresses the power management. 

![totem](/uploads/6dec9dc3c3398961f74340cfd86d6915/totem.png)

title: Allows but fails to rip mixed CDs
description:
See #159 

When a mixed CD is inserted, trying to create an image from it results in a big warning at the end, saying a large portion of the disc couldn't be read. Until udisks has support for creating images of mixed CDs, creating images of them should be disabled.

![audio-track-errors](/uploads/dfe2e2a4cfecb5430e58bd9a68852030/audio-track-errors.png)

description:

title: GIMP Git master segfaults on start
description:
GIMP version: Git master

Operating System: Debian Sid

Package: Built from source

# Description of the bug

GIMP segfaults when it is started, without showing any UI except for the crash debug dialog.
I'm not sure if this is a duplicate of e.g. #4296 - the trace there seems to be different.

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? Always

Reproduction steps:

1. Start GIMP
2. Get message "gimp-2.99: fatal error: Segmentation fault" in the terminal window
3. GIMP Crash Debug dialog appears

…

Expected result: GIMP runs

Actual result: GIMP segfaults

title: Titlebar-less view for Linux
description:
Operating System: Linux

# Description of the feature 

Just as Mozilla did in Firefox, it would be really good to have an option to integrate the title bar into the top bar, in order to save some vertical space (which is even more important if you work on a non-FHD laptop such older Thinkpads).

I would like to especially see it in GNOME (1. because that is what I use and 2. because GIMP is under the GNOME umbrella), but maybe it could be made into a more portable solution that has options for all DEs with top bars (be it Mac, Gnome, Xfce...). Like Mozilla did, it could even start to roll out when just some DEs are supported, with the warning that it may not work on all systems.

title: Crash with Fatel Error
description:
GIMP Version:

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System:

Package: [flatpak? Installer from gimp.org? If another installer, tell us where from]

# Issue Description

Please provide a general description of the issue.

# Performance Log

Please record a performance log demonstrating the issue, and attach it to the report.
See

  https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gimp/blob/master/devel-docs/performance-logs/performance-logs.md

for more information.

# Performance Log Description

Please describe in detail the actions performed in the performance log.
If you added empty event markers to the log, please provide a description for them here.
If you recorded a screencast while recording the log, please attach it here.

# Additional Information

If there is any additional information, please provide it here.

title: Porting histogram-export to Python 3 (with patch)
description:
Apply this patch to main branch:
 [0001-Port-histogram-export-plugin-to-python-3.patch](/uploads/8907b1aa7ef666f9f895703f48176f8c/0001-Port-histogram-export-plugin-to-python-3.patch)

@Jehan, I managed to get the configuration parameters saved between invocations by using config begin_run and end_run.  
Although it doesn't work for the "file" field - I didn't manage that.

I hope I am using the methods correctly.

I had trouble implementing the UI for file and "output_format" parameters.
I'd be glad to know if there an easier way to do that, but what I did mostly works, and I'm pretty pleased with the UI itself.

title: Pango dropped support for Bitmap fonts with version 1.44 (was: Bitmap fonts are broken)
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Operating System: Linux

Package: manjaro repository

# Description of the bug
All bitmap fonts look (and work) like they are missing all characters. Watch the screenshots:
![tf](/uploads/fc9f15e75c957499294862dac6b27c73/tf.png)

![font_list](/uploads/15f0d00caca35aed073861d763d12f24/font_list.png)

It was ok few months ago.

title: Animation>Optimize (for GIF) shifts horizontal alignment of frames to the wrong side
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14 flatpak Linux

# Description of the bug

When optimizing an image Gimp seems to get offsets wrong

# Reproduction

Reproduction steps:

1. Load sample image (Sample-unoptimized.gif)
2. Run Filters>Animation>Optimize (for GIF) and export
3. Play the animation in a browser

…

Expected result:

The original animation plays like this:

![Sample-unoptimized](/uploads/8ee6d71c86ebcc6d213d1cf550cd7f55/Sample-unoptimized.gif)

The optimized animation plays like this:

![Sample-reoptimized210](/uploads/42638d989995f86b66296e18b66306e9/Sample-reoptimized210.gif) 

# Additional information

The same image is optimized correctly by Gimp 2.8:

![Sample-reoptimized208](/uploads/ad88d98001806b3db006d516f6bcf7ef/Sample-reoptimized208.gif)

title: Make a GIMP lite version
description:
You rock! You are much much deeply appreciated! 

Now, about GIMP lite. As you know, firing up GIMP to do a 30 second touch up on a pic is about the same as tooling down to the local 7-Eleven in a 747.

Keep on keeping on! Thanks much!

title: Windows 10 1909, broke gimp completely.
description: On a fresh install of Windows 10 1909, GIMP 2.10.14 does nothing what so ever.  I'd run gimp as admin nothing happens, double click icon, nothing happens.  I completely removed all security from Windows 10 1909 and tried to run gimp still nothing.  Seems Microsofts new update has been nothing but botched.  Please see what you can do about this.  I enjoy using this program...

title: Allow to temporarily switch the UI language in gimp
description: Please consider adding pop up cloud small window after short while, when stopping cursor over function with translated name of function to english. I think it would really help at first steps when someone using gimp in other language than english. Most tutorials for gimp is in english and translators not always giving best clue what function it is, especially when version of gimp in tutorial is so much different for beginner. If that is too much then i think simple add in some menu kinda like "gimp translator" just write name of function or word You want to know how it is in english or other language gimp. Some time ago i had also this challenge and ended up reinstalling gimp from my language to english version, but that could be not for all.

title: Index Mode should add paintbrush color if new and space in palette exists
description:
Operating System: (if feature is platform specific)
any
# Description of the feature

Index mode should add paintbrush color if not already present and space in palette exists

Please describe your feature with details.

It would be nice if when working in indexed mode, changing the foreground/background color and then using that color in the image would (optionally? require user verification?) add that color to the indexed mode palette if it is not there already and if the palette is not full.

From pippin:

What you are suggesting; to add the directly chosen color of the paintbrush/pencil tool, if there is empty slots in the palette would not conflict with this and be a nice addition... It would have to be only the directly selected foreground color though and not its antialiased results with various background pixels which would be ohter colors implicity attempted to be inserted. Since the more complete port to babl/GEGL with 2.10 GIMP is no longer special casing INDEXED/GRAYSCALE mode from RGB. This meant as new features we gained anti-aliasing for the paintbrush in indexed mode, ability to blur and do other filters; as well as
anti-aliased results when merging down layers/text-layers - this would quickly exhaust the free slots in the palette if all attempted to be used colors were added (checking if the current foreground color is
part of the palette before starting a new stroke is also a more feasible code change than always dynamically growin the palette).

Add screenshots, design images or other files which would help for
understanding the feature or for implementation.
Also add links when needed, for instance for implementation standards
or other relevant resources.

# Use cases

If not obvious, explain the use cases or problems to solve.

Currently, attempting to paint into an image in indexed mode using a new color paints black.

title: Print Dialog Window - "Image Settings" Tab - Preview window setting
description:
GIMP version:

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System: [Windows? macOS? Linux?] Windows 7 Home Premium

Package: [flatpak? Installer from gimp.org? If another installer, tell us where from] Installed from gimp.org

# Description of the bug: 
Preview window image position setting will not retain position for printing, even after clicking the "Apply" button. Even after making various printer setting changes (so that the "Apply" button becomes active), and then readjusting the image position in the Preview window screen, then clicking the "Apply" button, the image prints in an earlier position setting and won't retain the new setting.

Please describe your issue with details.
Add screenshot or other files if needed.

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? [Always / Randomly / Happened only once ] **Always**

Reproduction steps:

1.Described above.
2.
3.

…

Expected result: Image should print in the new position setting as set in the Preview window.

Actual result: Image position **always** prints from an earlier setting (upper left hand corner) which is were I positioned an earlier image position from an earlier session (a couple weeks ago).

See attachments:

![2._Print_result](/uploads/413eaaebeb079b8610222972af08f846/2._Print_result.png)

![1._CAPTURE_-_Preview_position_setting_window](/uploads/7e63a971cfc5de492adc36f83e597ceb/1._CAPTURE_-_Preview_position_setting_window.png)

Thanks!

title: Tile read error when loading many images
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System: Windows 10 64-bit

Package: Installer from gimp.org

# Description of the bug

After having loaded many image Full-HD files I noticed an error popup saying "**unable to read tile data from swap: No error (0/148651 bytes read)**". Switching images, I noticed that some images are corrupted.

**Pop-Up:**

![Error Pop-Up](/uploads/215fd35d0146dcdbaacea7422c301fe6/GIMP-Tile-Read-Error.jpg)

**Corrupted Image:**

![Corrupted Image](/uploads/2918f7be8981292c99ab46cefeb8f655/GIMP-Tile-Error.jpg)

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? I did not try yet.

Expected result: Images are either load OK, or there should be an error message when loading the images.

Actual result: Images seem to be loaded OK, but can't be displayed correctly later.

# Additional information

If you have a backtrace for a crash or a warning, paste it here.

title: Drive list in dialogs shows drives in reverse sorting order
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Operating System: Windows 7

Every Gimp dialog which regards access to the drives on my computer shows a list of this drives. So far, so good. But, for example,  why is the C drive at the bottom and the X drive on top of that list? Since there are no more floppy drives, I mounted two frequently used folders from my NAS as A and B drive to keep them on top of a larger drive list. Recently I updated to Gimp 2.10.14. The drive list turns upside down and I have to scroll a lot to get to the bottom of the drive list to reach the A or B drive. That is very arduous. And I found no way to change that sorting order...

title: Gimp 2.10 will not start on windows 10 after several uninstall/reinstalls
description:
So, yesterday I was performing a batch of gimpressionist image manipulations on my new setup (threadripper/gtx1080). I wanted to experiment with the overclocking, it actually seemed to slow the batch operation down by 2 seconds per image, so I restored the bios to default and went about my way... until I tried to start gimp again. It doesn't do anything now, no background processes even try to open in task manager. I tried using the command-line interface to get an error log or something, anything to happen, nothing, not even the -h help option. Uninstalled, deleted all folders, all registry instances I could, reinstalled (several, several times), I'm seriously about to just pay for photoshop. All other programs and hardware are working normally.

If anyone has any ideas, I'm kinda fascinated as to what the hell is going on. Thanks!

title: Slightly misleading documentation for the Sample Points
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Operating System: Online documentation 

# Description of the bug

The doc on sample points at https://docs.gimp.org/2.10/en/gimp-sample-point-dialog.html
doesn't mention that the operations to move/delete sample points require the Color picker tools to be active. Since it says "*You can delete a sample point, as you do with guides, by click-and-dragging it up to a rule*", users expect it to work the same way, with the Move tool.

# Reproduction

1. Create a sample point
2. Activate the Move tool
3. Click on a sample point and drag to move it
…

Expected result:

* The sample point moves

Actual result:

* A layer moves

title: GIMP PNG Export is not lossless due to hidden degradation, alpha channel goes monochrome
description:
When I export to PNG from an existing PNG it changes the alpha channel from 8 bits to 1 bit. There's no obvious option to control this.

# ATOMIC BLAST FROM THE PAST

1 bit alpha is usually for MSIE 6 compatibility mode from back in the day (most people thought that MSIE 6 only supported transparency with GIF but it actually didn't support 8 bit alpha channel so PNG would work fine with 1 bit).

Export has a list of pixel formats but they're all just bpp * channel/s. There's way more combination possible with PNG than it's showing.

title: Add support for layers in OpenEXR
description:
# Description of the feature

OpenEXR supports layers. The Gimp EXR plugin does only load the first one. Please add support to open all layers.
This is a file with three layers.
[art021.zip](/uploads/25315126ba2995244d415d5e4d1d6607/art021.zip)

And here is an video how they are used in Blender and Affinity Photo:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pjpOOrdpq2E&feature=emb_logo

title: Open embedding images in metadata in JPEGs as layers
description:
# Description of the feature

It is possible to save embedding images as metadata in JPEGs. It would be nice to have an option in the JPEG loader to open all embedded images as layers.

I have different examples here:

1. An photo from an "Samsung Galaxy S10 Plus". It contains next to the main image with applied filter three embedded images. Two photos from the two cameras with different lenses and a depth map.
I used this exiftool command to get the two images from the cameras:

>  exiftool -embeddedImage -a -b -W %d%f%c.%s test.jpg

And this to get the depth map (The data is a raw 1-byte 1008 x 476 array.):

> exiftool -EmbeddedImage -b test.jpg > output.data

Here I blogged about it:
https://dablogter.blogspot.com/2019/12/depth-map-from-gallaxy-s10-photos.html

![Samsung_Galaxy_S10_Plus](/uploads/5913e424002820ae97db3f44781b544a/Samsung_Galaxy_S10_Plus.jpg)
Please describe your feature with details.

2. An image from the Google Cardboard Camera App. It contains two images for stereoscopic view in VR Headsets:
![IMG_20170616_123602.vr](/uploads/5aac1983a67db7adf8f122c69ab367a0/IMG_20170616_123602.vr.jpg)

title: Negative values for line spacing, letter spacing, etc are not saved correctly
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System: Windows, Linux

Package: Linux: Flatpak, Windows: Installer from gimp.org

# Description of the bug

If you set text settings like line spacing or letter spacing to a negative number, then this value will not be saved correctly. Even though the text is being displayed as intended when loading the file back in, the respective options will be reset to zero, which you can see when selecting the text. Editing the text will also update the visuals according to the settings, which are now zero.  
However, if you load a similar file created and saved in version 2.10.12, the settings will load correctly, indicating the bug is part of the saving routine of GIMP 2.10.14.  
Furthermore, when loading a file with negative letter spacing created in version 2.10.14 into GIMP 2.10.12, it will display the following error:
![GIMP-Err](/uploads/12b954be0767cd5d19c2ce99c7c6f66d/GIMP-Err.PNG)

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? Yes, Always

Reproduction steps:

1. Create a file with a text layer and some text, and set it's letter spacing (or a similar setting) to a negative number
2. Save the file and close GIMP.
3. Open the file again.

Expected result: The file should look like before and the negative values for letter spacing, etc should be loaded back in.

Actual result: Due to the values not being saved correctly, they will reset to zero. Furthermore, if you load the file into GIMP 2.10.12 you will get an error (see above).

# Additional information

If you have a backtrace for a crash or a warning, paste it here.

title: Gimp cannot open images on smartphone with Android
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Operating System: Linux Elementary OS 5.1 Hera

Package: flatpak

# Description of the bug

Basically it reads the image, but when trying to open it, it says "no file or directory" with a source point (e.g. /mnt/smartphone/")

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? Always

Reproduction steps:

1. Connect Smartphone with file support (in my case Android 9, Redmi Note 7)
2. Open the camera directory on the phone in Gimp.
3. List all of the images. 
4. Clicking open will result in "no file or directory" with a full path to the file, but without any specific reason, since the file is there!

If you copy the file from the file manager to the desktop and open it from there, Gimp will load it normally.

I would also take the opportunity to suggest that image thumbnails should be visible by default. It's next to impossible to know which image to open based on the name alone. And it's very time consuming to click on the preview button every single time you want to check.

…

Expected result: Opened image

Actual result: abandon.

title: Port python-eval plugin to python 3
description:
Apply the following patch to master.

[0001-Port-python-eval.py-plugin-to-python-3.patch](/uploads/0e14bd90f9a7546118b9aebac999740a/0001-Port-python-eval.py-plugin-to-python-3.patch)

To test that this works, run gimp in batch mode:
> % gimp2.99 -i -b -

And then type:

> (python-fu-eval "print (2)")

title: Porting pygimp plugins to python 3
description:
@Jehan, I have a lot of questions and I thought an issue might be a good place to discuss them.

So lets start with just these two:

1) Is there currently no implementation for python to generate an automatic ui like script-fu or the old pygimp?

2) I have gone over some of the other plugins.
* Do we need to port benchmark-foreground-extract.py? This looks like a very specific development tool that shouldn't be packaged with gimp.
* It seems that clothify.py is already implemented as a script-fu - can we just delete it?

title: Color-to-alpha unnecessarily grayed out for grayscale imaged
description:
With Image|Mode|Grayscale, the menu entry Layer|Transparency|Color-to-alpha... is grayed out.
The feature does make sense for grayscale and one can even see that it works:
* open two grayscale images with alpha channel
* on first image
** set to Image|Mode|RGB
** apply Layer|Transparency|Color-to-alpha...
** set to Image|Mode|Grayscale
* on second image
** apply Filters|Repeat "Color to alpha"

=> the feature color-to-alpha can clearly be repeat-applied to a grayscale image without converting it to RGB, why not enable the menu item directly?

title: Make color selection dialog box shortcut assignable
description:
# Description of the feature

Make the color selection dialog box shortcut assignable.

# Use cases

Quickly change the foreground color when doing digital painting.

either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code

Operating System: Windows 7 Ultimate x64 SP1

Package: Installer from gimp.org

# Description of the bug

GIMP crashes on startup. A window with an unhandled exception appears: if I click OK, the program closes, otherwise I can work normally.

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? Always on my PC

1. Simply execute GIMP, both with the shortcut or from console.

title: Configuration sse2 sse4.1 tests suppressed system CFLAGS resulting in compilation fail.
description:
GIMP version: 2.10, 2.99

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System: All

Package: Sourcecode

# Description of the bug

During configuration tests if cpu supports sse2 and sse4.1 within `configure.ac` file
the system env variable CFLAGS parameters are suppressed by addition of `-msse2` and `-msse4.1`
that results in the GIMP will be compiled with their support but the compilation process
will be failed due to system env CFLAGS could have `sse2` and `sse4.1` disabled [1].

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? Always

Reproduction steps:

1. Setup system env CFLAGS with `-mno-sse2` or/and `-mno-sse4.1`
2. Run configuration process and notice that SSE2 ans SSE4.1 tests are passed
* `COMPILE_SSE2_INTRINISICS =1`
* `COMPILE_SSE4_1_INTRINISICS =1`
3. Run compilation
4. Notice that compilation is failed.

[1] https://bugs.gentoo.org/702554

…

Expected result: System value of CFLAGS shouldn't be overwritten during configuration phase.
Compilation shouldn't be failed

Actual result: Compilation process is failed due to suppressed system CFLAGS values during configuration phase.

# Additional information
The issue could be resolved by replacing within `conficuration.ac` from  
`CFLAGS="$intrinsics_save_CFLAGS $SSE2_EXTRA_CFLAGS"`  
`CFLAGS="$intrinsics_save_CFLAGS $SSE4_1_EXTRA_CFLAGS"`  

to  
`CFLAGS="$SSE2_EXTRA_CFLAGS $intrinsics_save_CFLAGS"`  
`CFLAGS="$SSE4_1_EXTRA_CFLAGS $intrinsics_save_CFLAGS"`

title: "Colors/*" menu items are grouped under "Filters" in Keyboard Shortcuts preferences
description:
# Description of the feature

Some users [1] of **GIMP 2.10** are confused by grouping of main menu "Color" items under "Filter" within "Keyboard shortcut" preferences. Due to this fact the users could assume that it isn't possible to setup shortcuts for "Color" menu items.

As I see the current situation:

* Within "Keyboard shortcut" preferences grouping is by the function names.
* "Color" main menu is just group for quick access while actions are actually filters.


Request:  
The grouping within "Keyboard shortcut" preferences should be matched to main menu of GIMP.

[1] https://bugs.gentoo.org/699460

title: Porting colorxhtml.py to python 3 - with patch
description:
@Jehan, here is my first attempt of converting a python plugin to python 3.

I removed the option of using the source code of the plugin itself as the characters to use.
Partly because of laziness, and partly because this seems like an arbitrary option to include.

I don't like the fact that the plugin exports to xhtml, when it really is just html.
But I am not sure whether two save plugins can use the same extension.

This is a pretty wacky plugin, and its description is not very clear. This seems to me to be
a form of ascii art. The description "Colored HTML Text" is rather cryptic, though I cant think
of a better one.

Apply the following patch to the master branch.
[0001-Port-pygimp-colorxhtml-plugin-to-python-3.patch](/uploads/bad7ba23e447b3867fcc648e359b236f/0001-Port-pygimp-colorxhtml-plugin-to-python-3.patch)

title: Grid disappears in Fullscreen
description:
GIMP version:
2.10.14

Operating System: Linux Mint Cinnamon 19.2 64bit

Package: flatpack

# Description of the bug

Grid disappears on full screen

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? Always

Reproduction steps:
1.  Open an image
2.  enable Grid (View -> Show Grid)
3.  Toggle Full screen (F11)


Expected result:

Gimp should switch to full screen and the grid should stay


Actual result:

Gimp switches to full screen but Grid disappears (Checkbox in View stays checked)
If you go back to windowed mode it restores the last state the Grid was in

## Workaround:
Toggle the Grid in full screen two times and its back

title: When using color to fade dynamics and gradient with transparency, brush does not have transparency
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.12, 2.10.14

Operating System: Linux

Package: flatpak, apt

# Description of the bug

When using color fade dynamics with a Paintbrush and choosing a gradient with alpha (ex FG To Transparency), the brush doesn't get any transparency.

# Reproduction

Always

Reproduction steps:

1. Create a new layer fill type Transparency.
2. Create a custom dynamics and choose Color to Fade
3. Select Paintbrush tool
4. In Dynamic Options set gradient to FG To Transparency
5. Set fade length to 800
6. Set repeat to none
7. Draw with the Paintbrush

Expected result: The brush stroke fades in and out

Actual result: The brush stroke has no transparency

# Additional information

The bug doesn't seem to be present in version 2.10.8.

title: Text copy & paste without format
description:
GIMP version:

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System: [Windows? macOS? Linux?]

Package: [flatpak? Installer from gimp.org? If another installer, tell us where from]

# Description of the bug
In older versions of GIMP I edited my Youtubethumbs by writing a title once and copy it to another layer with another color. In version 2.10 I copy the text and when I paste it the whole format including the color is pasted. This is not what I wanted. Now I have to retype the text or recolor it everytime this doubles my work.


# Reproduction

Always

Reproduction steps:

1. write a textlayer in a color
2. copy the layer and recolor it
3. copy the text of the first layer
4. paste the text into the second layer
5. the color changes with the text

…

Expected result:
only the text should be pasted

Actual result:
the completely formated text is pasted including colors

title: Bug/Feature: Reduce minimum frame delay? (suspect: /plug-ins/common/file-gif-save.c)
description:
**GIMP version:** tested in 2.8.22 and 2.10.14

**Operating System:** Windows (relevant?)

**Package:** Installer, GIMP.org


**Bug Details:**
When saving/exporting a .gif file with a 10ms frame-delay, the delay renders as if 100ms, but yet GIMP reports a "10ms" delay.

**Is the bug reproducible?** Very, can always reproduce


**Reproduction steps:**

1. Create an animation using 10ms delay, with at least more than 50 frames.
2. Export the animation
3. Open the animation in any other renderer and shake your head in disdain.
(Note: Step 3 has optional parts, other reactions are acceptable too.)


**Expected result:** a 60-frame animation that has a 10ms delay should complete in 0.6 seconds.

**Actual result:** The 60-frame animation reports a 10ms delay, but completes in 6 seconds.

Sample animation (Intended as my Discord avatar, while I have Nitro) is attached.

![O-PADORU_3_](/uploads/b00e3e2b482bd5d3c80a72db546091d6/O-PADORU_3_.gif)


**EDIT # 1:** Adding edit list, fixing formatting for ease-of-reading.

**EDIT # 2:** Well, line breaks help a bunch.
