title: Build seamless RAW loading from Darktable on macOS
description:
Operating System: macOS Mojave 10.14.6

# Description of the feature

When using GIMP for loading a RAW file, Darktable is suggested as a loader. After installing Darktable on macOS and opening a RAW file, it seems that nothing happens. But in fact, Darktable is launched as a separate program in the background, and only when closing it does GIMP load the picture. Opening multiple RAW files launches multiple instances of Darktable.

I have been closing the one or many instances of Darktable manually to return focus to GIMP. I would like Darktable to exit after loading the RAW file so it looks like GIMP is able to load RAW files directly.

# screenshots

The following screenshots explain the problem, resized to maintain privacy.

I open a RAW file in GIMP and see nothing:

![1](/uploads/7b0639328054757834a02f494e81e11f/1.png)

The bottom bar shows "Opening /path/to/file`:

![2](/uploads/0917582dd5c93a18b8b28aa1d5fab98f/2.png)

Darktable launches in the background and opens the image:

![3](/uploads/cb21b31d0060c531aaf1ed40ccf0e638/3.png)

When I close the Darktable application, GIMP loads the image:

![4](/uploads/ee5a5a8354d6c080508cefbb6c12b477/4.png)

# references

Original Q&A here, which suggested filing an issue at Darktable:

https://graphicdesign.stackexchange.com/questions/131647/how-to-make-darktable-work-in-gimp/131648?noredirect=1#comment196034_131648

and the issue on Darktable suggested filing it here:

https://github.com/darktable-org/darktable/issues/3691#issuecomment-562920832

title: Gimp assertion failure
description:
```
(gimp:7269): GLib-GObject-WARNING **: g_object_set_is_valid_property: object class 'GeglConfig' has no property named 'cache-size'

(gimp:7269): Gimp-Widgets-CRITICAL **: gimp_device_info_set_device: assertion '(info->device == NULL && GDK_IS_DEVICE (device)) || (GDK_IS_DEVICE (info->device) && device == NULL)' failed

(print:7930): Gtk-WARNING **: Error launching preview Failed to execute child process “evince” (No such file or directory)
libGL error: unable to load driver: nouveau_dri.so
libGL error: driver pointer missing
libGL error: failed to load driver: nouveau
```

That assertion looks pretty hokey to me. Anyway, Gimp seems pretty unhappy.

title: GIMP 2.10.14 Keeps Crashing at Random Times
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System: Windows 10

Package: Installed from gimp.org

# Description of the bug

GIMP keeps crashing while I'm using it at random times. No matter how large or small the file is, it crashes. Files with more layers seem to crash within close to 7 minutes at most, where files with at most 7 layers seem to crash in a couple of hours. It's not enough time to work on anything!

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? Randomly

Reproduction steps:

1. Open GIMP
2. Load image (typically a .psd file will make it crash quicker)
3. Start drawing and wait until GIMP crashes

…

Expected result: Load image, draw, finish image

Actual result: Lose all progress on numerous images because system usually won't save either.

# Additional information

If you have a backtrace for a crash or a warning, paste it here.

title: cursor not following mouse onto canvas
description: i'm having a problem where i'll move my mouse onto the canvas to draw something but the cursor bit just stays to the side. I can click on all the things on the sides just fine (colors, brush options, layers, tools, scrolling, ect) but as soon as i move onto the canvas my mouse will go onto it just fine but the little circle that appears when using the paintbrush for example will stay right at the sides. i've tried uninstalling and reinstalling, ive tried restarting or turning off my computer, ive plugged my tablet into different spots, and ive simply closed and opened gimp again of course but nothing seems to work. it was pretty much just fine when i first got this laptop a few weeks ago and i made a drawing just fine but at some point recently its decided to do this and i have no clue what could've caused it or how to fix it

title: when exporting to format "C header" wrong output
description:
When exporting to "C header file" there are two mistakes.
For example the line "static char header_data_cmap[...][...] =" does not compile with some C compilers as the contents of that array are not "char" but "unsigned char". The word "unsigned" is missing.

Same thing for the "static char header_data[] = {". The word "unsigned" is missing.

For example gcc from cygwin generates error in compilation complaining about narrowing conversion error.

title: не встановлюється
description:
запускаючи програму мені викидає вікно повідомлення, де пише чи запустити цю програму, після того як клікнути вибиває чи встановити програму, потім після усіх ти віконець, пісоля повног встановллення, при запуску програми знову все спочатку.. Знову ті віконця ніби я нічого не робила і не встановлювала


[adding Google translation]

running the program throws me a message box where it says or starts this program, after clicking outbutton or installing the program, then after all you are the window, after the full installation, when you start the program all over again .. Again those windows as if I did nothing and did not install

title: Brush/Pencil dynamics On/Off should be a Checkbox.
description:
Operating System: Any

# Description of the feature
Currently: You activate the dynamics by clicking on its list and picking what dynamic you want to use.
To turn it off you have to scroll through the same list to find the "Dynamics Off" preset.

**My Suggestion: Make the whole dynamics feature a Checkbox**

Just like the other modifiers below it (Jitter, Smooth Stroke, Incremental et.c.) it should be a simple Checkbox.
Not only does this make the options more unified and consequent, it removes the very tiresome step of having to scroll through a rather long list to find the "Dynamics Off" preset each time.

Screenshot of current look: https://i.imgur.com/ZgC7f3H.jpg

Mock Screenshot of suggested look: https://i.imgur.com/71tqULy.jpg

# Use cases
Currently, there is no real good way that I'm aware off to simply shut off Dynamics for a second and then return to it.
The current work scenario for such a thing would be.

1.  Scroll through the list of presets to find the Dynamics Off preset.
2.  Do the changes you wanted without the dynamic active.
3.  Scroll through the list of presets to find the preset you were using again.

In my suggested feature, it would remove part of this hassle as:

1.  Click the checkbox to turn off the Dynamics.
2.  Do the changes you wanted without the dynamic active.
3.  Click the checkbox to turn the dynamics back on.

title: Bevel Reflect Logo script crashes in 2.10.14
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System: Windows 10

Package: Installer from gimp.org

# Description of the bug
The Bevel Reflect Logo script crashes. It ran fine in 2.10.12, and I re-verified that it does.

Error log gives the following:
Plug-in crashed: "map-object.exe"
(C:\Program Files\GIMP 2\lib\gimp\2.0\plug-ins\map-object\map-object.exe)
The dying plug-in may have messed up GIMP's internal state. You may want to save your images and restart GIMP to be on the safe side.
  Bevel Reflect Logo Warning
Error while executing script-fu-ml-bevel-reflect-logo-alpha:
Error: Procedure execution of plug-in-map-object failed on invalid input arguments: Procedure 'plug-in-map-object' returned no return values 
  GIMP Warning
Plug-in 'Bevel Reflect Logo' left image undo in inconsistent state, closing open undo groups.

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? Always and on three different PCs all running Windows 10. When I downgraded to 2.10.12 on my laptop, the script again performed perfectly and again crashed I reinstalled 2.10.14.

Reproduction steps:

1. Created a test text of "GIMP"
2. Duplicated text layer and made "layer to image size" (which the plug-in requires to work correctly.
3. Ran with the default parameters

Expected result: Text processed with the script.

Actual result: Crashes partway through with the above error messages in the error log.

# Additional information
This script has always worked perfectly from Gimp 2.8 and through 2.10.12, and since I use it in some book cover designs, I rely on it.

title: After some exports or using the last export location with quick export (under File -> export to) will not export anymore
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Operating System: [Windows 10 Pro x64]

Package: [Installer from gimp.org]

# Description of the bug
After some exports the program will not export anymore and the result of your image will not be exported and will have to close the program and reopen the saved file to be able to export.

# Reproduction
In a image (doesn't matter what dimensions) i used the box selection tool and the right click to fill it 4 - 5 times at different positions and have not really tested any other method if it happens. export it, do it several times and at some point (usually it happens after 4 - 5 times) it will not export the composite image.

Is the bug reproducible? [Always]

Reproduction steps:

1. Create a image (doesn't matter the dimensions)
2. Use the box selection tool and fill it with a color.
2. make changes 4 - 5 times as the step above (every time your make a change you should export in order for the bug to appear, during those steps i did not saved the image.)
3. after some time the export will not work anymore.

Expected result:
it should export my result.

Actual result:
does not export anymore and i have to restart to make it work.

title: toolbox icons lost their colors
description:
The toolbox icons that were nice and colorful in previous Gimp versions lost their colors in the newest versions (I'm using 2.10.12). Now they look pale, like deactivated, and they are hardly distinguishable.

![toolbox](/uploads/bab7bcf5d1b5322d02f069884dcef18f/toolbox.png)

This bug has already been described here:
https://forums.funtoo.org/topic/1494-gimp-icons-are-all-gray/

The solution suggested there does not work for me (all of the 4 available themes have the same problem), and I don't see any reason why any theme should have pale, unrecognizable icons.

title: Add visual tab to spyrogimp plugin
description:
The current parameters for specifying a spirograph are not intuitive.
Its difficult to use them to get a desired visual effect.

The attached patch (for the gimp 2.10 branch) adds a "Visual" tab that uses two visual metaphors:
* The petals of a flower - the number of petals, and how many petals to advance when drawing successive petals.
* A doughnut that has an inner "hole radius" and a width.

Specifying the amount of petals and the petal "skip" can lead to impossible shapes. For example, there is no pattern with 6 petals which
advances 2 petals. Such a pattern would start with petal 1, and then go to 
petals 3 and 5, and back to 1 - without ever drawing the even petals.
In such cases, I allow the user to specify the pattern, and I just
draw two rotated shapes of 3 petals each.

If this patch is accepted, I will adapt it to work for the master branch as well.

[0001-Add-visual-tab-to-spyrogimp-plugin.patch](/uploads/5a774f99dbc450da110f0efee01e1deb/0001-Add-visual-tab-to-spyrogimp-plugin.patch)

title: First export to PDF resets image print definition
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14 Linux flatpak

# Description of the bug

When exporting  to PDF, the print definition of the image is reset to 72DPI (or possibly completely forgotten since 72DPI is a default)

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? Always

Reproduction steps:

1. *File>New* and create an A4 @300PPI image
2. *Image>Print size* and check that the definition is indeed 300PPI 
3. *File>Export* and export to PDF
…

Expected result:

4. *Image>Print size* should show a print definition of 300PPI

Actual result:

4. *Image>Print size* shows a print definition of 72PPI

# Additional information

Definition is reset whether it was set by a template or set explicitly in the image creation dialog.

If the definition is reset to 300PPI at that point, it seems to be kept by further exports.

See https://graphicdesign.stackexchange.com/questions/131670/exporting-gimp-image-to-pdf-with-specific-page-size/131671#131671

title: gimp_drawable_curves_spline() gives an "execution error" when used with HISTOGRAM_LUMINANCE
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14 Linux flatpak

# Description of the bug

Python API `pdb.gimp_drawable_curves_spline()` fails when used with `HISTOGRAM_LUMINANCE`

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? Always

Reproduction steps:

* Create a new image (a plain image with kist a white layer will do)
* Enter the following in the Python console:

        >>> image=gimp.image_list()[0]
        >>> layer=image.active_layer
        >>> curve=[0.0, 1.0, 0.33, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0]
        >>> pdb.gimp_drawable_curves_spline(layer,HISTOGRAM_LUMINANCE,len(curve),curve)

Expected result:

* Curve is applied to drawable, or some "Invalid parameter value" is issued.

Actual result:

* Nasty message that doesn't tell much

        Traceback (most recent call last):
        File "<input>", line 1, in <module>
        RuntimeError: execution error

# Additional information

Using `HISTOGRAM_VALUE` instead of `HISTOGRAM_LUMINANCE` works. 

Could be a documentation error. The PDB browser says:

> The channel to modify { HISTOGRAM-VALUE (0), HISTOGRAM-RED (1), HISTOGRAM-GREEN (2), HISTOGRAM-BLUE (3), HISTOGRAM-ALPHA (4), HISTOGRAM-LUMINANCE (5), HISTOGRAM-RGB (6) }

But do `HISTOGRAM_LUMINANCE` and `HISTOGRAM_RGB` make sense here? On the other hand there is no error with `HISTOGRAM_RGB`.

Hi,

I am a user of Gimp and a feature that I think would greatly improve usability (feature that does not have other payment software) would be to create a quick access bar as shown in the attached image

Each small numbered block of this bar could be associated with a command, each user could configure it to their liking depending on the commands they use most, for example:

title: Scroll Wheel Not Working
description: I always use the scroll wheel on the mouse to move up and down, but it only works sporadically. I've never had this problem before. I've tried restarting GIMP, updating to the newest version, and checking to make sure it wasn't an error with my mouse.

title: Safeguard against filling whole image
description:
# Description of the feature

I've been recently working with very big images (10k x 10k+) with multiple layers. It's easy to make a mistake when using fill tool and accidentally initiate filling of whole image. Not really a big deal in itself, because you can easily undo it, but the problem is that the operation takes extremely long time (also it crashes in the newest version in some cases).

There should be some way to avoid it, like, if GIMP detects that you are trying to fill more than 1000000 pixels, it would automatically cancel the operation. This of course should be optional, but would be really helpful to have this option.

title: Gimp crashes Xorg on HiDPI screen
description:

Operating System: Arch Linux, kernel 5.3.13-arch1-1, Xorg 1.20.6, nvidia 440.36 with prime configuration.

The bug occurs only on HiDPI screens (see also https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/62612).

Gimp starts without problems.
When an image is opened or created, as soon as the mouse cursor is moved over the canvas, Xorg crashes.

title: Drawing with pen delayed image
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.0

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System: [Windows 7 Enterprise]

Package: [Download from gimp.org https://download.gimp.org/mirror/pub/gimp/v2.10/windows/Gimp-2.10.0-setup-2.exe (2.10.14 did not work on this machine so I used an older version.]

# Description of the bug

Please describe your issue with details.
Add screenshot or other files if needed.

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? [Always]

Reproduction steps:

1. GIMP 2.10.0 New file or open existing image
2. Select Pencil tool
3. Draw line with Huion Inspiroy Q11K V2 tablet (Drivers reinstalled from Huion.com/downloads yesterday.)

…

Expected result:
Line drawn from A to B

Actual result:
Dot appears at A, No line appears as the pen moves on the tablet. At B if the pen remains stationary on the tablet no line or menus appear. Once the pen is lifted from the tablet surface the line appears along the track taken by the pen. Any pressure variation during the stroke is correctly rendered.
 
# Additional information

The same behavior is seen with the brush and the eraser.
Using the same tablet and pen and a concurrent session, the line drawing performance is as expected in MS Paint.

title: Python script bucket fill works on 2.10.12, fails on 2.10.14
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System: Linux

Package: Both Arch Linux package and Flatpak package

# Description of the bug

I have confirmed a regression by using Flatpak. I was receiving this error when running a script I wrote which worked fine before I updated GIMP:

```
Opening pngs/three.png and writing to styleB/three.1.png
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
GeglBuffer* gimp_pickable_contiguous_region_by_seed(GimpPickable*, gboolean, gfloat, gboolean, GimpSelectCriterion, gboolean, gint, gint): foo took 0.0000 seconds
gimp-2.10: GEGL-WARNING: (../gegl/buffer/gegl-tile-handler-cache.c:1076):gegl_tile_cache_destroy: runtime check failed: (g_queue_is_empty (&cache_queue))
EEEEeEeek! 29 GeglBuffers leaked
```

The expected stdout is similar, just without the line about `gimp_pickable_contiguous_region_by_seed`. 

The problem line appears during running of command:

```
pdb.gimp_edit_bucket_fill(im.active_drawable, 0, 0, 100, 255, True, 1.0, 1.0)
```

The script is run via:

```
gimp -idf --batch-interpreter=python-fu-eval -b - < styleB.py
```

I was able to avoid the problem temporarily by not using my system GIMP. I first tried running stable GIMP from Flatpak this way:

```
flatpak install https://flathub.org/repo/appstream/org.gimp.GIMP.flatpakref
```

Then run my script via:

```
flatpak run org.gimp.GIMP -idf --batch-interpreter=python-fu-eval -b - < styleB.py
```

But I got the same dreaded `gimp_pickable_contiguous_region_by_seed` error. I had to downgrade my Flatpak GIMP:

```
sudo flatpak update --commit=798d8cd8a6a2ccf1bf21c0f5e9749dd4d97ecd511a3af1922d6fedf6c26e3a7c org.gimp.GIMP
```

Now it works. 

```
$ ./styleB.sh pngs/three.png 11 1
Gtk-Message: 11:32:40.677: Failed to load module "canberra-gtk-module"
GIMP-Error: Error while parsing '/home/fred/.var/app/org.gimp.GIMP/config/GIMP/2.10/templaterc' in line 9: unexpected number '300', expected number (float) - fatal parse error

GIMP-Error: Skipping '/home/fred/.var/app/org.gimp.GIMP/config/GIMP/2.10/pluginrc': wrong GIMP protocol version.

Gtk-Message: 11:32:41.227: Failed to load module "canberra-gtk-module"
Opening pngs/three.png and writing to styleB/three.1.png
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
using gegl copy
gimp-2.10: GEGL-WARNING: (gegl-tile-handler-cache.c:1076):gegl_tile_cache_destroy: runtime check failed: (g_queue_is_empty (&cache_queue))
EEEEeEeek! 31 GeglBuffers leaked
```


But this is not a long term  solution. I hope it can be fixed.

I attached some files. This is a very bad bug, I hope it can be fixed.[build.zip](/uploads/a46109bcb38bf6ff151189c3d90562b5/build.zip)

title: Status bar messages hide useful information
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Operating System: Windows

Package: Installer from gimp.org

# Description of the "bug"

This might not really be a bug, but it really negatively impacts usability for me. Status bar displays some useful information. I especially like that it shows selection rectangle size. But when any message appears, you need to wait few seconds until it disappears to see the desirable information.
![jZa4Z0x0fS](/uploads/823e08b7c3026e44e4e2f35881138f28/jZa4Z0x0fS.gif)

Just look at the gif. I can see the rectangle size, but then I do something like mistake or save image etc. and the status bar is occupied by some useless message that lasts for few seconds and I have to wait to use it again. It happens more than it should.

Not sure about the fix. Maybe allow to make the messages shorter or allow to override them with the information from selection or something.

title: Eyedropper icon doesn't work
description:
GIMP version: v2.10.14-1

Operating System: Manjaro KDE (Linux)

Package: Software Installer within Manjaro (Packager: Christian Hesse)


Picking color by Eyedropper icon doesn't work.
To be more precise:

- color picker from the toolbar works as expected
- color picker whilst selecting a Brush and holding CTRL key works as expected
- eyedropper whilst double-clicking the foreground color works as expected
- if you single-click the foreground color and click the eyedropper icon within the dialogue box, **the expected behavior will fail** (instead of the actual color, it will always set `#7f0000`, regardless any color you click at)

# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? [Always]

Reproduction steps:

1. Click at the foreground color
2. Click at the eyedropper icon
3. Click at any pixel within your image
4. Check the RGB code of your foreground color.

…

Expected result:
Chosen color should be presented as RGB.

Actual result:
RGB of a foreground color will not represent the color of a chosen pixel.

EDIT:

I just tried and "**eyedropper whilst double-clicking the foreground color**" doesn't work. No idea why I wrote that, since it's not even suppose to work that way.

title: GEGL cubism is crashy and/or broken
description:
While applying GEGL cubism in a new image with a simple gradient, I get the following in the preview ...

![gegl-cubism](/uploads/de68a60b93fa131234dac847f8a2ef65/gegl-cubism.png)

and sometimes

    gimp-2.10: fatal error: Segmentation fault
    ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/read.c: No such file or directory.

I'm always in #gimp in case you want more details. Easy to duplicate with 8-bit or 16-bit integer RGB images.

title: GIMP 2.10.14 fails to start on Windows
description:
I have a brand new Windows 10 system. I installed 2.10.14, and initially it worked fine. The only change I made was to tweak a few settings, e.g. to switch to multi-window mode. I have not attempted to install any plugins or do anything else.

When I came to use it today, I found it would not start. I therefore ran gimp-console-2.10.exe and saw the following:

```
GEGL-Message: 12:41:11.030: Module 'C:\Program Files\GIMP 2\lib\gegl-0.4\ff-load.dll' load error: 'C:\Program Files\GIMP 2\lib\gegl-0.4\ff-load.dll': The specified module could not be found.
GEGL-Message: 12:41:11.046: Module 'C:\Program Files\GIMP 2\lib\gegl-0.4\ff-save.dll' load error: 'C:\Program Files\GIMP 2\lib\gegl-0.4\ff-save.dll': The specified module could not be found.
```

At this point, it simply hangs, and I have to kill the process from the task manager.

The dll files listed are in fact present in the directory specified.

I have tried re-installing, the last time without 32-bit plugin support. I have deleted the GIMP user folders under AppData. It makes no difference. Please could someone give any pointers as to what the issue is?

title: Segmentation fault with rocm-opencl enabled
description:

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of GIMP or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System: Fedora 31 Linux

title: Newsprint plugin: Add SPI and LPI parameter
description:
Operating System: GIMP 2.10.14 on Windows 10

# Description of the feature

The new Newsprint plugin has no parameters for SPI and LPI, like the previous Newsprint plugin. It seems like the available settings now are labels that print designers don't really use for halftone generation. The labels are not even standard terms used in print design for halftones.

# Use cases

1. Add SPI parameter / setting
2. Add LPI parameter / setting

Previous Newsprint plugin :

![newsprint](/uploads/19d3b588ad6aca1bce4a5c33b41049b6/newsprint.png)

title: Add an icon for a spinner with a small number of steps
description:
The default animation of the Gtk spinner has some performance issues (see https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1204242). We have found out that it helps to limit the number of steps of the animation (see https://github.com/rhinstaller/anaconda/pull/2240). However, the icon process-working-symbolic is not designed to be animated this way. When the rotation of the icon is not smooth, the spinner looks a little glitchy.

We would like to use an icon that can be animated with a very small number of steps, but still looks beautiful. Could you provide an alternative icon for a spinner, please?

title: OpenVPN configuration files icon
description:
I am not really sure if I am at the good place to talk about this. If I am not, do not hesitate to close this issue.

I noticed that OpenVPN configuration files `.ovpn` do not have their own icons. There is [a request](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-control-center/issues/718) for gnome-control-center to be able to manage `.ovpn` files. I think this is a great idea, and that would need to have an associated icon.

I am not sure what would fit the most between something recalling the "configuration" idea, or the "secure network" idea.

What do you think?

title: Deprecate the  nautilus-open-terminal
description:
The same functionality is provided by gnome-terminal which installs libterminal-nautilus.so built from [terminal-nautilus.c](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-terminal/blob/master/src/terminal-nautilus.c)

Can you please check it's sources, maybe some features are missing and can be migrated there.

This causes some confusion because I looked for sources of the Open in Terminal action but was wondered that the n-o-t is not installed on my system.


It would be nice to mark this project as deprecated or obsolete. At least mention this in README.

There is also related discussion https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nautilus-open-terminal/+bug/1451166

title: Migrate away from gconf
description: It's deprecated anyway, but more specifically, it causes build failures because its header files use the deprecated `GTime` and `-Werror=deprecated-declarations` is active.

title: Question - How can I mark icons as translatable=no ?
description:
There are 43 strings in several .sheet files and they have not been marked as translatable but they have been in the PO files.

For example: 
```
#: sheets/ER.sheet:11
msgid "res:/org/gnome/Dia/ER/weakentity.png"
msgstr "res:/org/gnome/Dia/ER/weakentity.png"
```
The current code is: 

```
    <object name="ER - Entity" intdata="1">
      <description>Weak entity</description>
      <icon>res:/org/gnome/Dia/ER/weakentity.png</icon>
    </object>
```

I marked the icon tags as translatable="no", but it had no effect on them.

```
    <object name="ER - Entity" intdata="1">
      <description>Weak entity</description>
      <icon translatable="no">res:/org/gnome/Dia/ER/weakentity.png</icon>
    </object>
```

I also added this line to **/po/its/sheet.its** (https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/dia/blob/master/po/its/sheet.its) file but again had no effect.

```
<its:translateRule selector="/sheet/contents/object/icon" translate="no"/>
```

title: Build fails on macOS
description:
Hi, I'm a maintainer for the [Homebrew package manager](https://brew.sh). [I've been trying to get our packaged version of `msitools` updated from `0.99` to `0.100`](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/47542), and I've been having some issues:
*  In the file `libmsi/string.c`, the file `endian.h` is included, but this header lives at `machine/endian.h` on macOS. I managed to get around this by adding ifdefs around the include statement to change the location on macOS, but there are still other compilation issues
*  After resolving the aforementioned include issue, compilation fails with the following error:
```
libtool: link: clang -dynamiclib  -o .libs/libmsi.0.dylib  .libs/alter.o .libs/create.o .libs/debug.o .libs/delete.o .libs/distinct.o .libs/drop.o .libs/insert.o .libs/libmsi-database.o .libs/libmsi-enums.o .libs/libmsi-istream.o .libs/libmsi-query.o .libs/libmsi-record.o .libs/libmsi-summary-info.o .libs/select.o .libs/sql-parser.o .libs/storages.o .libs/streams.o .libs/string.o .libs/table.o .libs/tokenize.o .libs/update.o .libs/where.o   -L/usr/local/Cellar/glib/2.62.4/lib -L/usr/local/opt/gettext/lib -L/usr/local/Cellar/libgsf/1.14.46_1/lib -lgsf-1 -lxml2 -lgio-2.0 -lgobject-2.0 -lglib-2.0 -lintl  -g -O2   -install_name  /usr/local/Cellar/msitools/0.100/lib/libmsi.0.dylib -compatibility_version 1 -current_version 1.0 -Wl,-single_module -Wl,-exported_symbols_list,.libs/libmsi-symbols.expsym
Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
  "_le16toh", referenced from:
      _msi_load_string_table in string.o
ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
make[3]: *** [libmsi.la] Error 1
make[2]: *** [install] Error 2
make[1]: *** [install-recursive] Error 1
make: *** [install] Error 2
```
I found that `le16toh` is supposed to be in `endian.h`, but evidently Linux's `endian.h` and macOS's `machine/endian.h` are not interchangeable.

title: Clearlinux bundle
description:
The [Clearlinux](https://clearlinux.org/) is a new distro which uses Flatpack and swupd. It would be great if you can provide a bundle for it, because I can't even compile and install the `nautilus-python` myself.
It gives some unclear errors and I just don't want to fix them all.

title: xsltproc fails for external entities on https
description:
This is a migration and follow up of https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=791491

That bug was marked as duplicate of a closed bug in `libxml2`.

However, nowadays, switching to HTTP uri is usually not possible, thanks to Google pushing HTTPS everywhere.

There is a [similar issue](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/issues/41) on `libxml2` on gitlab.gnome.org, but it was also closed with suggestion to register own input callback that calls to `libcurl`. However, end user of `xsltproc` does not have a way to do that.

Is there a way to let `xsltproc` users specify a custom HTTP client?

title: xsltproc on Windows fails when paths contain spaces
description:
Libxslt built with MinGW-W64 on WinXP. Everything is fine when paths to input/output files do **not** contain spaces. But e.g. following command fails:
```
xsltproc -o "C:/Program Files/KiCad/share/kicad/demos/pic_programmer/pic_programmer" "C:\Program Files\KiCad\bin\scripting\plugins\bom2csv.xsl" "C:\Program Files\KiCad\share\kicad\demos\pic_programmer\pic_programmer.xml"

Command error. Return code 11
Error messages:
I/O error : Invalid argument
I/O error : Invalid argument
```

When KiCad (i.e. the application which calls `xsltproc` in my case) is installed under a directory without spaces in its name (e.g. C:\Temp\KiCad), `xsltproc` works as expected.

title: Win32 configure.js is missing support for the with-profiler switch
description:
The Win32 configure.js script doesn't support the with-profiler switch, so it creates an xsltconfig.h that contains:

`#if @WITH_PROFILER@`

which breaks the MSVC preprocessor.

I've attached a patch file with the necessary changes, based on the equivalent code for the with-debugger switch.

[profiler.patch](/uploads/5b2d609003d120cf1dbe81b84cd323fc/profiler.patch)

title: GtkFileChooser issue
description:
I had an error when using GtkFileChooser on OSX : "no gsettings schemas are installed on the system"
This dialog uses the GSETTINGS_SCHEMA_DIR environment variable.
I had to insert a new line in my gtk3-launcher.sh to fix this issue
export GSETTINGS_SCHEMA_DIR="$bundle_data/glib-2.0/schemas"
I suggest you commit this update in https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk-mac-bundler/tree/master/examples to ease the osx integration.
Sincerely

title: Change bugreporting link
description:
Readme.md and manpages have a link to https://bugzilla.gnome.org/. Whilst at Bugzilla a notice reads:
>No new issues can be reported in GNOME Bugzilla anymore. Some older issues are still tracked here (until migrated to Gitlab).
To report an issue in a GNOME project, go to GNOME GitLab.

A very small problem, but at some point someone should go in all of the GNOME project repositories grepping case insensitive for `bugzilla` and then manually replacing the links.

title: Raise or remove the maximum for threshold parameter
description:
<sup>This software is great thanks for making it!</sup>

I would like if I could experiment with parameter values for `--threshold=n` (ignore mouse movements less than that) with a much higher value than currently possible (0-30). I don't see (yet) why people couldn't set it to unusual values from the command line. GUI can always have more reasonable defaults.

I think there can be many unforeseen use cases that would benefit to higher or removed maximum for all of the parameters. Though the manpages should probably indicate some other way then what the reasonable values would be. Like "commonly: 0-30" or "usually 0-30" or "normally 0-30". 

(**My specific use case** that would benefit from higher numbers is the following. I have a (2-in-1) Dell laptop with a touch screen and with a built-in graphics tablet (Wacom). I tried a number of desktop environments and OS-s to see what works out of the box where (where will I have less effort settings things up) and found that Kubuntu worked the  best for me. Except that under Wayland they don't have graphics tablet (+ pen) support yet. So since I want to use that I have to work under X11 which doesn't have true touch support - emulates a mouse instead. And KDE does not backport their touch-related stuff from Wayland version to X11 version. So I am stuck with limited touch support.
So I would like to use `mousetweaks --ssc --ssc-time=1.0` to emulate right clicks to fill in a gap in otherwise okay touch experience (`florence` and `touchegg` contribute a lot). With a `--threshold=30` setting it is still extremely difficult to land a finger on the touch screen so that it does not move more than 30 px. The result is a right click that works 1 in dozens of attempts.)

title: D-L is unable to push protected
description:
The master branch is currently protected, which blocks pushes from `@translations` user, used by Damned Lies. The following message is displayed when trying to push it:

`“[Errno 1] Command: "['git', 'push', 'origin', 'master']", Error: Warning: Permanently added 'gitlab.gnome.org,172.31.1.77' (ECDSA) to the list of known hosts. remote: GitLab: You are not allowed to push code to protected branches on this project. To git@gitlab.gnome.org:GNOME/gtranslator.git ! [remote rejected] master -> master (pre-receive hook declined) error: failed to push some refs to 'git@gitlab.gnome.org:GNOME/gtranslator.git'”`

To allow translations to go through, this could be solved by dropping the protection or by promoting `@translations` to maintainer role.

Can this please be verified?

title: must use g_object_unref instead of g_free for GdkPixbuf
description:
`gdl_dock_object_finalize` calls `g_free` on a `GdkPixbuf` pointer. This can lead to double-free since `GdkPixbuf` derives from `GObject` and is reference counted, thus must be released with `g_object_unref`.

https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gdl/blob/8f8435bac99f3fdfde4e877a70ec98bfe1e83433/gdl/gdl-dock-object.c#L419

title: need to include eglmesaext.h
description:
Recently mesa moved inclusion of eglmesaext.h from eglext.h as per this commit 

```
From eaf43966027cf9654e91ca57aecc8f5a65b58f49 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Eric Engestrom <eric.engestrom@intel.com>
Date: Wed, 6 Nov 2019 19:53:28 +0000
Subject: [PATCH] egl: move #include of local headers out of Khronos headers
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Cc: mesa-stable@lists.freedesktop.org
Signed-off-by: Eric Engestrom <eric.engestrom@intel.com>
Reviewed-by: Marek Olšák <marek.olsak@amd.com>
---
 include/EGL/eglext.h                 | 3 ---
 src/egl/generate/gen_egl_dispatch.py | 2 ++
 src/egl/main/egltypedefs.h           | 2 ++
 3 files changed, 4 insertions(+), 3 deletions(-)

diff --git a/include/EGL/eglext.h b/include/EGL/eglext.h
index 02dd7719161..04facdfbce6 100644
--- a/include/EGL/eglext.h
+++ b/include/EGL/eglext.h
@@ -1373,9 +1373,6 @@ EGLAPI EGLBoolean EGLAPIENTRY eglImageInvalidateExternalEXT (EGLDisplay dpy, EGL
 #endif
 #endif /* EGL_EXT_image_flush_external */
 
-#include <EGL/eglmesaext.h>
-#include <EGL/eglextchromium.h>
-
 #ifdef __cplusplus
 }
 #endif
diff --git a/src/egl/generate/gen_egl_dispatch.py b/src/egl/generate/gen_egl_dispatch.py
index 12342b28a54..2063e9d0993 100644
--- a/src/egl/generate/gen_egl_dispatch.py
+++ b/src/egl/generate/gen_egl_dispatch.py
@@ -100,6 +100,8 @@ def generateHeader(functions):
 
     #include <EGL/egl.h>
     #include <EGL/eglext.h>
+    #include <EGL/eglmesaext.h>
+    #include <EGL/eglextchromium.h>
     #include "glvnd/libeglabi.h"
 
     """.lstrip("\n"))
diff --git a/src/egl/main/egltypedefs.h b/src/egl/main/egltypedefs.h
index 642f473c4eb..4809cf5d7d5 100644
--- a/src/egl/main/egltypedefs.h
+++ b/src/egl/main/egltypedefs.h
@@ -33,6 +33,8 @@
 
 #include <EGL/egl.h>
 #include <EGL/eglext.h>
+#include <EGL/eglmesaext.h>
+#include <EGL/eglextchromium.h>
 
 #ifdef __cplusplus
 extern "C" {
-- 
2.21.0
```

then cogl can't find a definition for EGL_WAYLAND_BUFFER_WL, resulting in a build failure.  Some API egl functions that get define during preprocessing in struct CoglRenderEGL will also fail as a result of not finding the previous macro definition

I am not sure if this is something mesa has to continue including or if cogl needs to fix.

title: Ocrfeeder doesn't initiate
description:
Hi. I usually work with *OCRFeeder*. And I am, also usually, happy with this program. But this time, working on Trisquel 8.0 (Flidas) LxQT DE, *OF* doesn't initiate session. I have to start it through my Terminal, with its command. This is the result:

```
$ ocrfeeder
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/ocrfeeder/util/lib.py:26: PyGIWarning: Gtk was imported without specifying a version first. Use gi.require_version('Gtk', '3.0') before import to ensure that the right version gets loaded.
  from gi.repository import Gtk
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/ocrfeeder/studio/widgetPresenter.py:31: PyGIWarning: GooCanvas was imported without specifying a version first. Use gi.require_version('GooCanvas', '2.0') before import to ensure that the right version gets loaded.
  from gi.repository import Gtk, GooCanvas, Gdk, GObject, GLib, GdkPixbuf, GtkSpell
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/ocrfeeder/studio/widgetPresenter.py:31: PyGIWarning: GtkSpell was imported without specifying a version first. Use gi.require_version('GtkSpell', '3.0') before import to ensure that the right version gets loaded.
  from gi.repository import Gtk, GooCanvas, Gdk, GObject, GLib, GdkPixbuf, GtkSpell

(ocrfeeder:32511): Gtk-WARNING **: Theme parsing error: gtk.css:2:13: 'min-width' is not a valid property name

(ocrfeeder:32511): Gtk-WARNING **: Theme parsing error: gtk.css:3:14: 'min-height' is not a valid property name
```
After do this the program initiates but is not the good way to work, right?

Do you see any solution to this?

Thank you.

title: Password seems to be mandatory even when set as not required
description:
Hi,

I'm investigating an issue in plasma-nm (https://bugs.kde.org/show_bug.cgi?id=414975), where the reporter is unable to successfuly use our fortisslvpn plugin. It seems that when the password is set as "Not Required" and OTP is required, it fails to connect.

In my case with NM-fortisslvpn-1.3.90 from Fedora 31, I don't even get the auth-dialog, because NM assumes no secrets are required I guess. In case of the reporter, he uses version 1.2.8 and he gets the auth dialog, but he needs to set both the OTP and the password to the same value, to successfuly connect.

Can someone clarify how this all should behave?

title: secret-tool crashes in various cases with KeePassXC
description:
In KeePassXC, I created an entry in a Group exposed via secret service.  The entry has title "test1", username "user222", password "pass222", URL "test1.com".  The following commands give me the indicated behaviors (I think all of them should find that entry):

    secret-tool search Title test1		# gives entry, then core-dumps
    secret-tool search username user222		# gives nothing
    secret-tool search Username user222		# gives nothing
    secret-tool search label user222		# gives nothing
    secret-tool search Label user222		# gives nothing
    secret-tool search Password pass222		# gives entry, then core-dumps
    secret-tool search URL test1.com		# gives entry, then core-dumps
    secret-tool search URL test1.com service secret		# gives nothing
    secret-tool search URL test1.com service secrets		# gives nothing
    
    secret-tool lookup Title test1		# returns password
    secret-tool lookup username user222		# gives nothing
    secret-tool lookup Username user222		# gives nothing
    secret-tool lookup label user222		# gives nothing
    secret-tool lookup Label user222		# gives nothing
    secret-tool lookup Password pass222		# returns password
    secret-tool lookup URL test1.com		# returns password
    secret-tool lookup URL test1.com service secret		# gives nothing
    secret-tool lookup URL test1.com service secrets		# gives nothing
    
    secret-tool store --label=test4 username user444 service secret  # set password to pass444
    # creates a new entry in KeePassXC with Username field empty

When I say "gives entry, then core-dumps", I mean output like this:

    $ secret-tool search URL test1.com
    [/org/freedesktop/secrets/collection/KeePassDatabase/d44e8ebxxxxxxc83eb2d29]
    label = test1
    secret = pass222
    created = 2019-12-08 11:18:17
    modified = 2019-12-08 11:40:55
    schema = xdg:schema
    free(): invalid pointer
    Aborted (core dumped)

I'm using KeePassXC 2.5.1 on Linux Mint 19.2 Cinnamon.  I have uninstalled seahorse and gnome-keyring.  All of the results above were obtained after a system reboot and fresh launch of KeePassXC.

    $ apt show libsecret-tools
    Package: libsecret-tools
    Version: 0.18.6-1

I filed https://github.com/keepassxreboot/keepassxc/issues/3992

A core dump is attached.[core.secret-tool.1000.145490f7becd439381a98d00c08da398.1281.1575810492000000.lz4](/uploads/b17658059e1c9adb06511846e596ea53/core.secret-tool.1000.145490f7becd439381a98d00c08da398.1281.1575810492000000.lz4)

title: Typos in license text (and others)
description:
I'm using latest `codespell` to check for common typos in source code.
While it detects dozens of issues in the whole libXML source code, there is one that is bugging me particularly:
*MERCHANTIBILITY*. The correct spelling is MERCHANT**A**BILITY.
This is troublesome, because people are required to quote the license text explicitly mentioned in some files (e.g. `hash.c`) if libXML gets integrated in 3rd party software:

```
# ~/libxml2-2.9.10> grep -ir MERCHANTIBILITY
list.c: * MERCHANTIBILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE AUTHORS AND
hash.c: * MERCHANTIBILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE AUTHORS AND
trio.c: * MERCHANTIBILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE AUTHORS AND
triodef.h: * MERCHANTIBILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE AUTHORS AND
dict.c: * MERCHANTIBILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE AUTHORS AND
triostr.c: * MERCHANTIBILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE AUTHORS AND
trionan.c: * MERCHANTIBILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE AUTHORS AND
trio.h: * MERCHANTIBILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE AUTHORS AND
trionan.h: * MERCHANTIBILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE AUTHORS AND
triop.h: * MERCHANTIBILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE AUTHORS AND
triostr.h: * MERCHANTIBILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE AUTHORS AND
```

Attached are lists of spelling problems found in the libXML2 2.9.10 source code tree (some of them are obviously false positives).

[codespell-result-c.txt](/uploads/c63493ed5eec112d3fff4b63a80d8c99/codespell-result-c.txt)

title: problem with 0762c9b6 commit exposed in an unsupported scenario
description:
Hey Nick,

this is a very raw and perhaps mislead report, to be taken with a grain
of salt...

It appears that what's masked for whatever reason with `AMD64` arch
(and some others) will get exposed with `x86` arch; without further ado:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1777056#c10

and what I suspect _might_ be a problem is that the change forgot
to consider that `XML_DOCUMENT_NODE` might actually itself be
enclosed in some "XSLT fragment" container.

Previous recursive code would hence _not_ descent into
`XML_DOCUMENT_NODE` at _arbitrary depth_, whereas now, it
seems to be -- likely erroneously -- possible (only the
first entry level is guarded).

Any preliminary thoughts?

I hope to look into this more next week if not, but this seems
a plausible explanation (and `AMD64` may be accidentally safe
because of accidentally? initialized `cur->content` of
`XML_DOCUMENT_NODE`)

Cheers!

title: Music displays incorrect playback times for most MP3 songs
feature request: honor $XKB_CONFIG_ROOT
description:
# Current behavior
The directory where keyboard layouts are looked up is [hard-coded](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-desktop/blob/master/libgnome-desktop/gnome-xkb-info.c#L137) at compilation time.

# Desired behavior
If the `XKB_CONFIG_ROOT` environment variable is set, it should override the compile-time path. Otherwise, nothing changes.

# Reasoning
I use GNOME, [NixOS](https://nixos.org/)[1], which is a distribution that insists on installed software being immutable to allow structural sharing, and [my own custom keyboard layout](https://gitlab.gnugen.ch/bettens/nixos-profiles/tree/master/segments/custom-layout/symbols). In order to make GNOME on NixOS recognize the extra layout, I had to figure out how `libgnome-desktop` & friends discovered keyboard layouts and rig together a [setup](https://github.com/lourkeur/nur-expressions/blob/master/modules/gnome3-fix-extra-layouts.nix) that automatically recompiles them to support the custom `xkeyboard_config` package that NixOS [can generate.](https://nixos.org/nixos/manual/#custom-xkb-layouts) This works perfectly as-is, but it leads to a fair bit of unnecessary recompilation work for me and potentially others in my (admittedly rare) situation. When figuring this out I assumed at first that this library would use [`libxkbcommon`](https://xkbcommon.org/) internally since it seems designed for this use case and therefore that it would honor the environment variable, but that's not the case. If it did honor the variable, it would have made my problem simpler to solve.

Is that feasible? planned? If I implement it, might it be merged?

title: Is the background transition clock ahead by 1 hour?
description:
General info:
 - cinnamon 4.4
 - archlinux
 - gnome-backgrounds 3.34
 - central daylight time (usa)

**Issue:** I think that the clock that gnome backgrounds uses for transitions is ahead by an hour.

**Description:**
I created a set of 12 backgrounds that are images of the numbers "1", "2", "3", ..., and "12," and I set the background xml file so that each number is displayed for 1 hour at the corresponding time (e.g. the image "2" at 2 PM). The idea is to compare the time to the number displayed on the background to see if the times match.

What I'm seeing is that the number displayed in the background is ahead by 1 hour. For example, the "8" background shows at 7:00 and 7:30 PM.

![Screenshot_from_2019-11-27_19-15-42](/uploads/2a67191766967ed0d312ce39f78043f3/Screenshot_from_2019-11-27_19-15-42.png)

I don't know why this happens. I don't think this repo is the cause --- I don't see any source code here, but I don't really have a good idea for what to try next. Maybe it's a cinnamon issue...

At any rate, I'd like to hear your opinion.

I've attached the background files I used. I stuck them in /usr/share/backgrounds/timed and set the background via dconf (`dconf write /org/cinnamon/desktop/background/picture-uri "'file:///usr/share/backgrounds/timed/clock-timed.xml'"`) because cinnamon's background application doesn't show the timed xml files.

[timed_20191127-182148.tar.gz](/uploads/af5801dbb28803882785f4b9e27dad79/timed_20191127-182148.tar.gz)

title: Environment variables with control characters vanished.
description:
Issue:
After update to Fedora31 GNOME 3.34.1, (only) environment variables containing control sequences such as the following vanished:

From ~/.bash_profile:
```
export LESS='-R -P%lb\:?B%pb\%.'$'\x1b''[27;31;1m %F '$'\x1b''[0m'
export LESS_TERMCAP_mb=$(tput bold; tput setaf 6) # blink: cyan
```

Digging through the process hierarchy and GNOME code found that in gsm_util_export_activation_environment@gnome-session/gnome-session/gsm-util.c, variables with values containing control characters are deliberately not part of "UpdateActivationEnvironment" sent to systemd --user.

 value_regex = g_regex_new ("^([[:blank:]]|[^[:cntrl:]])*$", G_REGEX_OPTIMIZE, 0, error);

Resolution:
While variable values with control characters is a legitimate use case, I guess there should've been a strong enough reason to exclude the above regex. In which case kindly document the same perhaps in gnome-session man page, so that users will not be surprised, and instead workaround. Regards, Narendran Gopalakrishnan.

title: Username and other form values are not saved after successful login
description:
I created a new username/password authorized openconnect connection, checked the "Save password" box and signed in. The VPN connection works fine. Next time I open the connection, the password field is filled in, but the username field is left blank, so I have to type it in again.

This is on Gnome 3.34.2 on Arch linux, with networkmanager-openconnect version  1.2.6-1

I did some debugging of this issue by manually building the auth-dialog from this repository, and launched it with the same arguments as done my network-manager-applet. When doing this, it outputs the form entries from the signin page, including the username, in this format on stdout (secrets manually redacted). 

```
form:main:username
user.name
form:main:group_list
vpn.meniga.is
gateway
X.X.X.X:443
save_passwords
yes
cookie
YYY
save_s
yes
gwcert
pin-sha256:XXX
lasthost
vpn.XX.yy
```

Reading auth-dialog.c, it seems like this is then intended to be saved back to the connection profile for the next time. However, this does not happen. Instead the connection profile has only the last entry, "lasthost" in it. 

My guess is that something goes wrong in the interaction between network-manager-applet and this dialog, but I couldn't quite figure out what.

title: repository incompatible with default GitLab hosted projects
description:
Hello!

The repository contains tree objects with zero-padded file modes:

```
git fsck
Checking object directories: 100% (256/256), done.
warning in tree 070ce550b59ce224ec26e31165703525963caa6f: zeroPaddedFilemode: contains zero-padded file modes
Checking objects: 100% (7703/7703), done.
```

This makes it impossible to push to a GitLab hosted project since there is no way of setting `git config receive.fsck.zeroPaddedFilemode warn` on the server (see [GitLab issue 1602](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/omnibus-gitlab/issues/1602)). GitHub is more lenient and allows it, but I want to move my fork of gtk-osx to Inkscape's project on GitLab.

To really fix this, you'd have to either [export/import](https://stackoverflow.com/a/14839059) (generating new hashes, breaking all references left and right) or deprecate this repository and continue development in a new one.

You're probably not keen on doing anything of the above (none of the given solutions feel good), nevertheless I wanted to bring this to your attention and ask if you see a chance of fixing this.

title: gedit plugin 'Find in Files' causes segfault
description:
```
gedit: Version 3.34.1
gedit-plugins: Version 3.34.1-1
OS: Arch Linux 
Kernel: x86_64 Linux 4.19.86-1-lts
WM: i3
GTK Theme: Arc [GTK2], Adwaita [GTK3]
```

Opening gedit and enabling the 'Find in Files' plugin then closing gedit shows a segfault on stdout
```
[~]$ gedit
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

Subsequent attempts to use gedit are fine except when closed a segfault shows again.

Attempting to disable the plugin causes gedit to quit and segfault.

The present work around is to uninstall gedit-plugins, use gedit at least once (presumably this resets options in gconf), then reinstall gedit-plugins and ensure not to select 'Find in Files' again.

The following is typically found in systemd journal with every time gedit is closed whilst that plugin is enabled:

```
Dec 01 17:03:23 desktop systemd-coredump[1646]: Process 1625 (gedit) of user 1000 dumped core.
                                                
                                                Stack trace of thread 1625:
                                                #0  0x00007faa0a596804 __GI___strlen_sse2 (libc.so.6)
                                                #1  0x00007faa09dc24fe gtk_accelerator_parse_with_keycode (libgtk-3.so.0)
                                                #2  0x00007faa09db8c09 gtk_application_set_accels_for_action (libgtk-3.so.0)
                                                #3  0x00007fa9f54d62d7 n/a (libfindinfiles.so)
```

title: Latest Spanish help translation eadc85dae1 breaks the build
description:
Commit eadc85dae16e20225bf833bda99000acb261e2a7 "Updated Spanish
translation" breaks the build like this:
```
$ cd help
$ make
if ! test -d "es/"; then mkdir "es/"; fi
if test -d "C"; then d="../"; else d="/home/mike/programming/c/gparted/help/"; fi; \
mo="es/es.mo"; \
if test -f "${mo}"; then mo="../${mo}"; else mo="/home/mike/programming/c/gparted/help/${mo}"; fi; \
(cd "es/" && itstool -m "${mo}" ${d}/C/index.docbook) && \
touch "es/es.stamp"
Warning: Could not merge translation for msgid:
Check the partition for errors with the following command: <_:screen-1/> Remember to reboot back into the commercial operating system that uses NTFS to allow the <command>chkdsk</command> command to execute.
Error: Could not merge translations:
'NoneType' object has no attribute 'node'
make: *** [es/es.stamp] Error 1
```

It looks like some (newer) tool used as part of the translation work
flow breaks the English strings (msgids) by replacing sections of
`<screen>...</screen>` with `<_:screen-1/>`.  Thus `itstool` doesn't
find valid XML and can't assemble a valid translated document from the
translated strings.

title: Remove or revamp region page
description:
The `region` page was patched out of the list of pages back in 2014: a3c70fd2c511bbe3f5062314b0b932f37bb781d1. cb66d893be50b1fad6c0a1bd443c900e8853512c made its use a configure-time parameter, off by default. It is redundant with the current implementation of the language page, which include regional language variants in the language list. I think we should remove it from the codebase.

I had assumed that, since it was disabled in source for 4 years, no-one would use it, but in fact at least the following distros enable it:

* [Arch](https://git.archlinux.org/svntogit/community.git/tree/trunk/PKGBUILD?h=packages/gnome-initial-setup) [since 3.32](https://git.archlinux.org/svntogit/community.git/commit/trunk?h=packages/gnome-initial-setup&id=38eb51fd5ca42ee1d65f67ab39a26e698538a2cb)
* [NixOS](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/pkgs/desktops/gnome-3/core/gnome-initial-setup/default.nix#L88)
* (Possibly others – I didn't check every distro on https://repology.org/project/gnome-initial-setup/versions)

I don't think this page should be optional – it should either be included (and incorporated into the design of the language page) or removed.

title: Windows: Can't store files over 1 MB to disk
description:
Hi,

System: Windows 7 / MSYS
libsoup: mingw-w64-x86_64-libsoup 2.68.2-1
glib: mingw-w64-x86_64-glib2 2.62.2-1

I wrote a simple, download and store to disk script.
It does not work for files bigger than 1 MB, i cant find the reason

Its unlikely that its the server, i uploaded the same picture to two different servers

What im seeing is `g-io-error-quark: Fehler beim Schreiben in Datei (Error on write): Invalid argument (13)` issued from the `outputstream.write_all_finish(result)` call.

I opened the issue here, because i dont get this error if i just load the file from disk and save it to disk again.

It seems to be related to the download with soup

I could not reproduce this on Ubuntu

```python
import gi
gi.require_version('Soup', '2.4')
from gi.repository import GLib
from gi.repository import Gio
from gi.repository import Soup


session = Soup.Session()

def download_content(url, filename):
    print('Start download:', url)
    message = Soup.Message.new('GET', url)
    session.queue_message(message, _on_finished, filename)

def _on_finished(_session, message, filename):
    if message.status_code != Soup.Status.OK:
        print(Soup.Status.get_phrase(message.status_code))
        return

    data = message.props.response_body_data.get_data()

    gio_file = Gio.File.new_for_path(filename)
    gio_file.create_async(Gio.FileCreateFlags.NONE,
                          GLib.PRIORITY_DEFAULT,
                          None,
                          _on_file_created,
                          data)

def _on_file_created(gio_file, result, data):
    print('Created:', gio_file.get_path())
    try:
        outputstream = gio_file.create_finish(result)
    except GLib.Error as error:
        print(error)
        return
    print('Write:', gio_file.get_path())
    outputstream.write_all_async(data,
                                 GLib.PRIORITY_DEFAULT,
                                 None,
                                 _on_write_finished,
                                 gio_file.get_path())

def _on_write_finished(outputstream, result, path):
    print('Write finished:', path)
    try:
        _successful, _bytes_written = outputstream.write_all_finish(result)
    except GLib.Error as error:
        print(error)
        return
    print('Finished:', path)


download_content('https://upload.jabberfr.org/x9vVl5Tj_3GOuUK3/1469616305109.png', 'test.png')
download_content('https://upload.lightwitch.org/share/dToRDYv0zzBU5775/1469616305109.png', 'test2.png')
download_content('https://upload.jabberfr.org/8nsigws42gTGWa9C/chooser.png', 'chooser.png')

GLib.MainLoop().run()

```

title: Adding a SoupLogger with SOUP_LOGGER_LEVEL_NONE to a SoupSession causes two newlines to be printed to the console in my application
description:
The logger is instantiated like so

```c
g_autoptr(SoupLogger) logger = soup_logger_new(SOUP_LOGGER_LOG_NONE, -1);
```

The session is instantiated like so

```c
g_autoptr(SoupSession) session = soup_session_new_with_options(SOUP_SESSION_MAX_CONNS,
		max_connections, SOUP_SESSION_USER_AGENT, user_agent->str, SOUP_SESSION_ADD_FEATURE_BY_TYPE,
		SOUP_TYPE_CONTENT_SNIFFER, SOUP_SESSION_ADD_FEATURE, SOUP_SESSION_FEATURE(logger), NULL);
```

When I remove the logger feature from the session constructor, no newlines are printed to the console.

My small amount of debugging leads me to the following conclusion. Attached is a sample of `SOUP_LOGGER_LOG_MINIMAL`. In it you will notice two things. Two lines with 2 spaces to begin the lines although they are empty lines (4, 8).

[out.txt](/uploads/5a8e4e00b673e435d1f4b41352108eed/out.txt)

Here is a sample output of `SOUP_LOGGER_LOG_NONE`. In it you will notice that lines one and two both have two spaces preceding them. I believe these are the same lines as 4 and 8 from the previous file.

[out.txt](/uploads/ec943af9b56fd608d30692863c172800/out.txt)

Version of libsoup: 2.68.3 (Fedora default)

title: minor Preferences bug in single image mode
description:
Latest Gnome Manjaro here, 64bit.

This is really minor, but still...

If you change "File properties in browser", Appearance, after you exit the Preferences you can no longer use/see the image properties when you click on the icon. You must either go back to the browser or restart gthumb in order to see it.

This happens only if you change "File properties..." in single picture mode - not in browser! In browser everything is ok and works normally. 

I guess that's because this setting was meant for the browser in the first place, but IMO, it shouldn't affect the showing of properties if you happen to set this in single image mode.

title: TestEnvironment erases all env variables
description:
If `TestEnvironment` is set, then instead of inheriting the current environment, _only_ this environment is set. For example, adding `TestEnvironment=GLIB_TEST_COMPILATION=1` to the `.test` file will empty any `PATH` that might be set before the environment.

`TestEnvironment` should complement the existing one. See the `g_subprocess_launcher_set_environ()` call which says:
> Typically you will build this variable by using g_listenv() to copy the process 'environ' and using the functions g_environ_setenv(), g_environ_unsetenv(), etc.

title: gstreamer gets "invalid argument" when reading from gvfs-mounted smb share
description:
When playing FLAC files from an SMB drive using gstreamer, the last few seconds of the file fail to play. Initially reported to gstreamer, the devs there indicate the issue is likely with gvfs and suggested I report here.

Xubuntu Linux 19.10 with current patches
gvfs version 1.42.1-1ubuntu1

link to gstreamer bug (now closed) https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/gstreamer/gstreamer/issues/479

title: Cannot read files with FTP mounted filesystem on Linux >= 5.4
description:
**Summary:**

Most operations on GVFS filesystems do not work correctly on Linux 5.4 (but worked fine on 5.3; I checked). Running e.g. the "cp" command on a file on the filesystem gives an "Operation not supported" error.

This affects at least FTP servers mounted via GVFS.

This does *not* seem to affect Nautilus; I can copy files in Nautilus without issue.

**To reproduce:**
1. Upgrade your system to Linux >= 5.4. I tested this on Arch Linux, which is currently shipping 5.4.
2. Mount a FTP server with GVFS.
3. Navigate to the FTP filesystem in Terminal.
4. Use the "cp" command to try to copy a file on the filesystem to your local disk, e.g. "cp my_file.txt ~"

**Expected result:**

Successful copy.

**Actual result:**

This error:
  cp: error reading 'my_file.txt': Operation not supported.

**Software versions:**

GVFS: 1.42.2

Linux kernel: 5.4.6

Fuse2 version: 2.9.9

Fuse3 version: 3.9.0

Linux distro: Arch Linux

I was also able to reproduce the issue with GVFS 1.40.2. The issue did *not* reproduce with Linux 5.3.9.1.

**Links:**

[Issue on Arch Linux tracker](https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/64787)

title: Provide support to fetch GDataFeed by `orderBy=modifiedDate` to avoid issues with volatile entries in Google Backend
description:
The !58 MR augments the move and copy operation in the Google backend to use volatile entries to perform these operations. 

When performing a copy/move operation from a folder into another folder where there already exists some file with same title or volatile entry, we need to fetch the updated GDataFeed such that it is ordered by `modifiedDate`. The file which has been copied/moved latest will always have the most recent `modifiedDate` and that file will be inserted into the cache at the last, thereby ensuring consistency. By consistency, I mean that a `query_info` operation called using title/volatile_entry just after move/copy will get resolved with the file that is actually moved/copied and not the other one with the same title/volatile_entry.

Depends upon: 
* https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gvfs/merge_requests/58
* https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libgdata/merge_requests/21

title: MTP error about missing service
description:
When I try to access my Samsung Galaxy S6 (TWRP as well as RR 7.0.3 Android 9 Pie) in Nautilus in Ubuntu 19.10, I get the following error:

    Unhandled error message: The name :1.1848 was not provided by any .service files

`mtp-filetree` works fine, so it's not a problem with the device itself. Other devices like Xiaomi Mi A1 work fine in Nautilus as well!

title: Software caused connection abort, with Ubuntu
description:
With Ubuntu 16.04 gvfs used to work.

Since and including Ubuntu 18.04 gvfs does not work very well, giving a range of errors. (Now using Ubuntu 19.10)

A share using the SMB protocol is mounted with `gio mount`

In nautilus I double click a .txt file on the share and nautilus launches gedit but gedit gives the following error

`Software caused connection abort`

(possibly only for larger files? over 32KB?)

Copying a file in nautilus or with the `cp` command also gives errors.

More discussion here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gvfs/+bug/1773114
