title: Unable to copy files to iPhone Apps
description:
I was able to delete photos.  However, if I want to copy some files to my iPhone it stopped working.  

**Distro:** Arch  
**IOS Version:** 13.2.3  
**Version:** gvfs 1.42.2-1 gvfs-afc 1.42.2-1  
**Error:**  
![Screenshot_from_2019-12-05_11-31-35](/uploads/e3761ca2e2b19f31d723e4166fa234c2/Screenshot_from_2019-12-05_11-31-35.png)

title: Nautilus segfaults while transferring files via SFTP
description:
Every time I try to transfer a large file (or several small files) via Nautilus/SFTP, it ends up failing after a minute or so (connection closed).

For example, I tried the same transfer twice, and got the following log:

```
[505587.786931] gvfsd-sftp[23481]: segfault at 1 ip 0000000000000001 sp 00007ffe3e316a58 error 14 in gvfsd-sftp[559f94955000+6000]
[505587.786958] Code: Bad RIP value.
[505856.692209] gvfsd-sftp[23767]: segfault at 559d0000000a ip 00007fa35323bc04 sp 00007ffc3f4d7d90 error 4 in libc-2.30.so[7fa3531c8000+178000]
[505856.692233] Code: c9 0f 11 4b 20 48 89 ee 66 48 0f 6e c0 48 83 ce 01 0f 16 44 24 08 48 89 73 08 0f 11 43 10 49 89 2c 24 48 85 d2 74 8f 48 89 d3 <48> 8b 43 08 89 c2 c1 ea 04 83 ea 02 49 8d 54 d7 10 49 39 d5 0f 85
```

If I try the same transfer using Filezilla, it completes flawlessly. Also, before Ubuntu 19.10 / Nautilus 3.34, I didn't have any problems with the same server either.

PS: this bug was first submitted on Ubuntu bug system, and contains an ubuntu-specific crash log: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gvfs/+bug/1853961

title: Network folder caching
description:
### Use cases
<!-- Describe what problem(s) the user is experiencing and that this request
is trying to solve. -->
When exploring a remote location (in my case a Samba filesystem) I frequently open a folder, see that what I'm looking for is not there, and go back up to check other folders. Every time I go back the contents are fetched again which takes more than 10 seconds, making the process extremely slow.

### Desired behavior
<!-- Describe the desired functionality. -->
The contents are extremely likely to remain unchanged, so they should be cached and shown instantly. New contents can be requested either manually via F5. Alternatively, they can be requested automatically and replace the cached contents when the request completes (although this could result in an issue of the user clicking right after the new contents are shown and going down a wrong folder if contents did change).

### Benefits of the solution
<!-- List the possible benefits of the solution and how it fits in the project. -->
Exploring network shares over a slow connection ~~stops being a torture~~ becomes twice as fast, and more, depending on the user's folder access pattern.

### Possible drawbacks
<!--
     Describe possible drawbacks of the feature and list how it could affect
     the project i.e. UI discoverability, complexity, impact in more or less
     number of users, etc.
-->
New contents for cached folders are not shown right away. However, if the user expects the contents to change, they can use F5 manually.

<!-- Ignore the text under this line. -->

title: Incoming file transfer notification hard to accept/decline
description: When a file is sent to a gnome/linux machine, gnome shows a floating notification in the top notification area that a file is incoming. You need to hover the mouse over the notification for the accept/decline buttons to appear. But if you accidentally mouse out again, the notification disappears and there is no way to get the accept/decline buttons back. Which means you have to wait for the transfer to time-out and then restart the transfer. Obviously this is quite bad UX. I don't know if the gnome notification system allows to get the notification and buttons back, or whether there is another place where gnome-bluetooth could show the incoming as well where you can still accept or decline them.

title: Headset delivers bad audio quality and low microphone volume on HSP/HFP mode
description:
I own a [Teufel Airy (2017) bluetooth headset](https://www.teufel.de/kopfhoerer/teufel-airy-2017-p15185.html) (bluetooth 4.0, aptX support) and like to use it as a headset through bluetooth on Fedora 31. The settings dialog allows me to connect it in A2DP mode (just playback, good sound quality) and in HSP/HFP mode. The letter one offers bad playback quality, the microphone seems to work, but the record levels are way too low. Knocking directly on the microphone produces just 3 to 8 dashes in the picture below.

![Bildschirmfoto_von_2019-12-10_15-59-33](/uploads/e3ab0a759351a5d6dfeb2ec3ad2adedb/Bildschirmfoto_von_2019-12-10_15-59-33.png)

Pulseaudio source details for my headset:
```
  * index: 30
	name: <bluez_source.A0_E9_DB_01_7E_D0.headset_head_unit>
	driver: <module-bluez5-device.c>
	flags: HARDWARE HW_VOLUME_CTRL LATENCY 
	state: RUNNING
	suspend cause: (none)
	priority: 9050
	volume: mono: 65536 / 100%
	        balance 0,00
	base volume: 65536 / 100%
	volume steps: 16
	muted: no
	current latency: 36,42 ms
	max rewind: 0 KiB
	sample spec: s16le 1ch 8000Hz
	channel map: mono
	             Mono
	used by: 1
	linked by: 1
	fixed latency: 28,00 ms
	card: 6 <bluez_card.A0_E9_DB_01_7E_D0>
	module: 28
	properties:
		bluetooth.protocol = "headset_head_unit"
		device.intended_roles = "phone"
		device.description = "Teufel AIRY"
		device.string = "A0:E9:DB:01:7E:D0"
		device.api = "bluez"
		device.class = "sound"
		device.bus = "bluetooth"
		device.form_factor = "headset"
		bluez.path = "/org/bluez/hci0/dev_A0_E9_DB_01_7E_D0"
		bluez.class = "0x240404"
		bluez.alias = "Teufel AIRY"
		device.icon_name = "audio-headset-bluetooth"
	ports:
		headset-input: Headset (priority 0, latency offset 0 usec, available: yes)
			properties:
				
	active port: <headset-input>

```

Info of bluetoothctl:
```
Device A0:E9:DB:01:7E:D0 (public)
	Name: Teufel AIRY
	Alias: Teufel AIRY
	Class: 0x00240404
	Icon: audio-card
	Paired: yes
	Trusted: yes
	Blocked: no
	Connected: yes
	LegacyPairing: no
	UUID: Headset                   (00001108-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Audio Sink                (0000110b-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: A/V Remote Control Target (0000110c-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: A/V Remote Control        (0000110e-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
	UUID: Handsfree                 (0000111e-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb)
```

If connected to my phone (Android 9), the playback quality is as intended, the record quality is as intended and playback quality in phone calls is as intended - perfectly fine.

I guess some part of the bluetooth system isn't supporting something or is misconfigured, but I don't know which part. I found this [bugreport on launchpad](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/pulseaudio/+bug/1838151) mentioning the issue and a possible solution which seems to be applied in ChromiumOS - they stated that the kernel/bluetooth stack isn't supporting modern HSP/HFP modes (which was standardized in 2011).

I don't know whether this is the correct channel to report this bug. If not, please report it to an appropriate upstream project, like bluez, pulseaudio or the linux kernel. I'd be happy to assist in gathering more logs.

My software versions:
Fedora 31
pulseaudio 13.0-rebootstrapped
bluetoothctl 5.52
kernel 5.3.14

title: bluetoothctl recognize device, gnome-bluetooth doesn't
description:
Hi, On SurfaceGo (arch, kernel 5.1.15) pen buttons are recognized when pairing using bluetoothctl :
evtest gives :
`/dev/input/event21:	Surface Pen Keyboard`
`/dev/input/event22:	Surface Pen`

and `xinput list` gives
`↳ Microsoft Surface Type Cover Consumer Control	id=17	[slave keyboard (3)]`
`↳ Surface Pen Keyboard id=19	[slave keyboard (3)]`

However pairing with gnome bluetooth control panel actually connects however buttons are not recognized. `xinput list` doesn't list the buttons. Can you help?

title: Please add styles for Yaru theme
description:
- Desktop icons do not change in any way when one selects them. The label should get background color.
- Input source popup looks ugly (#30).
- Brightness/sound OSD can have some border-radius.

title: Input source popup looks bad with non-standard themes
description:
Here is how it looks with Yaru theme:

![Screenshot](/uploads/8ab3342b87d02616db455d0d62ea8460/switcher.png)

Also note the `en` label to the right of `ru` which is barely visible.

It would be nice to have some fallback CSS that will set the correct size, borders and alignments for this popup for all themes. Maybe CSS rules that are common to `Adwaita/gnome-flashback.css` and `Adwaita/gnome-flashback-dark.css` should be copied also to `fallback.css`.

title: Desktop icons’ labels have very low contrast with some backgrounds
description:
For example, here is how it looks like with `/usr/share/backgrounds/budgie/window_in_window_by_stefan_serena.jpg` from Ubuntu package [`budgie-wallpapers-eoan`][1] and Ambiance theme:

![Screenshot](/uploads/db21e2df16a84ea77179d285078fcc86/desktop_icons.png)

It would be nice to use a different color in such cases (maybe based on average color, in this case white should work).

[1]: https://packages.ubuntu.com/eoan/all/budgie-wallpapers-eoan/download

title: Please add a possibility to permanently delete files on desktop with Shift+Delete
description:
Nautilus supports <kbd>Delete</kbd> for moving files to Trash, and <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Delete</kbd> for permanently deleting them.

Having a similar <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Delete</kbd> shortcut for files on desktop would be nice.

title: Renaming a Network Connection does not update the name in the UI
description: Issue: When you rename a connection in nm-connection-editor the new name is not displayed within nm-applet until network-manager is restarted or the computer is rebooted.![network-manager](/uploads/20507b7a2f4585e953083beb2d265d83/network-manager.png)

title: Simplify the process of connecting to a Wi-Fi network
description:
To connect to a Wi-Fi in GNOME 3.34, users have to do the following:

1. Open the System Menu.
2. Click on "Wi-Fi Not Connected".
3. Click on "Select Network".
4. Click on the network to which I want to connect.
5. Click on the "Connect" button.

It requires 5 clicks and 3 different UI widgets (System Menu, Wi-Fi submenu, and Wi-Fi networks dialog).

The process could be simplified by displaying a list of network directly under the Wi-Fi submenu. Clicking on one of them would connect to it. It would require 2 clicks and 1 widget less in most cases.

If the list of networks is too long, only the networks with the better signal strength could be listed and another option to connect to other networks could be added.

Here is a sketch of how the submenu could look like:

![System_menu_with_Wi-Fi_networks](/uploads/ca91db3119a53ad361765efdbca78936/System_menu_with_Wi-Fi_networks.png)

title: Display an empty Wi-Fi icon when the Wi-Fi is not connected
description:
When doing usability test for [Tails](https://tails.boum.org/), I often see people take some time to find out that they need to click in the top-right corner of the desktop to connect to a Wi-Fi network.

Displaying an empty Wi-Fi icon even when the Wi-Fi is not connected would provide a visual clue on where to find this core feature of the OS.

This issue is a learnability and discoverability issue and would mostly affect first time users. In the case of Tails, most of our users are not otherwise Linux users so it's a bit more severe but I think that it's in the interest of GNOME in general to ease to experience of first time users as we want many more of them :)

For example, that's how macOS does it too:

![empty](/uploads/c26391ebb2fa70d9e181a3fbb7cf5e23/empty.png)

Wi-Fi being by far the most common option for people to connect to the Internet these day, I think that it deserves some visibility on the desktop by default. The empty icon could also be displayed only when a Wi-Fi interface is being detected and not otherwise.

title: DBus API allows manipulation by any outside app that requests access
description:
Currently, any random application (running as the same user as the application exposing the a11y APIs, or as root) can open a connection and utilize the a11y APIs. For security reasons, we should find a way to tighten this. See the discussion at https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk/merge_requests/1120
Polkit might be useful here.

title: A better preview of each font in the content overview
description:
In the content overview, it is hard to tell the different fonts apart. Each one is mainly represented as two large letters, which doesn't give a good impression of what the font is like in general. The font name is also secondary to the letter preview and is hard to pick out.

A better content overview would:

 - have the font name first, and have it positioned and styled so that it can be easily picked out
 - have a more elaborate preview - a longer set of text formatted in the font (probably a pangram)
 - better delineate each font, by putting it in box of some kind (either a list box or a grid tile)
 - indicate which/how many weights are available for the font

A possible design for this can be seen [here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/app-mockups/blob/master/font-manager/font-manager.png).

title: Allow fonts to be removed/uninstalled
description:
Fonts allows you to install fonts and to see which fonts are installed. Logically, it would also make sense for it to allow fonts to be removed.

This would also facilitate https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-software/issues/861 .

title: Show different font weights as a single item
description:
In the content overview, each weight appears as a single item. For example, I see 5 items for Cantarell, each for one of its weights. When you select a font, you select the font itself, rather than a weight, and this is the way that the majority of software handles fonts. It would be good if Fonts did the same.

This would require that the page for each font shows each of the weights. There's some design work for this [here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/app-mockups/blob/master/font-manager/font-manager.png) which could be helpful.

title: Cobol: gedit "highlights" the entire file in red when file extension is ".cob".
description: Linux Mint 19.3 with the latest gedit version. When I open a file that has the .cob or .cbl file extension, gedit "highlights" every line in the document in bright red, which makes it very difficult to read. The same problem occurs with xed (so apparently they share definition files). If I change the "highlight mode" to "Plain Text", the bright red "highlight" no longer appears for that file, indicating that there is some sort of file store for exceptions to the (useless) Cobol highlighting.

title: [Language definition] The same context replaced by different languages do not retain their differences when used in an aggregate language
description:
(Tested with gtksourceview 4.4.0, gedit 3.34.0, Ubuntu 19.10)

If test-a.lang replaces `def:c-like-comment-multiline` (note: `style-ref="warning"`):

```xml
<context id="test-a-c-like-comment-multiline" style-ref="warning">
  <start>/\*</start>
  <end>\*/</end>
</context>

<replace id="def:c-like-comment-multiline" ref="test-a-c-like-comment-multiline"/>
```

and test-b.lang also replaces `def:c-like-comment-multiline` (note: `style-ref="error"`):

```xml
<context id="test-b-c-like-comment-multiline" style-ref="error">
  <start>/\*</start>
  <end>\*/</end>
</context>

<replace id="def:c-like-comment-multiline" ref="test-b-c-like-comment-multiline"/>
```

then, when the definitions are used separately there is no issue.

Highlighted with test-a.lang:

![test-a-lang](/uploads/2097b9e0d311ea02d058ca8d88f16311/test-a-lang.png)

Highlighted with test-b.lang:

![test-b-lang](/uploads/a3ec35966244a9f63143933f382cfe75/test-b-lang.png)

But if these two definitions are referenced by an "aggregate" language (test.lang):

```xml
<context id="test-a">
  <start>test-a {</start>
  <end>}</end>
  <include>
    <context ref="test-a:test-a"/>
  </include>
</context>

<context id="test-b">
  <start>test-b {</start>
  <end>}</end>
  <include>
    <context ref="test-b:test-b"/>
  </include>
</context>

<context id="test" class="no-spell-check">
  <include>
    <context ref="def:c-like-comment-multiline"/>
    <context ref="test-a"/>
    <context ref="test-b"/>
  </include>
</context>
```

then one of the replacement contexts (the "last" one, in some order) will be used for all three languages:

![test-lang](/uploads/dc95653f1c2870aca6409ddbc03b9b0f/test-lang.png)

This is probably working as designed, but I thought I should document this behaviour anyway.

(I encountered this while working on the HTML/CSS/JS definitions - html.lang references css.lang and javascript.lang to highlight code in `<style>` and `<script>` elements.)

This may become a more serious issue if there are more aggregate languages, e.g. if markdown.lang starts using other language definitions to highlight code in fenced code blocks:

    ```css
    body { color: red; }
    ```

Test files:
* [test-a.lang](/uploads/c2254b5fb49ac1ce73520079815ea3fd/test-a.lang)
* [test-b.lang](/uploads/0472f9fe9ba6c6fee25d1a93c7cdd1d2/test-b.lang)
* [test.lang](/uploads/f87c7ee94975da2ea6dc4fcf0fe52889/test.lang)
* [file.test](/uploads/3f278643db56f3050a87d7ac290ef5f4/file.test)

title: evolution wizard ignores email address change
description:
Description of problem:
Evolution ignores changes to the Email in Identity setting while on Exchange MAPI Server Type.

Version-Release number:
RHEL8.2.0 evolution-mapi-3.28.3-2.el8.x86_64

How reproducible:
100%

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have evolution-mapi installed.
2. Open evolution.
3. Add new account through evolution.
4. Enter name and email. Press Next.
5. Change Server Type to Exchange MAPI.
6. Enter data and press Authenticate.
7. Note the email.
8. Go back and change the email in Identity.
9. Go forward and press Authenticate.


Actual results:
Email was not changed.

Expected results:
Email was changed.

Additional info:

title: Data source “<email>@gmail.com” does not support OAuth 2.0 authentication
description:
Whenever I restart evolution, an info bar shows up that says:
Failed to connect “<email>@gmail.com”
Data source “<email>@gmail.com” does not support OAuth 2.0 authentication

With a "Reconnect" and an "Open Settings" button. Clicking "Reconnect" always works. Ideally, it would connect itself the first time around. Is there a particular reason why it needs to Reconnect?

title: Reduce addressbook and contacts data usage when on a metered connection
description: The IMAPX code has some ability to reduce its network traffic when the connection is metered, but there seems to be no equivalent code for the addressbook or contacts backends, or other mail backends. Is there scope to reduce the amount of data they use (or the frequency at which they check for updates) when the user’s on a metered connection?

title: No calendar events in gnome-shell or gnome-calendar
description:
I regularly notice that I have no calendar events in gnome-shell or gnome-calendar. When this happens, I have to reboot my computer to see calendar events again. In gnome-calendar, I also have no visible calendars displayed:

`systemctl --user status evolution-calendar-factory.service` says:


Today is Dec 08, but I think I didn't shut down my computer last night, so if the issue in refresh_thread_func() is to blame, then maybe it failed after running for five hours?

title: All import types disabled and no error message is confusing
description:
#### How to reproduce
1. Click *File* » *Import* menu item.
2. In the *Evolution Import Assistant* click *Next* button.
3. Choose *Import a single file* and click *Next* button.
4. Select a gzipped mbox file (e.g. https://lore.kernel.org/linux-wireless/1437542484-23409-2-git-send-email-ahmed.taahir@gmail.com/t.mbox.gz).
5. Now try to select a file type.

#### What happens
All combo box items are greyed out but there is no error message explaining why. It could be a bug, improperly installed importers, unknown file type, or some other weird issue.

#### What should happen
Error message explaining what is going on and how to make it work should be displayed.

#### System
* Evolution: 3.34.2
* e-d-s: 3.34.2
* OS: NixOS

title: Can't type Date into new appointment

The format validation should not take place until after I finish typing the complete date and either move the cursor to a different field or press Enter.

Evolution version 3.34.1-2
PopOS 19.10 64bit

title: OAuth2 error and a quick work around
description:
This morning I powered on to my OpenSUSE laptop to do some work. I went to go check my emails using my email client Evolution, and to my dismay I get a strange OAuth2 error for my google account. Well I did some research to bugs that were currently unsolved or mysteriously solved and didn't come up with any solutions. But, then I remembered that I set my account to log in automatically and decided to investigate that. Now this may be an OpenSUSE issue but the problem seems to be when automatically logging in Gnome Keyring DOES NOT unlock, because you never login with a password. **There is, however, a dialog to unlock the keyring when logging but it disappears quickly before you can do anything about it!** Now if I just automatically login and then go to the keyring and manually unlock it then try to use Evolution, I still get the OAuth2 Error. But setting my account to require me to login (which I assume properly unlocks the keyring) will allow me to start Evolution and use my google account with no issues. I suspect from other posts about how the keyring works with dbus that the initial attempt to unlock the keyring, that disappears at login, is possibly locking a file or in some other fashion holding up the keyring from properly being unlocked. Steps to reproduce: 1. Set account to automatically login at boot. 2. Restart computer 3. Unlock Keyring after computer boots 4. Open Evolution Expected Outcome: Evolution is able to get credentials and logs into google account. Actual Outcome: Evolution is unable to get credentials from keyring, and fails to log into google account. ![error](/uploads/9b08b3f7863e307640ef407c9ae88806/error.jpg) ![keyring](/uploads/0001727cd075945fbd83c37e1c9fbe51/keyring.jpg) Steps for Work Around: 1. Set account to require user to log in at boot 2. Restart computer 3. Open Evolution Outcome: Works as expected. Evolution Version: 3.34.2 System Information:

title: Contacts preview only passes wrong "Website URL" field value to browser as it goes to openstreetmap.org

when I open the entry  and go to field in which the website URLs are stored, I am shown an arrow, clicking on it correctly opens the browser.

If I just use the view/preview (and do not open the entry editor), the same link is shown, but clicking on it gets me to https://www.openstreetmap.org/search?query=URL.

This is Evolution 3.34.2 (3.34.2-1.fc31)

title: Very slow loading of search folders
description:
When I click on a search folder it takes a really long time to load. Although the folder has around 120,000 messages in it, when I run Evolution from terminal with all the debugging flags enabled there does not appear to be any IMAP transactions pending during the load. So it doesn't appear to be a server issue. 

Sometimes the folder loads in only a second or two, and other times it takes a minute or longer after I haven't clicked on it for a while.

I am using Evolution 3.34.1.

I noticed [this](https://forums.opensuse.org/showthread.php/483717-Evolution-Searches-Slow-Generating-Message-List) fellow from a few years ago is having a similar issue.

title: Some keyboard keys not working
description:
Evolution 3.34.1-2 on Ubuntu 19.10.

Keyboard not working in the email edit pane. In the email message editor, I can edit the address fields and subject with no problem, but when I type in the message edit pane, only the "7890" numbers, the characters "qwfjasfhzn" and the punctuation "[]\;',./`-=" keys work. I didn't test with shift key down. Some keys have special functions, "p" enables bold and "g" is page down.

Sometimes some of these keys don't work, for example in a one message editor window the "q" character no longer worked. Sometimes depending on how fast I type characters will show up, but sometimes the cursor moves right with no characters displayed. And sometimes there is a long delay but all the characters show up. 

I've tried an apt remove and apt install. No change. I have not deleted the configuration that was there before the upgrade to Ubuntu 19.10.

Completely removing the ~/.config/evolution directory and reconfiguring my email accounts did not fix the problem.

It's like the keyboard language is different for just the edit pane and there is a problem with the key press buffering.

title: Search Folder incorrectly shows "There are no messages in this folder" after clearing a quick search
description:
I've created a Unified Inbox by going to Edit > Search Folders and added in some custom rules which works perfect and shows all my emails from all my different email accounts.

Then I type in the Search box to search emails and it works perfect too and finds all the emails as expected.

The problem occurs when I then clear the Search Box - no emails are shown in my Unified Inbox anymore. I have to exit Evolution completely and then open it again to show the emails in my Unified Inbox once again.

title: Wizard Set Gmail SMTP Server Incorrectly
description:
After using the Evolution Account Setup Wizard to create a Gmail account I was unable to send mail. The reported error was: "Could not connect to smtp.googlemail.com: Network is unreachable.

The wizard had incorrectly set the SMTP server to smtp.googlemail.com. I changed it to smtp.gmail.com and this corrected the issue. 

Evolution 3.28.5-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 running on Linux Mint 19.2

title: Allow creation of event with start and end in different timezones
description: If I try to put in a flight which starts and ends in different timezones with evolution, I can't separately select the timezone for the start and end of the event: if I change the timezone after putting in the start time, it doesn't adjust the displayed time (I agree that this is right in some situations, but wrong in the case of a flight). Of course I can do the addition or subtraction, but this can be tricky if the start and end locations have different Daylight Saving Time rules: anyway it's the sort of thing that computers are supposed to do for us. I did try to build evolution and submit a patch, but it requires a whole chain of tools requiring other tools to be installed which aren't available on my distro (openSUSE-Leap-15.0). My evolution version is 3.26.6-lp150.3.3.1 from the OpenSUSE repo.

Of course I can scroll it, but as  issue #513 point out, the scrolling UI isn't very nice. Please provide a user preference to make the month view start up with the week containing today at the top. title: Filter match entry in log file is unclear
description:
I just wrote a filter _Spam-Beschwerde_ to forward messages with `@nl.` in `address` directly to the official complaints office of the EU (allgemeiner-spam@internet-beschwerdestelle.de).

The filter log part for _Spam-Beschwerde_: 

```
2019-12-08 09:43:06 - Applied filter "Spam_Beschwerde" to message from Reebok <reebok@nl.fitnessmagazin.de> - "Sebastian, exklusiv 40% Nachlass im Reebok Online Shop"
   Header 'From' value ' "Reebok" <reebok@nl.fitnessmagazin.de>' does match '@nl.'
   Finished test of message uid:914 subject:'Sebastian, exklusiv 40% Nachlass im Reebok Online Shop' from '@vivaldi.net : INBOX' as MATCHED
   Filter 'Spam_Beschwerde' matched

Action: Forward message to 'allgemeiner-spam@internet-beschwerdestelle.de'
Action: Set Seen flag
Action: Delete
   Filter 'Spam_Beschwerde' did not match
```

seems to match, but

1. in the very last line it is written `Filter 'Spam_Beschwerde' did not match` (which is confusing)
2. I cannot find any forwarded message relation to that email in evolution.
3. The next filter _Provider-Junk_ is processed for that email (see below). From documentation I expected the filtering is stopped after the first match.

The filter log part for _Provider-Junk_:

```
2019-12-08 09:43:07 - Applied filter "Provider-Junk" to message from Reebok <reebok@nl.fitnessmagazin.de> - "Sebastian, exklusiv 40% Nachlass im Reebok Online Shop"
   Header 'From' value ' "Reebok" <reebok@nl.fitnessmagazin.de>' does not match 'neu@mailings.web.de'
   Header 'From' value ' "Reebok" <reebok@nl.fitnessmagazin.de>' does match '@nl.'
   Finished test of message uid:914 subject:'Sebastian, exklusiv 40% Nachlass im Reebok Online Shop' from '@vivaldi.net : INBOX' as MATCHED
   Filter 'Provider-Junk' matched

Action: Stopped processing
Action: Delete
   Filter 'Provider-Junk' did not match

Stopped processing per request
```
 Here it's the same: the filter matched, but the very last line tells it doesn't. However in this case I found the email in the trash folder.

title: Evolution 3.34.2 flatpak mail setting "browser-close-on-delete-or-junk" not working?
description: On Ubuntu 18.04, I recently upgraded from Evolution 3.28 (via apt) to Evolution 3.34.2 (via flathub).  The primary reason was to get access to the org.gnome.evolution.mail setting "browser-close-on-delete-or-junk".  Unfortunately, it doesn't seem to exist.  I also saw a mail preference labeled "Go to previous message after message deletion", which I assumed controlled the same setting, but it doesn't seem to do anything.

title: [Flatpak] Can't seem to set default application
description:
Since upgrading to v. 3.34.1, Evolution doesn't seem to be aware of my default application preferences, even though they are set in both username/.config/mimeapps.list AND username/.var/app/org.gnome.Evolution/config.mimeapps files (confirmed via xdg-mime query default application/[file extension])

Seemingly as a result, when I try to open an attachment, whether by double-clicking, or by right-clicking and the choosing "Open With Default Application", Evolution opens a *minimized* "Portal" window (Gear Icon) that says "Select an application to open "filename.extension."" Choosing an application does allow me to open the attachment, but Evolution doesn't remember the selection, so this process has to be repeated for EVERY attachment.

Is this a known issue, or is there a known solution?

P.S. Using Ubuntu 18.04.3, and GNOME was updated within the last 6 weeks.

title: Evolution crashes unexpectedly; difficulty pinpointing cause
description:
I'm having a good deal of trouble using Evolution, it crashes (segmentation fault/SIGSEGV) very frequently, and I'm having some difficulty pinpointing exactly why. For background, I'm using evolution 3.34.1-2 on Ubuntu 19.10; using Evolution with 2 accounts, both Google.

Here's what I know:

CAMEL_DEBUG

Email was changed.

title: NetworkManager-openvpn does not send client_hw_addr to server
description:
Hello,
Fedora 31 here:

```
NetworkManager-openvpn-1.8.10-1.fc31.1.x86_64
NetworkManager-openvpn-gnome-1.8.10-1.fc31.1.x86_64
openvpn-2.4.8-1.fc31.x86_64
```

I'm trying to configure POST_AUTH MAC address validation with OpenVPN Access Server [(link)](https://openvpn.net/vpn-server-resources/access-server-post-auth-script-host-checking/), but when I connect with NetworkManager-openvpn the server returns the error:

```
AUTH: Received control message: AUTH_FAILED,VPN client is not reporting a MAC/UUID address. Please verify that a suitable OpenVPN client is being used.
```
On the server side, client_hw_addr attribute is missing:
```
2019-12-21T17:02:37+0100 [stdout#info] ********** POST_AUTH {'username': u'blablabla', 'pg_session_id': u'PG_XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX', 'client_session_id': None, 'pg_session_state': u'Initial', 'client_ip_addr': u'1.2.3.4'}
```

I imported the downloaded client.ovpn via `nmcli connection import type openvpn file client.ovpn` .

If I connect via openvpn client with the command:
```
openvpn --config client.ovpn
```
connection starts properly, and server side I can see client_hw_addr attribute correctly populated:
```
2019-12-21T17:14:29+0100 [stdout#info] ********** POST_AUTH {'username': u'blablabla', 'pg_session_id': u'PG_XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX', 'pg_session_state': u'Initial', 'client_hw_addr': u'ab:cd:ef:00:00:00', 'client_ip_addr': u'1.2.3.4', 'client_session_id': None, 'static_response': u'123456'}
```

Is there a way to configure NetworkManager-openvpn to populate and send client_hw_addr?

Thanks.

Best,
Federico Chiacchiaretta

title: Can't disable mssfix.

But plugin does not allowing it. See line https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/NetworkManager-openvpn/blob/master/src/nm-openvpn-service.c#L1771

title: UI too large on small displays
description:
When running clocks on an RPi 7" touchscreen, I get weird display inconsistencies when clicking on the stopwatch and timer tiles. It feels like the UI for those 2 tiles is not responsive on small screens, making the 3 window buttons (minimize, maximize and close) to disappear from the screen.

This is what the alarm tile looks like:
![full_screen_glitch_alarm](/uploads/232978b1f4e0b1d01e86f9b11f607d03/full_screen_glitch_alarm.png)

Here is what the stopwatch and timer tiles look like:
![full_screen_glitch_stopwatch](/uploads/8c9c4a03e8823825d2dea4aa51903129/full_screen_glitch_stopwatch.png)
![full_screen_glitch_timer](/uploads/bec4cb703e17409638d1e58f48793d0f/full_screen_glitch_timer.png)

You can see that most header elements are not aligned when switching between the world/alarm tiles to the stopwatch/timer tiles.

Note that this appears to be fixed by https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-clocks/merge_requests/38, but I'm not 100% sure of that, because for some reason when I merge both https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-clocks/merge_requests/38 and https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-clocks/merge_requests/42 together, the problem reappears. So https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-clocks/merge_requests/38 might just be "dodging" the real responsiveness problem.

title: Alarm volume ignores GNOME system setting for alert volume
description:

However, this alert volume won't affect the volume of the alarm played by `gnome-clocks`. I'm not sure this can be fixed from `gnome-clocks`, as I would be expecting `gsound` to use that alert volume when playing a sound of type `alarm`, [which is what is happening here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-clocks/blob/9211438ad82c0f4fddf7c4ad80194962ecba2bf6/src/utils.vala#L333)

description:

title: Feature: Prioritize alarm ringing sound

It would be nice if `clocks` pauses the sound of other applications while an alarm is ringing, if that's even possible.

description:
This is what the alarm ringing screen looks like on an RPi 7" touchscreen:
![alarm_ringing_ui](/uploads/ea73b143eddf96d05b88e34b9924bf44/alarm_ringing_ui.png)

It makes it kinda difficult to snooze (button on the border, not super large). I was wondering if people had ideas on how to improve that UI for smaller screens / touch screens.


@ZanderBrown were you planning to tackle that during your alarm screen redesign?

title: custom snooze duration
description: Right now the snooze duration is hardcoded to 9 minutes [here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-clocks/blob/10e77a9e798d83dd3c86c4c9c3235888f9eba7ae/src/alarm.vala#L28). It would be nice to have that configurable from the alarm setup dialog.

title: Issue: Alarm sound should stop ringing after a reasonable time period
description: Can we set the duration of alarm sound? (for example, we might want the alarm to stop ringing after 30 seconds)

title: Search provider for quickly setting timers/alarms
description:
It would be very cool to be able to quickly set timers or alarms from shell search. For example:
- "5 min timer"
- "alarm tomorrow at 9"
- "start a timer for 20 minutes"

Similar to calculator queries, if the phrase in the search input matches a format we recongize, there'd be a search result for clocks previewing the timer/alarm.

![image](/uploads/3e29459b768c983b0566e60b7f327efb/image.png)

title: Feature: world-clock time table view
description:
When collaborating with colleagues in other parts of the world, or finding a time to call my parents ~10 timezones away, I either try to remember the unix `date` command invocation to convert timezones (e.g., see [this SuperUser answer](https://superuser.com/a/164354)), or turn to a tool like the [World Meeting Planner](https://www.worldtimeserver.com/meeting-planner.aspx) to get an idea of convenient times for everyone involved. Here's a screenshot:

![meeting-planner](/uploads/8b4ff75a830a8246a2c28d9227840585/meeting-planner.png)

It would be nice to be able to do this offline, and Clocks seems like it might be a good fit (Calendar doesn't really have a world-clock view). The World Clocks feature currently only says the current time in each timezone, and a table view could help with scheduling events in the future (so it would also be nice to view such a table for some other date than the current one).

I am concerned that adding such a feature might make Clocks' UI confusing, but on the other hand it would contribute to making GNOME even more useful. I'm thinking it could be some toggle that switches the current box view into a table. If fact, as I was writing up this issue I found there were some [mockups](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/app-mockups/commit/7f35a77f50c173897927714a319765ca1643591d) for this already (thanks: https://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2019/12/new-gnome-app-mockups), although it sounds like it might be preferred as a separate app? 

Thoughts?

title: make flash, sound and saving in recent files configureable
description:
The following Merge Request (MR) has been forwarded from GitHub in order to prevent
the GNOME Project from losing contributions coming from un-official channels. And for
contributors to not see their valuable contributions not being accounted for.

Relevant information:

Github handle: tim0s

MR URL: https://github.com/GNOME/gnome-screenshot/pull/5

Patch URL: https://github.com/GNOME/gnome-screenshot/pull/5.patch

Body of the MR:

When invoking gnome-screenshot via command line in a script, e.g., to take many screenshots for a tutorial, the constant flashing / shutter sound gets annoying. Previously there were many alternatives for this use-case, e.g., scrot. But since these command-line screenshot tools do not deal with Wayland atm, I opted for adding switches to gnome-screenshot.

title: GIMP User Manual Svenska is not found  The requested URL /2.10/sv was not found on this server.
Slightly misleading documentation for the Sample Points
description:
GIMP version: 2.10.14

Operating System: Online documentation 

# Description of the bug

The doc on sample points at https://docs.gimp.org/2.10/en/gimp-sample-point-dialog.html
doesn't mention that the operations to move/delete sample points require the Color picker tools to be active. Since it says "*You can delete a sample point, as you do with guides, by click-and-dragging it up to a rule*", users expect it to work the same way, with the Move tool.

# Reproduction

1. Create a sample point
2. Activate the Move tool
3. Click on a sample point and drag to move it
…

Expected result:

* The sample point moves

Actual result:

* A layer moves

title: Seaching for a quoted full sentence doesn't seem to work
description:
The [documentation on the wiki](https://wiki.gnome.org/Projects/Tracker/Documentation/Examples/SPARQL/FTS#Sentences) suggests you can search for a full sentence by quoting the text with double quotes.

I noticed that we don't test this feature properly. Having added a test, I discovered that it seems to be broken: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/tracker-miners/merge_requests/132

Related with https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk/issues/616#note_672588

title: Tracker calling unimplemented `sched_setscheduler` on musl
description: `sched_setscheduler` is only a stub on musl. Upstream recommends using pthread's `pthread_setschedparam` instead: https://www.openwall.com/lists/musl/2016/03/01/5

title: FTBFS on non-linux architectures
description:
Hello,

Currently tracker FTBFS on non-linux architectures:

> cc -Isrc/libtracker-common/12e1c39@@tracker-common@sta -Isrc/libtracker-common -I../src/libtracker-common -I./ -I.././ -Isrc/ -I../src/ -I/usr/include/glib-2.0 -I/usr/lib/i386-gnu/glib-2.0/include -I/usr/include/gio-unix-2.0 -fdiagnostics-color=always -pipe -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -Wformat -Wformat-security -Wno-pointer-sign -DTRACKER_COMPILATION '-DG_LOG_DOMAIN="Tracker"' -g -O2 -fdebug-prefix-map=/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -fPIC -pthread -D_GNU_SOURCE -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE -MD -MQ 'src/libtracker-common/12e1c39@@tracker-common@sta/tracker-file-utils.c.o' -MF 'src/libtracker-common/12e1c39@@tracker-common@sta/tracker-file-utils.c.o.d' -o 'src/libtracker-common/12e1c39@@tracker-common@sta/tracker-file-utils.c.o' -c ../src/libtracker-common/tracker-file-utils.c
> ../src/libtracker-common/tracker-file-utils.c:256:19: error: #if with no expression
>   256 | #if HAVE_STATVFS64
>       |                   ^
> ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.

Shouldn't it be `#ifdef HAVE_STATVFS64` instead of `#if HAVE_STATVFS64`?
https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/tracker/blob/master/src/libtracker-common/tracker-file-utils.c#L254

title: an unfinished/corrupted midi file puts tracker out of service
description:
I have found that one of the files on my harddrive makes `/usr/lib/tracker-extract` consume the whole CPU while not making any progress. The file is a midi (.kar) file which timidity plays fine but after some minutes reports `Terminated sig=0x02`.

To reproduce:
- copy the attached file [White_Room.kar](/uploads/42929edfea4f438ac1432d4505533f2c/White_Room.kar) to any of the directories watched by tracker
- observe system behaviour

```
$ tracker daemon
..
0%  Extractor               - Extracting metadata 
$ htop
```

Removing the file and restarting extract service (`systemctl --user restart tracker-extract.service`) fixes the problem.

Tracker: 2.3.0
Arch Linux: current, x86_64

title: Investigate if we could usefully respond to signals from low-memory-monitor
description:
A new project named [low-memory-monitor](https://www.hadess.net/2019/12/gmemorymonitor-low-memory-monitor-2nd.html) might help desktops avoid situations where Tracker contributes memory pressure stalls on Linux systems.

I don't want to make assumptions about whether Tracker triggers these situations or what we might do to prevent them, however if someone does investigations into https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/tracker-miners/issues/77 then it would be sensible to test this at the same time.

title: Add CI pipeline that runs tests on Ubuntu
description: Tracker is installed by default since Ubuntu 19.04, it will be useful for us to actively do CI on this platform instead of only Fedora.

version: tracker-2.3.1-1.fc31

title: "jhbuild sanitycheck --help" return first translation string
description:
When running `jhbuild sanitycheck --help` in a locale other then `C`, JHBuild will print the very first translation string in the translation files, which is the one with Gettext headers like Project-Id-Version, Report-Msgid-Bugs-To, PO-Revision-Date. This does not happen when forcing C locale, like `LC_ALL=C jhbuild sanitycheck --help`.

This normally happens when printing an empty string, because the above string has source content `""` (nothing) and its translation has the aforementioned headers. For example:

```
$ jhbuild sanitycheck --help
Usage: jhbuild sanitycheck Project-Id-Version: jhbuild
Report-Msgid-Bugs-To: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/jhbuild/issues
PO-Revision-Date: 2019-11-24 21:54-0300
Last-Translator: Rafael Fontenelle <rafaelff@gnome.org>
Language-Team: Brazilian Portuguese <gnome-pt_br-list@gnome.org>
Language: pt_BR
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
Plural-Forms: nplurals=2; plural=(n > 1)
X-Generator: Gtranslator 3.32.0
X-Project-Style: gnome


Verifica se as ferramentas necessárias para apoio estão disponíveis

Options:
  -h, --help  show this help message and exit
```

Maybe [sanitycheck.py setting `usage_args=''`](GNOME/jhbuild/blob/master/jhbuild/commands/sanitycheck.py#L39) is ending up in printing the empty string?

title: "python2" symlink conflicts with Python 2 package
description:
While updating [Arch Linux AUR package](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/jhbuild/) from 3.34 to 3.35.2, I notice that "make install" is now installing symlink at `/usr/bin/python2` pointing to `/usr/bin/python`, which conflicts with [python2](https://www.archlinux.org/packages/extra/x86_64/python2/files) package's `/usr/bin/python2` file.

My guess is that the commit 6007add3 made `scripts/debian-python2-postinstall-hook.sh` run on any distro, even on Arch Linux.

For now I'm removing this symlink in my build script, but can it be fixed to install only where it is required?

When running `make -k check` to test newly built JHBuild, I get the following error output (see [check.txt](/uploads/c319415eca013d937ac8389127dfa1e5/check.txt) for full check output):

title: libgweather missing build file: 'schemas/meson.build'
description:
I am trying to build gnome-shell with a newly checked out jhbuild on Fedora 31:
1. `jhbuild update gnome-shell`
2. `jhbuild build gnome-shell`

It fails at `libgweather` with
`meson.build:120:0: ERROR: Non-existent build file 'schemas/meson.build'`. The line in questions contains `subdir('schemas')` but there is no folder `schemas`. The same goes for the folder `po`.

For some reason, these folders have been deleted during the checkout. This can be seen by `deleted:` in `git status`. A `git reset --hard` fixes the issue but it stays unclear why this happens in the first place.

title: switching build system from meson to autogen
description:
I try to bisect an issue with mutter and need to go back to a version that does not support meson.

If I check out and older version without meson build support and rebuild via `jhbuild buildone -cn mutter` I will get the error message `ERROR: Neither directory contains a build file meson.build.` since there is no meson build file, just `autogen.sh`.

I tried to run with `--autogen` and removed the build folder via `rm -r ~/.cache/jhbuild/build/mutter/` to no avail, jhbuild is still trying to build with meson.

title: Empty personal certificates in fresh install
description:
In an up-to-date Fedora 31 Workstation installation, there are several empty personal certificates in the `Default Trust` section. Seahorse 3.34 (3.34-1.fc31)

Those certificates are empty both when showing their properties and when imported.

Is this an expected behavior? From which path(s) would be Seahorse retrieving those certificates?


This also seems to happen in other distributions (Arch in this case):

https://bbs.archlinux.org/viewtopic.php?id=249704

```console
$ seahorse
684074 segmentation fault  seahorse
```

title: Add support for encrypting/decrypting clipboard contents
description:
This would be a nice feature like in kgpg.

In the older GNOME version, there were at least the Seahorse plugins,
so that you could do this with gedit, but without that, you have to save the text in a file in order to decrypt it, which is somewhat inconvenient.

title: [CodeGen error] invalid operands of the binary operation
Add ISO 646
description:
http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/ciso646/  
Use clear words like `and` `or` `not` instead of `&&` `||` `!`

title: Add possibility to add C macros from Vala.
description:
For example, it would be cool to be able to mark a pure function with G_GNU C_CONST or G_GNU C_PURE.  
As far as I know vala now automatically [puts them](https://mail.gnome.org/archives/vala-list/2010-August/msg00098.html) for `get_type`. I guess it's best to implement this as ccode code attribute.

title: Report: allow to save errors and warning for a Language Server use
description:
Currently Report, just print errors and warnings to the standard error and output, but that is not good for a Language Server like GVls serving a client with errors and warnings to allow it to show up to the user in an IED GUI program, for example.

In order to improve this situation is recommended to:

* [ ]  Add a `GLib.List` holding the errors and warnings, its location, source and message
* [ ]  Add a `CodeContext` parameter to instruct `report' to store them instead of print out.
* [ ]  Make sure the stored messages are released after they were used by the caller

title: CodeContext: Add options parser
description:
Currently `compiler/valacompiler.vala` has the possibility to parse input options, but a Language Server will never run `valac` but setup a `Context` and run parsing/Resolver/SemanticAnalyzer/FlowAnalyzer to get a report of all incidents found in a given build enviroment.

Move all options parsing to `CodeContext` will provide that features for free to just pass an array of options to the context. For now GVls is going to copy/paste in order to help setup a `CodeContext` for the given options from the LSP Client.

title: valac critical and odd error assigning va_args to class member
New window creation
description:
There is an menu item to create new windows https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gitg/issues/214, but its only visible if no project is active. I need to exit an open project to open a new window (weird workflow btw).

In gnome-shell, a [middle click](https://help.gnome.org/users/gnome-help/stable/mouse-middleclick.html.en) on the app-icon should invoke the new window creation. This is not working for gitg currently. I don't know the underlying mechanism, but it seems as if gitg is forcing single-instance behavior on purpose. Are there reasons for that?

description:
It seems that the problem was introduced in commit 7adba4541cdd612c0e06d6d4cc3b6690172aa9a9.
```
[171/199] Compiling C object 'gitg/25a9a22@@gitg@exe/meson-generated_commit_gitg-commit-dialog.c.o'.

clang -B/home/lantw44/.local/bin -Igitg/25a9a22@@gitg@exe -Igitg -I../../source/gitg/gitg -I. -I../../source/gitg/ -Ilibgitg-ext -I../../source/gitg/libgitg-ext -Ilibgitg -I../../source/gitg/libgitg -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/gobject-introspection-1.0 -I/usr/local/lib/libffi-3.2.1/include -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/glib-2.0 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/lib/glib-2.0/include -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/gtksourceview-4 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/gtk-3.0 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/pango-1.0 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/harfbuzz -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/fribidi -I/usr/local/include/freetype2 -I/usr/local/include/libpng16 -I/usr/local/include/uuid -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/cairo -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/pixman-1 -I/usr/local/include/libdrm -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/gdk-pixbuf-2.0 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/gio-unix-2.0 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/atk-1.0 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/at-spi2-atk/2.0 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/at-spi-2.0 -I/usr/local/include/dbus-1.0 -I/usr/local/lib/dbus-1.0/include -I/usr/local/include/libxml2 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/gspell-1 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/enchant-2 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/gee-0.8 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/libgit2-glib-1.0 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/libdazzle-1.0 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/libpeas-1.0 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/json-glib-1.0 -Xclang -fcolor-diagnostics -pipe -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -w -O2 -g -DHAVE_CONFIG_H '-DG_LOG_DOMAIN="gitg"' -march=corei7 -B/home/lantw44/.local/bin -g3 -Og -gz -Wno-error=format-nonliteral -pthread -DGIT_SSH=1 -D_THREAD_SAFE -Werror=format=2 -Werror=implicit-function-declaration -Werror=init-self -Werror=missing-include-dirs -Werror=missing-prototypes -Werror=pointer-arith -Werror=return-type -Wmissing-declarations -Wnested-externs -Wstrict-prototypes -Wuninitialized '-DDATADIR="/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/share"' '-DGITG_DATADIR="/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/share/gitg"' '-DGITG_LOCALEDIR="/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/share/locale"' -MD -MQ 'gitg/25a9a22@@gitg@exe/meson-generated_commit_gitg-commit-dialog.c.o' -MF 'gitg/25a9a22@@gitg@exe/meson-generated_commit_gitg-commit-dialog.c.o.d' -o 'gitg/25a9a22@@gitg@exe/meson-generated_commit_gitg-commit-dialog.c.o' -c 'gitg/25a9a22@@gitg@exe/commit/gitg-commit-dialog.c'
../../source/gitg/gitg/commit/gitg-commit-dialog.vala:907:32: error: format string is not a string literal [-Werror,-Wformat-nonliteral]
                                _tmp40_ = g_strdup_printf (_tmp36_, _tmp39_);
                                                           ^~~~~~~
../../source/gitg/gitg/commit/gitg-commit-dialog.vala:910:32: error: format string is not a string literal [-Werror,-Wformat-nonliteral]
                                _tmp52_ = g_strdup_printf (_tmp48_, _tmp51_);
                                                           ^~~~~~~
2 errors generated.
```

The problem comes from these lines of code:
```vala
 907                     var command = @"echo $commit_msg > %s".printf(file.get_path());
 908                     Posix.system(command);
 909 
 910                     command = @"$hook_name %s $commit_src $commit_sha".printf(file.get_path());
 911                     Posix.system(command);
```

A string template is not a string literal. `@` should be removed and `$variable` should be replaced by `%s`. In addition to the format string problem, this code also generates shell commands without quoting arguments, making it vulnerable to shell injection. To generate a shell command safely, arguments should be quoted with `g_shell_quote`, so special characters won't break the script.

title: Cache file with no loaders generated on Windows by gdk-pixbuf-query-loaders if MODULEDIR path contains non-Latin characters
description:
When the path of `gdk-pixbuf` on Windows contains non-Latin characters (in this case cyrillic letters), running `gdk-pixbuf-query-loaders.exe` will succeed in generating a `loaders.cache` file, except it will not contain any loader and only the starting header. Looking at the code, presumably the moduledir cannot be read, therefore not finding any modules (in this setup, the module dir is also a path with cyrillic letters set using the `GDK_PIXBUF_MODULEDIR` variable, the directory structure is much like the msys2/mingw build).

It should be reproduced by putting gdk-pixbuf in a directory path containing cyrillic characters, particular the module dir, and then setting `GDK_PIXBUF_MODULEDIR` to that directory before running `gdk-pixbuf-query-loaders.exe`. it should generate an almost empty `loaders.cache` file in the usual path.

Version: gdk-pixbuf v2.38.2  
OS: Windows 10 64-bit

title: Add feature: NORMAL SORTING
description:
normally in some sheet application sorting a column will sort all the other column following the selected sorting column. But, in Gnumeric, it doesn't, and I couldn't find the way to make it work.

Generic sort in Sheet application:
Normal:
C-2
A-4
D-1
B-3
Sorting the ABC:
A-4
B-3
C-2
D-1
Sorting the Number:
D-1
C-2
B-3
A-4

Bad way sorting, in Gnumeric:
Normal:
C-2
A-4
D-1
B-3
Sorting the first column:
A-2
B-4
C-1
D-3
As we can see here, the sorting is only happen to the first column which is rarely need to have, most people have the child table data just right next to the child or main data itself.

title: data labels : another batch of CRITICAL assertions

title: "make install" scribbles outside the --prefix
description:
## Rationale and Background:
*  It would be nice to be able to install multiple independent copies of gnumeric on the same machine, without bothering with full-blown virtual machines.  This facilitates comparative testing.
*  It would be nice if a non-root user could compile from scratch a working copy of gnumeric. Unix is supposed to be a multi-user operating system, usable by non-root users.

## Expected behavior:
*  I would expect the --prefix option to ./configure to produce the desired result.

## Observed behavior:
*  --prefix works as expected for libgsf and for goffice
*  Alas, for gnumeric itself, "make install" insists on replacing certain system-wide files, no matter what --prefix says.  Specifically, for a non-privileged user, the following errors are observed:
```
/usr/bin/install: cannot remove '/usr/share/gir-1.0/Gnm-1.12.gir': Permission denied
/usr/bin/install: cannot remove '/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/girepository-1.0/Gnm-1.12.typelib': Permission denied
install: cannot remove '/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/gi/overrides/Gnm.py': Permission denied
```

Is there some way around this?  I looked at ./configure --help and didn't see anything relevant.

The full typescript is here: [install-muggle.logg](/uploads/190a1e45b9494429d8ee064ee86c7763/install-muggle.logg)

title: segfault : data labels
description:
**Recipe 1:**  Read in the attached file [data-labels-crash-del.gnumeric](/uploads/550946b966c738ce1866f8f6641ed753/data-labels-crash-del.gnumeric).
Select the A1 cell and hit the <Delete> key.
Observe immediate segmentation fault.

**Recipe 2:**  Read in the slightly less boiled-down file [data-labels-crash-pos.gnumeric](/uploads/37e2f4a5739dcd732f47ed98938285da/data-labels-crash-pos.gnumeric).
Observe many hundreds of messages such as the following:

```
 ** (gnumeric:13805): CRITICAL **: 17:29:33.592: go_data_vector_get_str: assertion '(int)i < vec-len' failed

 ** (gnumeric:13805): CRITICAL **: 17:29:33.593: go_data_vector_get_markup: assertion '(int)i < vec-len' failed
```


Select the A1 cell, then either
*  hit the <Delete> key, or
*  enter a smallish non-negative number.

Observe hundreds of additional CRITICAL messages, followed by an immediate segmentation fault.

**Discussion:** I don't know whether this is two manifestations of the same bug, or two completely different bugs.  The presentation is similar but not identical.  In particular, recipe 1 requires <Delete> (not a plain number) and does not scribble error messages on the terminal.

This is not a newly-introduced bug. It has been bugging me for a long time.  It's only now that I took the time to create a stripped-down test/demonstration case.  Its is observed with the lastest git version of gnumeric, and with a variety of previous versions.

title: gnumeric cut to paste broken (due to "remmina" clipboard manager being installed)
description: I am using Debian Sid and am currently using gnumeric 1.12.46-1.  I have used gnumeric for over a decade.  Currently, if I use copy/paste everything is normal.  If I use cut/paste, the cut cells or text disappear and do not paste, apparently never being copied to the clipboard.  I found this problem in a file from csv, but then created a new blank file and still had the problem.  I restarted the laptop with the idea that maybe the X clipboard was broken, but with no change.  I can use other programs and they cut and paste properly, e.g. libreoffice and gedit.  I can cut from another program and paste into gnumeric with no problem, but if I cut in gnumeric, the info is gone and cannot be pasted into gnumeric or any other program. This behavior is the same whether I use Ctrl+X or the menu. I don't see this reported elsewhere.  This is definitely new behavior.  I was doing the same thing a month ago with no problem, but I assume there has been an update since then.

title: Gtk4 port
description:

title: Fail to compile with Exiv2 0.27.2
description:
```
[6/23] Compiling C++ object 'gexiv2/1a6c516@@gexiv2@sha/gexiv2-metadata.cpp.o'.
FAILED: gexiv2/1a6c516@@gexiv2@sha/gexiv2-metadata.cpp.o 
clang++ -B/home/lantw44/.local/bin -Igexiv2/1a6c516@@gexiv2@sha -Igexiv2 -I../../source/gexiv2/gexiv2 -Igexiv2/.. -I../../source/gexiv2/gexiv2/.. -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/include/glib-2.0 -I/home/lantw44/gnome/devinstall/lib/glib-2.0/include -I/usr/local/lib/libffi-3.2.1/include -Xclang -fcolor-diagnostics -pipe -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -Wall -Winvalid-pch -Wnon-virtual-dtor -std=c++11 -O2 -g -march=corei7 -B/home/lantw44/.local/bin -g3 -Og -gz -fdebug-macro -fPIC -pthread -MD -MQ 'gexiv2/1a6c516@@gexiv2@sha/gexiv2-metadata.cpp.o' -MF 'gexiv2/1a6c516@@gexiv2@sha/gexiv2-metadata.cpp.o.d' -o 'gexiv2/1a6c516@@gexiv2@sha/gexiv2-metadata.cpp.o' -c ../../source/gexiv2/gexiv2/gexiv2-metadata.cpp
../../source/gexiv2/gexiv2/gexiv2-metadata.cpp:90:26: error: non-constant-expression cannot be narrowed from type 'size_t' (aka 'unsigned long') to 'long' in initializer list [-Wc++11-narrowing]
        Exiv2::DataBuf b{rcount};
                         ^~~~~~
../../source/gexiv2/gexiv2/gexiv2-metadata.cpp:90:26: note: insert an explicit cast to silence this issue
        Exiv2::DataBuf b{rcount};
                         ^~~~~~
                         static_cast<long>( )
1 error generated.
```

In Exiv2 0.27.2, the constructor is declared as `explicit DataBuf(long size);`, and passing `size_t` (which is unsigned) is not allowed.

title: gtk-demo/example_glarea.cc throws "Couldn't find current GLX or EGL context.\n" on closing window
description:
Compiling the gtkmm-demos from source, then selecting "OpenGL Area" -> "Run" and then closing the window results in:
```
 ┌─gerlof@gerlof-laptop ~/packages/arch/packages/gtkmm3/trunk/src/gtkmm/demos (makepkg *) $
 └─╼./gtk-demo/gtkmm-demo 
 lt-gtkmm-demo: ../libepoxy/src/dispatch_common.c:863: epoxy_get_proc_address: Assertion `0 && "Couldn't find current GLX or EGL context.\n"' failed.
 Aborted (core dumped)
```

Software versions:
- gtk: 3.24.13
- gtkmm-3.0: 3.24.2
- libepoxy: 1.5.4

See also https://mail.gnome.org/archives/gtkmm-list/2019-December/msg00000.html

To summarize from the mailing list:

A minimal application illustrating the issue (almost verbatim copy of the gtkmm-demo):  
https://gist.github.com/gfokkema/a0c73de5c9df476b5b31057ebb63394f/39cac57cca915432c43ecb4d5dcb8eaad35fabf0

Results in the output:
```
┌─gerlof@gerlof-laptop ~/workspace/gtk-renderer (master *+) $
└─╼./a.out 
Realize context: 0x55d1f7aafe60
Destructor context: 0x55d1f7aafe60
Unrealize context: (nil)
a.out: ../libepoxy/src/dispatch_common.c:863: epoxy_get_proc_address: Assertion `0 && "Couldn't find current GLX or EGL context.\n"' failed.
Aborted (core dumped)
```

Setting breakpoints at:
- gtkglarea.c:195: gtk_gl_area_dispose
- gtkglarea.c:575: gtk_gl_area_unrealize

Reveals that when using Gtk::GLArea as a class member, gtk_gl_area_dispose is called before gtk_gl_area_unrealize.  
Since gtk_gl_area_dispose clears the opengl context, gtk_gl_area_unrealize then has no reference to the context anymore, resulting in (nil).

When using Gtk::GLArea as a managed widget, the issue disappears, gtk_gl_area_unrealize is called before gtk_gl_area_dispose.  
The last revision of the linked gist shows changes i made for a working version:  
https://gist.github.com/gfokkema/a0c73de5c9df476b5b31057ebb63394f/revisions  
https://gist.github.com/gfokkema/a0c73de5c9df476b5b31057ebb63394f/5bef8962fa2de35d30fc9e84dcf7536d35ab8c8c

Results in the output:
```
┌─gerlof@gerlof-laptop ~/workspace/gtk-renderer (master *+) $
└─╼./a.out 
Realize context: 0x5613daaa35d0
Destructor context: 0x5613daaa35d0
Unrealize context: 0x5613daaa35d0
```

title: Word break not supported for Chinese ('zh') and/or Unihan in general
description:
I have been looking into fixing Geary bug GNOME/geary#121, where a search query entered in Chinese such as `男子去` is not properly tokenised into two words (`男子` and `去`), whereas a search in English such as `test search` would be.

Using Pango seemed to be a good solution for this since I can use `pango_get_log_attrs()` to analyse the search text, however  after implementing this, it seems that word-break analysis for Chinese (using `zh` as the language) doesn't work, whereas it does for both English and Thai.

So this is a request to have this implemented for Chinese, but perhaps the Unihan database could be used as a basis for implementing this for the Han unification languages in general?

title: Gtk reftests broken with pango 1.44 [hyphenation changes]
description:
Compare the "button-wrapping" reftest from gtk3

what gtk created:
![button-wrapping.out](/uploads/9c250ca0b0af8ad884afee223dc2a4e5/button-wrapping.out.png)

the reference image:
![button-wrapping.ref](/uploads/4bf42f8fae5459cd945057c8876a5fd3/button-wrapping.ref.png)

there's some extra spacing now. The test fails. I bisected pango and this commit was the one to break it

```
commit eb4882cada397268948ec24da046ff75615dfb9e (HEAD, refs/bisect/bad)
Author: Matthias Clasen <mclasen@redhat.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 15 23:15:35 2019 -0400

    Insert hyphens in more places
    
    Look for whether the char before the break
    is not whitespace and doesn't look like a
    hyphen.

diff --git a/pango/pango-layout.c b/pango/pango-layout.c
index 2387e1cd..255fe90a 100644
--- a/pango/pango-layout.c
+++ b/pango/pango-layout.c
@@ -3405,8 +3405,37 @@ get_need_hyphen (PangoItem  *item,
 
   for (i = 0, p = text + item->offset; i < item->num_chars; i++, p = g_utf8_next_char (p))
     {
-      gunichar ch = g_utf8_get_char (p);
-      need_hyphen[i] = ch == 0xad;
+      gunichar wc = g_utf8_get_char (p);
+      switch (g_unichar_type(wc))
+        {
+        case G_UNICODE_SPACE_SEPARATOR:
+        case G_UNICODE_LINE_SEPARATOR:
+        case G_UNICODE_PARAGRAPH_SEPARATOR:
+          need_hyphen[i] = FALSE;
+          break;
+        case G_UNICODE_CONTROL:
+          if (wc == '\t' || wc == '\n' || wc == '\r' || wc == '\f')
+            need_hyphen[i] = FALSE;
+          else
+            need_hyphen[i] = TRUE;
+          break;
+        default:
+          if (wc == '-'    || /* Hyphen-minus */
+              wc == 0x058a || /* Armenian hyphen */
+              wc == 0x1400 || /* Canadian syllabics hyphen */
+              wc == 0x1806 || /* Mongolian todo hyphen */
+              wc == 0x2010 || /* Hyphen */
+              wc == 0x2027 || /* Hyphenation point */
+              wc == 0x2e17 || /* Double oblique hyphen */
+              wc == 0x2e40 || /* Double hyphen */
+              wc == 0x30a0 || /* Katakana-Hiragana double hyphen */
+              wc == 0xfe63 || /* Small hyphen-minus */
+              wc == 0xff0d)   /* Fullwidth hyphen-minus */
+            need_hyphen[i] = FALSE;
+          else
+            need_hyphen[i] = TRUE;
+          break;
+        }
     }
 }
```

at first glance it seems that `need_hyphen` would be set for anything which *was* a `0xad` hyphen before, and now it is set for anything which is *not* a hyphen. And this somehow results in the extra space being allocated.

Is the problem that we are doing this at the end of the text? This fixes it:

```
diff --git a/pango/pango-layout.c b/pango/pango-layout.c
index 255fe90a..2a23ceb0 100644
--- a/pango/pango-layout.c
+++ b/pango/pango-layout.c
@@ -3612,6 +3612,8 @@ process_item (PangoLayout     *layout,
 	  pango_glyph_item_get_logical_widths (&glyph_item, layout->text, state->log_widths);
 	  state->need_hyphen = g_new (int, item->num_chars);
           get_need_hyphen (item, layout->text, state->need_hyphen);
+          if (item->num_chars > 0)
+              state->need_hyphen[item->num_chars - 1] = FALSE;
 	}
 
     retry_break:
```

but I don't really understand what's going on here, that's probably wrong for some reason (e.g. I just checked this one reftest, not all of them).

title: atkmm 2.29.1
description:

title: I am not able to enter a real number as a logarithm base
description:
Congratulation for your super Calculator!

Even my favorite operation works fine:

log₂ 512 = 9

It still needed a tiny modification, as the base can't be a real number just integer.

I can't count e.g.    log₂.₂  10.648   = ?    (=3)
Actually, I am not able to enter a real number as a logarithm base.

It would be very nice just to add this feature, it would be very useful. 

Best regards,

Juhász Bálint

title: After Win The Game Resets Instead of Showing Victory
description:
This happens when all the best time records are filled and you win the game.
 
After you win, the game goes back to a new game.  This doesn't allow you to see your time. The proper action should be to stay on the game you just won because you can see the time.

If the best time records aren't filled it correctly brings you to the best times screen so you can put in your name.

Mines: 3.28.0
Ubuntu

title: gedit "highlights" the entire file in red when the extension is ".cob".
description: Linux Mint 19.3 with the latest gedit version. When I open a file that has the .cob or .cbl file extension, gedit "highlights" every line in the document in bright red, which makes it very difficult to read. The same problem occurs with xed (so apparently they share definition files). If I change the "highlight mode" to "Plain Text", the bright red "highlight" no longer appears for that file, indicating that there is some sort of file store for exceptions to the (useless) Cobol highlighting.

title: Change default Tab width from 8 to 4 spaces
description:
It can be seen that gedit have a default Tab width set to 8 spaces, while 4 spaces is commonly used among all the other popular editors like Notepad++, sublime and services such as github and even cloud editors and Ide's ex. Cloud9 IDE.

**Please set default Tab width to 4 spaces.**

![Screenshot_from_2019-12-23_15-39-23](/uploads/5c0b488c2c67321656aa179440404592/Screenshot_from_2019-12-23_15-39-23.png)

title: Column mode Editing and selection
description:
I'm missing this critical feature in gedit. Does anyone know anything about it?  
I would like to hold ALT+right mouse click and select through multiple lines just like in Notepad++

Bonus: select through multiple lines using keyboard

If this is not hard and possible, it would be great to implement.

![columnmode1](/uploads/44b3d2a809331b12ca060a114cbc0fc1/columnmode1.gif)

title: CSD header bar has different height than in some other GNOME applications when font size >11
description:
It's better to use thinner headbar just like `gnome-tweaks` in several other Gnome apps including `gedit`.
![csd](/uploads/4df4ad770e022f236d8ff4f0c85a1e79/csd.png)

title: Empty/dead space when opening files
description:
Sometimes when I open files, there is a lot of scrollable empty space being created:

![Screenshot_from_2019-12-11_15-31-24](/uploads/8a466f09eb8af33d86d7188a1f8afaa7/Screenshot_from_2019-12-11_15-31-24.png)

As you can see, `gedit` does not consider that as usable, but for some reason the scroll area seems to get miscalculated. When alt-tabbing away and back again multiple times, the area becomes either black / is not repainted, or the issue disappears.

Fedora 31, gedit 3.34.1

title: gedit plugin 'Find in Files' causes segfault
description:
```
gedit: Version 3.34.1
gedit-plugins: Version 3.34.1-1
OS: Arch Linux 
Kernel: x86_64 Linux 4.19.86-1-lts
WM: i3
GTK Theme: Arc [GTK2], Adwaita [GTK3]
```

Opening gedit and enabling the 'Find in Files' plugin then closing gedit shows a segfault on stdout
```
[~]$ gedit
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

Subsequent attempts to use gedit are fine except when closed a segfault shows again.

Attempting to disable the plugin causes gedit to quit and segfault.

The present work around is to uninstall gedit-plugins, use gedit at least once (presumably this resets options in gconf), then reinstall gedit-plugins and ensure not to select 'Find in Files' again.

The following is typically found in systemd journal with every time gedit is closed whilst that plugin is enabled:

```
Dec 01 17:03:23 desktop systemd-coredump[1646]: Process 1625 (gedit) of user 1000 dumped core.
                                                
                                                Stack trace of thread 1625:
                                                #0  0x00007faa0a596804 __GI___strlen_sse2 (libc.so.6)
                                                #1  0x00007faa09dc24fe gtk_accelerator_parse_with_keycode (libgtk-3.so.0)
                                                #2  0x00007faa09db8c09 gtk_application_set_accels_for_action (libgtk-3.so.0)
```

title: Add duplicate line keyboard shortcut
description:
Duplicate Line is very important func when debug code. Can emebed it into office plugin?

Now all 3rd plugin of duplicate line are dead. I use `external tools` to write a script to do this.

title: Make keyboard shortcuts configurable
description: #209 was over-specific. Please allow keyboard shortcuts to be configured in general.

title: Save notes/files as *.md instead of *.txt
description: To fully leverage on NextCloud synchronization (or github/lab) would be nice to have notes saved as ".md" files instead of ".txt". This way NextCloud Notes app will pick these up as "native", markdown formated notes instead of "simply" unformatted text files. Same goes in cases when users will push their notes to git.

title: move note into a different folder?
description:
It is great that I can define a default location/container for my notes.
I wonder, whether I can move notes to a different container.
The use case includes several cloud containers - e.g. personal cloud vs work cloud vs device/local only container.

if different notes can be stored at different places, it would be meaningful if the note is also shown in the color of that container.

title: Shortcuts for Bullets and Lists
description: There should be shortcuts for both Bullets and for Lists, it would also be nice if shortcuts were customizable(although if this is too much because they are hardcoded it would not be much of an issue).

title: UI ideas for the toolbar
description:
The current toolbar has a couple of problems.

- It uses the oldschool icons
- It's placed in a bit of a weird place
- It doesn't quite look like a toolbar

This is an issue to discuss how to improve it.

These mockups don't have symbolic icons because I kind of rushed them, and I don't think we have icons for everything yet. I also applied the "selected" state to the cut button which can't be selected, but it's useful to see how it would look anyways :p

The toolbar would look and behave like the toolbar of [Drawing](https://github.com/maoschanz/drawing). Buttons would have no frame, and only get a background when selected. For buttons that don't have that state (copy/paste/etc) the background would show while clicking.

![mockup_pitivi_toolbar](/uploads/efbab8005665d2e4f6b6e6f0f86cf825/mockup_pitivi_toolbar.png)

Here's a crazier layout. This is more of a FCPX/Apple motion style. The idea is that we can have more buttons and controls over a horizontal bar. Also we can move the zoom control to the bar, and take the time out of the viewer and put it close to the timeline (like Premiere and After Effects). The con is that we lose some vertical space.

![mockup_pitivi_toolbar_top](/uploads/0140e76bf9557bee39d41bb2b0761c82/mockup_pitivi_toolbar_top.png)

If someone wants to play around with these mockups let me know, I can upload the original krita file. It's a mess but editable.

title: Record Audio
description:
This is a fantastic feature I've seen in Kdenlive and Olive. There's a button on audio layers which you can click to start recording an audio right on the timeline. 

- The audio clip starts where the playhead is at currently. 
- The audio file is saved in the projects' folder with a default + timestamp name
- When recording the playhead starts moving, so you can talk along the video
- Clicking the _pause_ or _stop_ buttons on the viewer stops the recording

Here's the manual from Kdenlive: https://userbase.kde.org/Kdenlive/Manual/CapturingAudio

It's a little different in Olive, where the playhead actually moves.

title: Inform the user if the rendering encoders can not take full advantage of the available CPU/GPU resources
description:
When I render my project, I noticed that only one CPU is used at maximum in the rendering. If all the CPU's were utilized more, I would think rendering time would be significantly reduced.

![Screenshot_from_2019-12-13_08-32-08](/uploads/f123a5392ee9e99a01dff8db548e4c38/Screenshot_from_2019-12-13_08-32-08.png)

title: gdk_keymap_get_modifier_mask docs inaccurate
description:
gdk_keymap_get_modifier_mask says:
```
 * Note that this function always returns real hardware modifiers, not
 * virtual ones (e.g. it will return #GDK_MOD1_MASK rather than
 * #GDK_META_MASK if the backend maps MOD1 to META)
```
which however is not true at least for intent GDK_MODIFIER_INTENT_DEFAULT_MOD_MASK, where the returned value contains SUPER|HYPER|META, but *not* the corresponding real modifiers (which would be from MOD2..MOD5).

gtk-3-24 HEAD as of today.

title: gsettings(1), documentation of files modified
description:
The gsettings(1) manual page should describe the filesystem location where settings are stored.

After some research I found that they are stored in a binary file, `.config/dconf/user`.

Knowing this location will be helpful to users who are interested in backing up their GTK settings or transferring them from one computer to another.

Thank you.

title: GTK does not forward XDND protocol messages for X11 embedded windows
description:
Consider the following situations:
Case 1. There's a plugin host (Ardour) which supports LV2 plugins and uses GTK2 toolkit. There are audio plugins (LSP Plugins) which provide native X11 window for the UI. Trying to perform a Drag&Drop operation of some file from Nautilus to the plugin's X11 window embedded into GTK window denies all XDND events to the target X11 window. Trying to perform Drag&Drop of the same file from Dolphin succeeds: the X11 window properly receives and handles all XDND messages.

Case 2. There's a plugin host (Carla) which supports LV2 plugins and uses QT toolkit. The behaviour is the same as in case 1.

The related issue is the following:
https://github.com/sadko4u/lsp-plugins/issues/67

It seems that GTK implements some inter-toolkit protocol for Drag&Drop facilities and denies standard XDND protocol if possible.

According to the FreeDesktop specification, the toolkit is responsive for forwarding XDND messages to the child window:
https://specifications.freedesktop.org/xembed-spec/xembed-spec-latest.html#idm46049203496608

```
Drag and drop (XDND)

XDND drag-and-drop does not work with reparented external windows, since messages are exchanged with the toplevel window only. This is done for performance reasons. While it is cheap to get the window under the mouse pointer, it is very expensive to get a window under another window. Unfortunately, this is required quite often when dragging objects around, since the pointer may overlap the drag icon.

Solving the drag-and-drop problem, however, is quite easy, since the XDND protocol was carefully designed in a way that makes it possible to support embedded windows. Basically, the embedder has to operate as drag-and-drop proxy for the client. Any XDND messages like XdndEnter, Xdnd,Leave, etc. simply have to be passed through. A toolkit's XDND implementation has to take this situation in consideration. 
```

I need to know how the problem of Drag&Drop should be solved.
