title: Some window are wrongly rendered after opening
description:
Some windows are wrongly rendered immediately after opening, or after changing focus, or resizing. It is easily reproducible when opening File chooser dialog from various applications, e.g. gedit, evince, firefox. It usually helps to change focus, switch screens, or resize to fix the issue. I see this issue also with gnome-shell top menus. I am on up-to-date Fedora 31 Wayland. This has definitely something to do with the fact that I use an external monitor in addition to internal and one of them has 125% scaling and another one 100%. The screenshots are not affected, thus attaching photos:

Actual result:
![IMG_20191210_144155](/uploads/c2c5ba6a4764bd185fdb057a1c34f235/IMG_20191210_144155.jpg)
Expected result:
![IMG_20191210_144207](/uploads/c538e0b59bba6bdb5805d410f6b28882/IMG_20191210_144207.jpg)

title: Wrong monitor resolution gets detected.
description:
I'm using a UWQHD monitor from Iiyama (XUB3490WQSU-B1). The resolution is 3440x1440 but detected as 2560x1440. I am connected through Display Port.
I can forcefully add through xrandr but it really kills my purpose of using this beautiful DE that works out of the box for anything from audio, bluetooth and all. It also doesn't work on wakeup from sleep. I'm forced to reboot the machine and reconfigure, or sometimes not. It's configured as 3440x1440 already.

This issue happens on both wayland and X. With wayland, it's impossible to add any resolution, but somehow after configuring from X and restart as Wayland, it sometimes work.

title: Support EGL_KHR_partial_update
description:
From https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/wayland/weston/merge_requests/106:

> This MR implements support for EGL_KHR_partial_update. The partial_update extension allows us to inform the GL implementation ahead of time which areas of the buffer we are going to be rendering to. Doing so allows tiled renderers to skip reloading old content into the tile buffer in some cases, improving performance by lowering memory bandwidth. 

So this could help improving performance on the Raspberry Pi and the like once driver support is available.

See also https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/wayland/weston/issues/134, https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/mesa/mesa/merge_requests/227, https://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/mesa-dev/2019-June/220701.html

title: Triple-tiling for windows
description:
Currently we can tile windows to the left and right halves of the screen. On very wide widescreen monitors (21:9 / 24:10 / 32:10 / 30:9) which are getting more and more common these days, it is often very handy to have three windows tiled next to each other. This is especially true for documents and code which often cannot use the horizontal space of half a 21:9 screen – but also for browsers, as content usually does not scale to those widths.

Implementing such a triple tiling might not be that trivial, I guess 😕️, but would allow us not having to hassle around with manually doing that every time. 32:10 screens are even wider, guess even a quad-tiling would make a lot of sense here.

title: Drag but no drop under Wayland
description:
I’ve encountered a problem with drag and drop functionality in Qt5 under Wayland. When I compile and run the Qt5 `draggableicons` example program:

https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtwidgets-draganddrop-draggableicons-example.html

from Fedora 31 package qt5-qtbase-examples-5.12.5-1.fc31.x86_64 the dropEvent never fires.  

When I run the Qt4 version (from package qt-examples-4.8.7-50.fc31.x86_64) of the same program it works just fine.
`/usr/lib64/qt4/examples/draganddrop/draggableicons/draggableicons`

I followed the advice here:

https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/How_to_debug_Wayland_problems

Because this occurs on the `mutter` compositor but not on `weston`, I think this is a `mutter` problem.  I ran the application under both compositors like this:

`WAYLAND_DEBUG=1 draggableicons`

Comparing the result I see a `wl_data_device@11.start_drag()` under both and a `wl_data_device@11.drop()` under weston but not the corresponding `drop` under mutter.  I have also tried `mutter-3.35.1-2.fc32.x86_64` from the Rawhide repo, but get the same result.  

I can also run this with either version (Qt4 or Qt5)

`QT_QPA_PLATFORM=xcb draggableicons`

and everything works fine using X.

The mutter log file, [qt5version.strace](/uploads/d88233ec205c585bbde40ab1bc3993da/qt5version.strace) and the weston log file [weston.txt](/uploads/79c483bdcf21c50364714203e87863cb/weston.txt) are attached.

title: move-to-center are different position with center-new-windows
description:
[`center-new-windows`](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/blob/master/src/core/place.c#L811) position are based on `logical_monitor`.

[`move-to-center`](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/blob/master/src/core/keybindings.c#L3081) position are based on `work_area`.

`work_area` is not include gnome-shell top-panel height. So these functions have different window positions.

title: gnome shell freezes when qt (wayland) applications are dragged between screens
description:
Seen this on multiple machines and multiple versions of gnome-shell/mutter.

This time it was:

- mutter 3.34.1
- gnome-shell 3.34.1
- Qt 5.14.0 RC1 (also with older versions)

To reproduce:

1. `export QT_QPA_PLATFORM=wayland` (to circumvent blacklisting of wayland on gnome-shell)
2. Run a Qt application, such as `konsole`.
3. drag the window from one monitor to another.

Mutter freezes, cannot change to a tty.

title: Introduce ClutterSeat and deprecate ClutterDeviceManager
description: ClutterDeviceManager doesn't have per-seat semantics, which prevents us from implementing a few features, and doesn't follow modern semantics for input. This should be replaced by a seat-aware manager, namely ClutterSeat.

title: xterm window focus lost after polkit password dialog pops and disappear in Xorg session
description:
<https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/merge_requests/876> leads to some focus problem under Xorg session.

For example, open `xterm`, and type something like `systemctl enable sshd` that triggers polkit password dialog (maybe other shell toolkit, this is one that I confirmed), fill it and press enter, **focus should be back to xterm**, but in fact **it doesn't**.

Revert the commit in this MR fixes the problem. Please handle this, thanks!

title: Gnome-shell extension works incorrectly when 'autostart-xwayland' experimental option is enabled
description:
I encountered a problem with gnome-shell extensions, when the experimental `autostart-xwayland` option that was added in 3.34, is enabled in the `org.gnome.mutter.experimental-features` dconf key.

The specific issue was that the GSConnect shell extension failed to start, though the issue was partly worked around after I reported it to the extension maintainer.

The underlining issue is, that `Gtk.IconTheme.get_default()` returns `null`, instead of the correct `Gtk.IconTheme`, during the extension startup.

My bug report for the extension is [here](https://github.com/andyholmes/gnome-shell-extension-gsconnect/issues/726), although I don't think there's much information that would be relevant to the issue with mutter.

I've only reproduced the problem on Gnome 3.34, since I don't think the extension works on 3.35 yet.

title: Xwayland windows invisible since 3.34.1
description:
On Fedora 31

Seems to be a regression, I didn't have this issue before updating.

Under Wayland, native Wayland windows work fine. So any GTK3 apps aren't an issue. However, launching, for example, Thunderbird, under X11, it loads for a moment, after which nothing is visible. However, the application is running. I can even confirm there's an X window there with `lg`.

Trying to interact with a window usually results in the window being clicked through. So if I try to click anywhere on the Thunderbird window, it'll just focus on the window behind it.

These see-through windows still have shadows, and take up space in the overview. As demonstrated in these two screenshots ![Screenshot_from_2019-12-02_02-55-18](/uploads/75beceaf7432f6e551c39e61358821ed/Screenshot_from_2019-12-02_02-55-18.png)![Screencast_from_2019年12月02日_03時00分33秒_00_00_03.537](/uploads/933758bef140dce7d9a1dbfb6dba451e/Screencast_from_2019年12月02日_03時00分33秒_00_00_03.537.png)

A fullscreen application, such as a game or video, works completely normally and as expected.

title: Dimming screen brightness via xrandr breaks night mode
description:
3.34.1, Solus (Xorg)

Dimming the screen brightness with a command like `xrandr --output [eDP-1] --brightness [0.5]` seems to break Night Mode, and disable its color filter.

title: mpv on Wayland: vsync spikes and mistimed frames causing stutter
description:
When I play a video on Gnome Wayland via `mpv --video-sync=display-resample video.mpv` (it automatically picks Wayland backend), mistimed and delayed frames accumulate (occur together with vsync jitter spikes). It can happen with any video, but it seems to happen in a most "reliable" way when playing 59.94fps videos. This happens with my single display configured to both 59.95Hz and 75Hz. It might only happen once per minute, but it can also do so every few seconds. There comes visible stutter with this, e.g. easy to spot when watching judder test videos.

Sometimes also black flicker occurs together with the reported statistics anomalies. It's hard to spot, but I think this applies to the whole Mutter frame, not just the mpv window content.

The issue does not occur with Gnome Xorg, Plasma Wayland & Sway Wayland. Forcing maximum GPU and CPU clocks doesn't help either.
Afair Gnome Wayland doesn't have presentation feedback yet, thus vsync jitter in general is higher than on Xorg. But it shouldn't stutter regardless.

This should be tested with an AMD GPU, as Intel seems to have their own additional issue with vsync jitter spikes on Wayland, independent of Gnome.

Tested with gnome-shell 1:3.34.1+56+gbb24df2f9-1 (Arch rolls it out in stable repo), linux 5.4.1, mesa 20-git, recent mpv-git.
mpv shouldn't be older than 0.30 when trying to reproduce.

title: Auto-rotate is not working properly when system is booted up while not in its regular orientation
description:
Auto-rotation is not working properly when system is booted up while not in its regular orientation

[STEPS]
1. Make sure auto-rotation is enabled on the system
2. Before turning the system on, put it on tablet mode, with the inverted landscape rotation (the top part/the part with the camera is adjacent to the surface). The system should follow this orientation when the login screen appears.
3. Login to the system
4. Switch to the clam shell mode. The display suddenly becomes inverted/the opposite direction of the expected output.
5. Switch back to the tablet mode. The display also ends up being inverted/in the opposite direction of the expected output

I could reproduce this issue on X390 Yoga with gnome-shell 3.30 and mutter 3.30.

Greets

title: Mutter's clipboard manager doesn't take ownership of the CLIPBOARD_MANAGER selection
description:
Mutter [now has/is a clipboard manager](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/commit/5c009c20ab493fd610928d4581c52f0d448bea61) but doesn't declare itself as such per the [clipboard manager specification](https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/ClipboardManager/). This is not necessarily a bug, but it raises questions about what applications might want and expect when testing for clipboard persistence and using that functionality.

This follows on from a discussion [here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/merge_requests/320#note_654438). A brief summary:

[bob131 writes](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/merge_requests/320#note_654438)
> ... the clipboard manager spec doesn't specifically mandate managers to implement SAVE_TARGETS conversion ... I'm thinking perhaps Mutter's clipboard manager should take ownership of `CLIPBOARD_MANAGER`

[carlosg writes](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/merge_requests/320#note_654644)
> If the client thinks we implement SAVE_TARGETS but we actually don't, that might lead to other issues.

> So, IMHO the options are:
>
> * Faking the 100% of a x11 clipboard manager
> * Actually honoring it for X11 clients, and deal internally with the inconsistencies wrt Wayland.
> * Not doing anything

[bob131 writes](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/merge_requests/320#note_654767)
> It seems like it would be consistent with both the spec(s) and GTK's implementation if Mutter took ownership of `CLIPBOARD_MANAGER` and rejected `SAVE_TARGETS` conversion requests

[carlosg writes](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/merge_requests/320#note_657859)
> There's at least the "what to do with 3rd party clipboard managers" question left. We probably want to implement the standard to some extent, how full IMHO depends on whether we break expectations in some app.

title: Standard (latin) key combinations don't work on non-English keyboard layout in Overview search (at least)
description:
Hello!

For example, `Ctrl-A` or `Ctrl-C` works in search field on English (US) layout and doesn't on Russian (my native language).

> Do give clear step by step instructions on how to reproduce the problem.

1. Open Overview mode (I can't screenshot this screen with Flameshot, but I can try other tools if needed).
2. Set focus to search field at the top.
3. Enter some text in any keyboard layout.
4. Switch to non-English (Russian in my case) layout.
5. Press `Ctrl-A`, `Ctrl-C`, `Ctrl-X`, etc.

Expected result: key combinations works as in any place, like text editor.

Actual result: key combinations works as expected only with English keyboard layout and not with Russian.

> Do tell us the exact name and version of all relevant software, including your distribution and operating system.

Arch Linux, GNOME Shell `3.34.2`.

> If it is about a crash

No.

title: PolKit Agent: does not react on 'RET' without password
description:
Issue has been identified as part of openSUSE's contrinuous testing using openQA
https://openqa.opensuse.org/tests/1122192#step/gnome_music/11

Change happens since the upgrade to gnome-shell 3.34.2, which contains this change:
  * polkitAgent: Use dialog as confirmation when the user has no password

The test runs from a live image, without any user passwords defined (hence that change does apply to the condition)

As can be seen in the openQA tests, the dialog pops up, but then, when openQA tries to acknowledge it by pressing RET, the system is 'hanging' ('Authenticate' button becomes inactive, so 'something' happened) - but auth is not being granted.

If the 'Authenticate' button is clicked using a mouse, everything works as expected

The journal contains an entry for this event:

```
JS Warning: [resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/components/polkitAgent.js 211]: reference to undefined property "_session"
```

title: 100ms blockage when closing the icon grid [performance]
description:
Toggling the application icons grid (Super+A) hits a 100ms+ blockage every time it closes.

As shown by mutter!154 with `CLUTTER_SHOW_FPS=1`:
```
*** Performance over 1.0s: 22.17 FPS, update time avg: 10.2ms, peak: 121.7ms
*** Performance over 1.8s: 18.48 FPS, update time avg: 5.7ms, peak: 24.5ms
*** Performance over 1.0s: 41.56 FPS, update time avg: 7.2ms, peak: 113.9ms
*** Performance over 1.0s: 47.86 FPS, update time avg: 6.0ms, peak: 25.8ms
*** Performance over 1.0s: 43.25 FPS, update time avg: 8.3ms, peak: 119.1ms
*** Performance over 1.0s: 43.03 FPS, update time avg: 7.8ms, peak: 120.3ms
```
and confirmed by mutter!724 with `CLUTTER_DEBUG=backend`, which also pinpoints the problem to only when the icon grid closes:
```
Clutter-Message: 18:20:21.933: [      9847241214]:[BACKEND]:../clutter/clutter/cogl/clutter-stage-cogl.c:276: Missed some frames. Something blocked for over 119ms.
Clutter-Message: 18:20:24.467: [      9849775521]:[BACKEND]:../clutter/clutter/cogl/clutter-stage-cogl.c:276: Missed some frames. Something blocked for over 118ms.
Clutter-Message: 18:20:26.952: [      9852260133]:[BACKEND]:../clutter/clutter/cogl/clutter-stage-cogl.c:276: Missed some frames. Something blocked for over 84ms.
Clutter-Message: 18:20:29.200: [      9854508681]:[BACKEND]:../clutter/clutter/cogl/clutter-stage-cogl.c:276: Missed some frames. Something blocked for over 81ms.
Clutter-Message: 18:20:31.049: [         +810598]:[BACKEND]:../clutter/clutter/cogl/clutter-stage-cogl.c:276: Missed some frames. Something blocked for over 111ms.
Clutter-Message: 18:20:33.033: [         +773122]:[BACKEND]:../clutter/clutter/cogl/clutter-stage-cogl.c:276: Missed some frames. Something blocked for over 110ms.
```

This does not happen when just toggling the Activities Overview with Super.

title: Switching virtual desktops insert characters in gnome-terminal
description:
GNOME 3.34.2 on Debian testing.

I'm not really sure if that's gnome-shell or something else in the stack. When switching virtual desktop with Ctrl+Alt+Up/Down, characters 'A' and 'B' are inserted in open terminals.

See the attached video.

![Capture_d_écran_vidéo_de_22-12-2019_14_50_26](/uploads/b03a36651711f1ad1463289792e54f6a/Capture_d_écran_vidéo_de_22-12-2019_14_50_26.webm)

title: gnome-shell 3.34.1: Automount of MTP device fails
description:
When an Android device is connected via USB to desktop running Fedora31 (GNOME 3.34.1), and File Transfer by MTP is enabled in the Android device, Automount of MTP fails. This problem is reproduced with two different device brands. Corresponding to this failure, journalctl logs:

>  gnome-shell[1476]: Unable to mount volume Android: Gio.IOErrorEnum: volume doesn’t implement mount

`gio mount --list --detail` does show the "activation-root":
```
Volume(0): Android
Type: GProxyVolume (GProxyVolumeMonitorMTP)
ids:
 unix-device: '/dev/bus/usb/001/007'
activation_root=mtp://Android_Android_23f49936/
themed icons:  [phone]
symbolic themed icons:  [phone-symbolic]  [phone]
can_mount=1
can_eject=0
should_automount=1
```

The mount succeeds subsequently when attempted manually either via Nautilus GUI or via command line using

`gio mount mtp://Android_Android_23f49936`

Automount was working fine in Fedora30 and GNOME 3.32, without any need for manual intervention.

title: "gnome-shell dumped core" when trying to re-arrange my monitors in Display
description:
kernel 5.4.2 (also happens on 5.3.15)
gnome-shell 3.34.1


When trying to re-arrange my monitors gnome-shell crashes every time.  
I have an AMD Radeon RX 550 running the default open source drivers.[log_messages](/uploads/5579e7450ae4580508fbf86925cad79a/log_messages)

title: With switcheroo-control-2.0, GNOME shell doesn't pick NVIDIA Optimus card
description:
First off, it's great to see that https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/issues/1810 was fixed in GNOME 3.34! Especially since [Bastien's blog post](https://www.hadess.net/2019/12/dual-gpu-support-follow-up-nvidia.html) had it pegged for GNOME 3.36.

With that said, it seems there are still some growing pains. After having updated my system (Fedora 31) to get switcheroo-control-2.0 and the latest gnome-shell, and having already installed the proprietary NVIDIA driver from RPMFusion, switcheroo is able to tell that I have both an Intel & NVIDIA card installed, but some aspects of the gnome-shell session behave as if the NVIDIA card isn't there:

* Right-clicking a desktop entry and choosing "Launch using Dedicated Graphics Card" applies the `DRI_PRIME=1` environment variable instead of the NVIDIA env vars
* In gnome-control-center, Details->About->Graphics shows the Intel card twice. Maybe it shows the NVIDIA card too, but the text is so long that gets elided, even when maximizing the window:

![image](/uploads/713c927e956e55537ddd9ae5bd7e01e0/image.png)

switcheroo-control is definitely working, as opening D-Feet and viewing the properties of `net.hadess.SwitcherooControl` shows that the value of `GPUs` includes both cards & the correct env vars for each:

`[{'Name': 'NVIDIA Corporation GP107M [GeForce GTX 1050 Mobile]', 'Environment': ['__GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME', 'nvidia', '__NV_PRIME_RENDER_OFFLOAD', '1'], 'Default': False}, {'Name': 'Intel Corporation HD Graphics 630', 'Environment': ['DRI_PRIME', 'pci-0000_00_002_0'], 'Default': True}]`

Optimus & the NVIDIA card are working properly: launching programs like `glxinfo` and `glmark2` with the NVIDIA env vars shows that the NVIDIA card is indeed used. Launching those programs with `DRI_PRIME=1` (which is what is done by the new right-click option on a desktop entry) issues a warning message of `failed to load driver: nouveau`, and the Intel card gets used.

My kernel arguments (`/proc/cmdline`) are the following:

`BOOT_IMAGE=(hd0,gpt5)/vmlinuz-5.3.16-300.fc31.x86_64 root=/dev/mapper/fedora-root ro rd.driver.blacklist=nouveau modprobe.blacklist=nouveau nvidia-drm.modeset=1 rd.lvm.lv=fedora/root rd.lvm.lv=fedora/swap rhgb quiet resume=/dev/dm-1`

title: Incoming file transfer notification hard to accept/decline
description: When a file is sent to a gnome/linux machine, gnome shows a floating notification in the top notification area that a file is incoming. You need to hover the mouse over the notification for the accept/decline buttons to appear. But if you accidentally mouse out again, the notification disappears and there is no way to get the accept/decline buttons back. Which means you have to wait for the transfer to time-out and then restart the transfer. Obviously this is quite bad UX. I don't know if the gnome notification system allows to get the notification and buttons back, or whether there is another place where gnome-bluetooth could show the incoming as well where you can still accept or decline them.

title: Window switcher blocks other accelerators while modifier key is held
description:
Holding down the modifier key during window switching blocks all other keyboard shortcuts.

To reproduce:
1. Press and hold `<Super>`
2. Press `Esc` to begin a window switch (`<Super>Esc`).
3. Press `End` to change your mind about the window switch and jump to the last workspace (`<Super>End`)
4. Release `<Super>`

Expected behavior:
`<Super>End` works -- the view switches to that workspace

Actual behavior:
That `<Super>End` has no effect.  To make this work, `<Super>` must be released and re-pressed between steps 2 and 3.


I think the lost keypresses die in `SwitcherPopup.vfunc_key_press_event` in js/ui/switcherPopup.js.


As a workaround, I made [this heavy-handed extension that immediately completes a window switch as soon as it starts](https://gitlab.gnome.org/chuck/non-blocking-switcher)

title: Internal screen recording leaks memory
description:
Fedora 31, gnome-shell 3.34.2, wayland

The gnome-shell internal recording leaks a good amount of memory for me.  

Steps to reproduce:  
1. Gnome-shell has a memory usage of ~200MB
2. Start the recording, memory usage goes up to multiple GB after a few seconds
3. Stop the recording, memory usage goes down to ~500MB after some time (I guess until the encoding is finished?)
4. The value does not go down further

title: Gnome shell freezes when connecting dock / changing settings
description:
Hi,

I'm experiencing a problem: when I'm connecting a dock with a external display shows the screen but gnome freezes (it's not a system freeze, sound is still working). When the dock is connected during boot, the display works but also freezes when changing settings (e.g. multiple display--> single display). 

I'm running debian bullseye with gnome 3.34.2 on wayland.

I have no experience with this, so what kind of logfiles are useful?

Thanks in advance!

title: [RFE] Apply night light on lock screen
description:
Currently, it is very disruptive that the night light is not applied to the lock screen. This is especially visible when changing users, logging out or logging in. 
It would be helpful if the night light would be applied to the lock screen just as it is to the regular session.

title: Display an empty Wi-Fi icon when the Wi-Fi is not connected
description:
When doing usability test for [Tails](https://tails.boum.org/), I often see people take some time to find out that they need to click in the top-right corner of the desktop to connect to a Wi-Fi network.

Displaying an empty Wi-Fi icon even when the Wi-Fi is not connected would provide a visual clue on where to find this core feature of the OS.

This issue is a learnability and discoverability issue and would mostly affect first time users. In the case of Tails, most of our users are not otherwise Linux users so it's a bit more severe but I think that it's in the interest of GNOME in general to ease to experience of first time users as we want many more of them :)

For example, that's how macOS does it too:

![empty](/uploads/9a7b2afdef44e33dc11e42f058d57b64/empty.png)

Wi-Fi being by far the most common option for people to connect to the Internet these day, I think that it deserves some visibility on the desktop by default. The empty icon could also be displayed only when a Wi-Fi interface is being detected and not otherwise.

title: GNOME Desktop Stuttering
description:
After GNOME 3.30 update (even after 3.32 update), I started facing
desktop stuttering.

50% of the time, when I play videos in mpv, the video along with whole
desktop system (screen, windows, menus etc.) starts to stutter. 100% of
the time, when I stream videos in ungoogled-chromium, he video along
with whole desktop system (screen, windows, menus etc.) starts to
stutter. During stuttering, I also noticed in system monitor, that
processes ".gnome-shell-ca", ".gnome-shell-r" and ".gnome-system-m"
intermittently hitting 100% CPU.

The above issues does not happen when I log-in as i3-wm session via
gdm. They only happen inside gnome session.

OS: Guix System
Device: X200 Tablet

title: Allow a user to select among a full screen app menu, bottom of the screen horizontal app menu with left/right arrows, or a vertical app menu with up/down arrows located next to the dash.
description:
1. In the Settings app, Dash screen, there should be an "Application Menu Style" option. The user could select: Full screen, Horizontal, or Vertical.
2. The ability to choose the application menu style. I would prefer a horizontal applications menu.
3. A full screen application menu is the only option.

title: Window switcher sometimes doesn't show icon of the active application
description:
Randomly, but several times per day, I see "..." instead of an icon of the active application in the Window switcher shown over Alt+Tab. It happened to me with various applications (e.g. gedit, gnome-builder, fractal), but don't know why. If I press Alt+Tab for the second time, the icon appears. I am on up-to-date Fedora 31 Wayland. 

![IMG_20191206_122849](/uploads/be82cfecdbacfc03af25af9aeffdbad7/IMG_20191206_122849.jpg)

title: Gnome shell won't auto scale after detached from multi-monitor(Changed scaling between 100% and 200%)
description:
My laptop has QHD 4K screen,I set it to 2X scale and it works well.
I also use thunderbolt3 docking station with two 1080p monitors(I disabled internal screen). In this situation gnome shell will change to 1x automatic.
But after scale changed, Gnome shell setting buttons and app menu icons will not scale automatic. It still too large(2X).

You can try this:

1.  Open settings and change monitor scale to 200% 
2.  Open system setting menu and see if buttons scaled to 200% automatic
3.  Change monitor scale back to 100%
4.  Open app menu and see it applications icons scaled correctly.
5.  Change scale from 200% to 100% several times and check if Gnome-shell UI (Menu/app icons too big or too small)

I attached two screenshots which I changed from 100% back to 200% and menu/icons hasn't scaled correctly.(too small)

![截屏-20191210100438-578x900](/uploads/37364a57eb2bf01b82000cf3124fa659/截屏-20191210100438-578x900.png)

title: App-menu space increase during usage
description:
App-menu space below the application name doubles after a second application is opened

I could reproduce this behavior only with some applications so far:

- gnome-software
- utube 

on Fedora 30

How to reproduce
1. open gnome-software after Fedora boots up: app-menu space is as expected
2. open another application, e.g. Nautilus
3. come back to gnome-software, the app-menu space seems doubled

title: "swipe" always shown for fingerprint authentication
description: fprintd exports a property that specifies the sensor in question is a swipe or press sensor. This property should be used to adjust the string shown in the unlock screen.

title: Notification closes before timeout if pointer exits the notification area
description:
GNOME 3.34.1 Xorg

Notifications close automatically, giving no more possibility to the user to click an action specified by the buttons, immediately after the end of the first "mouse hover" status, which can accidentally happen very often especially when the mouse/touchpad speed is relatively high. This also violates the notification timeout as the notification seems to close even much earlier in this event.

There should be a minimum margin (or an infinite one if no timeout is specified, as in macOS, until the X is manually clicked) for this kind of cases.

![Bildschirmvideo_von_09.12.2019_13_31_36](/uploads/75aabb579945f3272452f8258e82d52c/Bildschirmvideo_von_09.12.2019_13_31_36.webm)

title: VPN auto-connect is not working, Invalid connection type: vpn
description:
Hi,

I have been told to report this bug upstream, after an initial bug report on [Launchpad](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gnome-shell/+bug/1851322).

When you configure a Wifi connection to auto-connect to a VPN network,
and that VPN network has credentials stored **"store password for this user only"**, then the connection will fail.

Looking at the logs, Gnome-Shell will complain that the connection is invalid:

```
déc. 08 18:36:28 xxxx gnome-shell[3267]: Invalid connection type: vpn
déc. 08 18:36:28 xxxx gnome-shell[3267]: Invalid connection type: vpn
```

The only way to make this works is to switch the credentials storage to **"store this password for all users"**.

I'm running Ubuntu 19.10

Gnome-Shell: **3.34.1+git20191024-1ubuntu1~19.10.1**

Thanks.

title: Wrong monitor resolution gets detected.
description:
I'm using a UWQHD monitor from Iiyama (XUB3490WQSU-B1). The resolution is 3440x1440 but detected as 2560x1440. I am connected through Display Port.
I can forcefully add through xrandr but it really kills my purpose of using this beautiful DE that works out of the box for anything from audio, bluetooth and all. It also doesn't work on wakeup from sleep. I'm forced to reboot the machine and reconfigure, or sometimes not. It's configured as 3440x1440 already.

This issue happens on both wayland and X. With wayland, it's impossible to add any resolution, but somehow after configuring from X and restart as Wayland, it sometimes work.

title: switch-to-application-n shortcuts aren't exposed to gnome-control-center
description:
Not entirely sure if this is intentional or not as there's a lot of shortcuts, but gnome-control-center doesn't show the `switch-to-application-N` shortcuts in the `Keyboard Shortcuts` panel. (https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/blob//data/50-gnome-shell-system.xml)

That means when a user tries to bind `super-1` or similar to eg. switching workspaces they're not notified about the shortcut conflict and asked if it should be replaced, resulting in a confusing experience.

title: Tiling windows up and down
description: We can tile windows to the left and right halves of the screen via the dconf keys `toggle-tiled-{left,right}`. It would be cool if these actions could also be implemented for tiling to the upper and lower halves of the screen. Would be especially useful for upright rotated monitors. 😀️

title: dconf: No schemas defined for window tiling keyboard-shortcut keys
description:
In FSB31, no schemas are defined for the `toggle-tiled-left` and `toggle-tiled-right` keys, which can be set via GNOME Settings.

![Bildschirmfoto_von_2019-12-07_21-53-47](/uploads/bbda53627667cf7e5dc9ee41547cf87b/Bildschirmfoto_von_2019-12-07_21-53-47.png)

title: Launching Firefox maximized, Firefox renders on left side of the screen for a split of a second on Wayland
description:
Fedora 31, gnome-shell 3.34.1

When launching Firefox maximized, Firefox is rendered only on the left side of the screen for a split of a second, before it is rendered correctly maximized on the full screen. You can see that in this screencast:  
![Screencast_from_07.12.2019_19_49_01](/uploads/671f62951519b721a51d5a9b5b3235ae/Screencast_from_07.12.2019_19_49_01.webm)

The same thing also happens to me with Thunderbird. But I do not see that behavior with any other windows.  
I also do not see this behavior under X, it only happens when running a Wayland session.

title: Going into fullscreen with the notification tray open moves it to left
description:
Reproduction:

 1. Launch an application that opens in fullscreen yet does not immediately open (in my case, it was Counter-Strike: Global Offensive)
 2. Open the notification tray in gnome-shell
 3. Observe that the notification tray is moved all the way to the left

System: 

gnome-shell 3.34.1 release 4.fc31 on Fedora 31

title: Overview search glitch when app terminates
description:
If an app that is present in search results is terminated (so the "blue dot" is removed) while the search results are shown, this strange graphical glitch can be seen:

![Bildschirmvideo_von_07.12.2019_14_15_54](/uploads/a984b653ed6bb3e84ab7df45d512dfb1/Bildschirmvideo_von_07.12.2019_14_15_54.webm)

The current setup is Solus 4 on Xorg (3.34.1), but I think the issue dates back to 3.28 or earlier as I noticed something similar even long ago.

title: [Feature] Bring back the systray icons, please!
description:
I've read article about GNOME's decision to remove the systray icons, I understand the UX design behind it. I've waited **several years** hoping to see a better UX emerged, one without icons in the systray, but with the same functionalities. But the reality is that **it doesn't work**: Nextcloud, Steam, Riot, Teams, etc... open source or not, all these applications that I use daily simply does not work properly without systray icons. And on top of that, GNOME devs keeps breaking all the TopIcons-like extensions.

I'm begging you! **Please reconsider your decision!**

Please, do something about it, this situation is utterly painful. I must not be the only one in this situation. Ask your users, make a survey, look at the installed extensions statistics (although skewed since the TopIcons-like extensions work on and off). I'm sure you will see that your (power?) users are in pain because of this decision.

At the very least, maintain yourself a systray extension, as you do for the Classic GNOME option (which I don't use, I prefer the more modern interface).

I honestly love most of the UX decisions you take, but to me, removing the systray is just a bad one in the end.

Thanks for reading this, please don't close it right away, take actions instead to feel what your users think about it, and publish the report. If the vast majority has no problem at all with the removal of the systray, then I'll know that GNOME might not be the best desktop for me, although I love everything else.

title: Screenshot to Clipboard, makes Clipboarded Screenshots overlayed in dark
description:
I made a screenshot by using keyboard combination of `CTRL` + `Super Key` + `PRTSC`  
I pasted clipboarded Screenshot into [Gnome Drawing program](https://github.com/maoschanz/drawing).  
And as you can see, it is way darker than simply taking a Screenshot.

Hint: it is probably due to dimming animation before the screenshot is taken.  
Notice: Screenshots taken via combination of `Super Key` + `PRTSC` do not thave this problem.

![Screenshot_from_2019-12-06_15-16-00](/uploads/310255bb5602f557764960181a627bec/Screenshot_from_2019-12-06_15-16-00.png)

title: Gnome-shell restart-refresh causes minimized applications to become unresponsive and unminimized
description:
**Ubuntu Launchpad direct link:**   
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gnome-shell/+bug/1852900

```
vaidas@vaidas-SATELLITE-L855:~$ gnome-shell --version
GNOME Shell 3.34.1
vaidas@vaidas-SATELLITE-L855:~$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu Focal Fossa (development branch)
Release:	20.04
Codename:	focal

```

Let's say you have minimized one or more applications such as Firefox, Gnome Tweaks or even Nautilus File Manager. These applications will be become unminimized after gnome-shell restart and also become unresponsive.

Unless I press to minimize/maximize them, these applications stay permanently unresponsive and unminimized.

**The Ways of restarting Gnome Shell I tested:**
* Either manual combination of keyboard keys `ALT+F2+R`

* Or a command line command:  
   `busctl --user call org.gnome.Shell /org/gnome/Shell org.gnome.Shell Eval s 'Meta.restart("Restarting…")'`

### Screencast after Gnome Shell restart, showing unminimized application
As can be seen, after the Gnome Shell restart, the application is being unminimized and unresponsive. 

Later on, I press to maximize/unminimize the application. The Application becomes responsive again.
 
![Screencast_from_2019-11-17_12_32_03](/uploads/22b827c5c2bc8ccc88bffe3a801d5d28/Screencast_from_2019-11-17_12_32_03.webm)

title: Improve automatic resources for extension authors
Improve introspection api for background tracking
description:
The current introspection api requires the portal to poll for open windows. As a consequence, the "app runs in background" notifications we emit are delayed, and tend to be batched (we check open windows once per minute, and notify about an app after two minutes).

It would be a better experience if we could notify directly in response to the last window of an application being closed (we still need to leave some grace period to give the app a chance to save state and exit).

This will require some signal from the gnome-shell side that gets emitted on that occasion.

title: Add a "portal open" status icons
description: To help with the potential issue of spoofing, we want to have a status icon in the shell that is shown whenever the active window has a portal dialog open. This may need some cooperation with the portal backends.

title: Stop installing an access portal
description:
On a recent design call, we've come to the conclusion that it is better to use GTK for all portal dialogs, and make this one modal to the application as well, instead of system modal.

For this change, it is enough to stop installing `/usr/share/xdg-desktop-portal/portals/gnome-shell.portal`

title: [Thinkpad] Display Persistence does not retain after restart when changed using (WIN key + P) or (Fn + F7)
description:
Found below scenario while switching display mode: 

1. Boot system to OS.
2. Attach Monitor
3. set Display from System-> Display to "Join Displays"  
3. Use Hotkey Fn+F7 or Win + P to set Mirror mode
4. Confirm display is 'Mirror' mode
5. Shutdown or Restart system
6. When system resumes, the "Join Display" mode is displayed .

**Expected behavior** -  Since user set "Mirror" mode using hotkey before restart . hence , "Mirror" mode should be displayed.

This seems to be same behavior in all Distros .


In Windows OS , last mode is restored after reboot .   
Is it possible to handle same way in linux i.e save last mode ?    
It seems gnome-shell and mutter is handling switch mode . 
/~"2. Needs Information" /~"1. Enhancement"

title: Captive portal helper does not show up (Firefox's detection works)
description:
I am currently at an Extended Stay hotel, and gnome-shell does not provide any notification for the needed network log in, and does not provide a way to log in.

Firefox's detection works and provides a button to log in to the network.

Running debian with gnome-shell 3.34.1+git20191024-1

title: Shell crash but not really (forced to log out)
description:
- OS: Fedora 31 / AMDGPU / X11
- Gnome: 3.34.1 (-4.fc31)
- Extensions: GSConnect

Sometimes the Shell seems to crash or something and adds this modal screen that sits above the shell. It happens often when Blender starts eating up ram and the kernel kills it. But it shouldn't affect the shell at all (it never has). This screen wasn't there in 3.32, or at least I never saw it.

![g_shell_crash](/uploads/97fbaecbc0f6485c56cd279f57e5acf9/g_shell_crash.m4v)

(sorry for the shaky cam)


The annoying thing is that the shell is working fine beneath the screen, as you can see in the video, I can move around and launch apps while I'm in the dashboard (using the META key). As soon as I leave
the dashboard I get the screen again.

It's really frustrating because I have no other choice but to log out and lose the entire session. Last time I even lost my browser session with 40+ tabs on 2 windows.

Is there some way to disable this? I don't care if the shell is "unstable", I'd rather have a hard freeze than this.

About this design: guys, this is basically a white BSoD (a WSoD?). It's a terrible idea. Maybe this can be redesigned as a bar that can be dismissed or something like that? i3 and AwesomeWM handle issues like that.


# Stack

Here's the stack, there's also another one from dbus from a minute earlier. Should I include that one too?

```
User Logs:
--Dec 04 14:03:11 localhost.localdomain gnome-shell[191994]: STACK_OP_RAISE_ABOVE: sibling window 0x20043d4 not in stack
```

title: gnome became unresponsive with mouse having high polling rates
description:
Hello,

I'm having problem with gnome, which happens even with different distributions on different machines (tested on Dell with Manjaro and Asus with Fedora, one without dedicated GPU, second with). Long time I don't know what is cause, but today I connect only mouse (without monitor, which I originally think was cause) and it happends again.

Biggest difference of (random) mouse and the mouse with problem is probably high polling rate. Same random mouse I ordered on random site is having polling rate about 128 Hz, but mouse I'm having problem is having polling rate up to 1000 Hz. (checked on site: https://zowie.benq.com/en/support/mouse-rate-checker.html )

Maybe there are other causes, but I can't tell. I'm just sure the mouse is problem. More info about mouse: https://www.legitreviews.com/mad-catz-rat-te-gaming-mouse-review_139257

Main symptoms are that switching windows is hard (system key and left upper border is unresponsive, only alt-tab works, and only partially. Also moving and scaling windows is not possible. It happens like thirty seconds after connecting problematic mouse and dissapper right away after disconecting.

title: Opening workspace preview results in two way transition for windows
description:
Fedora 31, gnome-shell 3.34.1

Steps to reproduce:  
1. Start Firefox and make it fullscreen.
2. Open the window overview.
3. Move the cursor to the right to show the workspace preview.

Actual result:  
The Firefox window is first pushed to the left and then its size is reduced. See this video:  
![Screencast_from_04.12.2019_19_16_27](/uploads/078c0ebf3842c1605d579867765cd9fa/Screencast_from_04.12.2019_19_16_27.webm)


The problem with the actual result is, that this two way transition looks weird and gives the user the feeling that the transition is not smooth.   
The same problem obviously exists as well when closing the overview again.

Expected result:  
The movement of the window as well as the size reduction are done in one transition.

title: Allow switching app windows with "Alt+~"
description: There's no way to switch between windows of the same app using keyboard shortcuts. All platforms use "Alt+~" to do that, would be good to have it in GNOME too.

title: Untiling a tiled window shrinks it
description:
As can be seen in the screencast below if you tile a window and then untile it, it doesn't return to it's original size but gets shrinked instead. It doesn't matter if you do it with a keyboard shortcut or mouse.
I'm on gnome-shell 3.34.1 Wayland. I quickly checked and it doesn't happen in Xorg.

![Screencast_from_12-04-2019_04_17_07_PM](/uploads/9833c5813fe4ccad75b47e5eb74cbd6a/Screencast_from_12-04-2019_04_17_07_PM.webm)

title: Toggle maximization state with "Super+Up"
description:
Right now Toggle maximize is binded to "Super+Up" key combo. But it doesn't help restore the original window size from the maximized state. I propose using "Super+Up" for toggling the maximization state instead, allowing to do both the mutually exclusive but related tasks with one key binding.

![Screenshot_from_2019-11-17_17-10-04](/uploads/94491a81cc3b113d6d84e3f263c8f49c/Screenshot_from_2019-11-17_17-10-04.png)

title: Allow to "Hide all normal windows" with a keyboard shortcut by default
description: There could be many situations where one wants to just quickly hide all normal windows. Like to prevent someone from watching over your shoulders in an open environment. A default keyboard shortcut to do that would be great, I propose "Super+D" as it's the same combo used for an equivalent behaviour in Windows, KDE and other Desktops.![Screenshot_from_2019-11-17_17-06-21](/uploads/cd10f1375f2c76423f13c26a6fcf82bb/Screenshot_from_2019-11-17_17-06-21.png)

title: More descriptive screenshot file names
Add new dbus messages in oVirt.js to handle SSO event
description:
Our product need to add some new dbus messages to handle our own SSO event in gdm/oVirt.js. 

Our product support multi desktop sessions,  so we will add a new dbus interface(org/xxx/Crential/D{display}) to receive the token from a special display, and oVirt.js module send a dbus message to our app to notify us greeter is ready.

the new dbus message we added:
```
<node>
<interface name="' + org.xxx.xxx.Credentials.D{display} + '">
<signal name="UserAuthenticated">
   <arg type="s" name="token"/>
</signal>
</interface>
</node>
```

greeter startup ready interface which is sent to our app:
 ```
<node> 
<interface name="org.xxx.xxx.Greeter"> 
<signal name="GreeterStarted"> 
    <arg type="s" name="token"/> 
</signal>
</interface>
</node>
```

title: AppGrid: Going through folders sometimes make them all disappear; "JS ERROR: TypeError: appIcon is undefined"
description:
On `gnome-3-34`, when checking the different app folders, it will sometimes hang a split second and all the folders will disappear, restoring all the different app icons in the grid. A shell restart fixes it.
 
When that happens, I see this in the log:
```
JS ERROR: TypeError: appIcon is undefined
                                                  _refilterApps/</<@resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/appDisplay.js:426:17
                                                  _refilterApps/<@resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/appDisplay.js:424:13
                                                  _refilterApps@resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/appDisplay.js:422:9
                                                  _redisplay@resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/appDisplay.js:400:9
                                                  _runDeferredWork@resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/main.js:624:5
                                                  _runBeforeRedrawQueue@resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/main.js:639:9
                                                  _queueBeforeRedraw/<@resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/main.js:648:13
```

title: default systemd service OOM killer policy leads to gnome-shell being stopped
description:
On Fedora 31, if the OOM killer takes out Firefox, the gnome-shell immediately dies:

```
> Dez 02 20:18:12 kernel: Out of memory: Killed process 2508 (firefox) total-vm:5579204kB, anon-rss:1243628kB, file-rss:0kB, shmem-rss:319592kB
> Dez 02 20:18:12 systemd[1681]: gnome-shell-wayland.service: A process of this unit has been killed by the OOM killer.
...
> Dez 02 20:18:13 systemd[1681]: gnome-shell-wayland.service: Failed with result 'oom-kill'.
> Dez 02 20:18:13 systemd[1681]: Stopped GNOME Shell on Wayland.
```

The default for the OOMPolicy setting is "stop", which makes sense for
system services, but certainly not for gnome-shell.

title: Switch only between windows contained within active workspace (via "current-workspace-only true")
description:
OS: Fedora; Component: gnome-shell.x86_64 3.34.1-4.fc31 @updates

Enhancement request: A mean to switch between application windows contained within  active virtual desktop, thus a single virtual desktop.

* Context: Applications of each numbered list are in their own virtual desktop: 

1. Office applications (illustrated by Libreoffice); 
2. Virtual Machine Manager, Gnome Terminal.

* Goal: Working for an undetermined time period with applications present within **active** virtual desktop –here the one containing office applications– and on demand, switching between them only, possibly via a short-cut. 

* Steps to reproduce: 
1. Open two virtual desktops with at least one application window opened in each;
2. Press <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>*tabulator*</kbd>;
3. Focus on an office application.

* Actual results:  
2. – That short-cut calls a useful function; Though it does not answer the assigned goal, as it does cover **all application windows** present within **all virtual desktops**.
 
![gnome_v.3.34.1_Select_view_1](/uploads/81465d9882323b26bfdaeabbe2e5ac30/gnome_v.3.34.1_Select_view_1.png)

* Enhanced results:  
As illustrated, covered application windows are the one present in a single virtual desktop. Creation of a dedicated short-cut would be a mean to achieve that goal. Shot-cut could be for example <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>*tabulator*</kbd> + <kbd>A</kbd>.

![gnome_v.3.34.1_Select_view_2](/uploads/118f7bbfe25fa7d4d9d6ddb7f34ea2ed/gnome_v.3.34.1_Select_view_2.png)

title: Remove broken parsing of `@media` rules.
description:
There is some incomplete code that ignores a `@media` rule's media_list, and unconditionally inclues of all of the rule's statements into the current ruleset.  MR upcoming to remove that.

The default theme doesn't use `@media` rules since they are not supported anyway.

title: Terminal window banner or title bar auto raise problem
description:
The GNOME auto raise feature works on the non-banner or non-title bar region of any terminal window. 
In KDE the banner or title bar portion of the window also worked with auto raise. 
My co-workers and I find this feature to be really valuable. If I move my mouse over the title bar/banner the window does not auto raise in Gnmoe.
I am requesting a change to add a switch to include or not include the terminal window banner to be recognized in the auto raise capability.

Thank you, Larry Aldrich

title: Shortcuts ctrl+c ctrl+v copy paste not working anymore when having "clipit" installed

title: Add way to change audio output (speakers vs headphones) on a per application basis
description:
As far as I know, it is not possible to change the audio output on a per application basis from anywhere in gnome-shell. An external application (e.g. pavucontrol) is required. 

Such a normal task, however, shouldn't require third party applications. It is unreasonable to think that a normal user would want to have Spotify on his speakers and a Discord call in his earbuds? As a matter of fact, everyone else has this feature built-in (e.g. Windows, OSX, Plasma, don't know about MATE, XFCE and LXQt). But why should gnome require an external application/extension? 

My suggestion is to add a dropdown in the sound settings or expand the functionality provided by the user-menu volume indicator: maybe instead of muting on click, something kind of stupid in my opinion, it would expand to a sub menu, [like this extension](https://extensions.gnome.org/extension/906/sound-output-device-chooser/).

![My crappy mockup of the Volume section in settings](/uploads/eaf201f37ef62c4d3fbe6da3367a8ac5/audio-mockup.png)

title: gnome-shell UI element highlight colors are not consistent
description:
As requested filing a separate issue for this, this was first brought up in #1963.

So I just checked and it seems different parts of gnome-shell use different highlight values ?

E.g. the highlight for the item under the mouse-cursor (for being the item which will be activated when clicked) is much brighter in the top right system-menu, then the highlight when hovering over a day on the calendar below the clock, is this intentional, because it looks a bit weird.

Oh even better, the highlight for selecting one of the menu items in the top-right system menu, e.g. "Wired connected" or your users name, is much brighter then the one for selecting the settings / lock / power-off icons and the highlights for the menu items are much easier to see.

Especially hovering over a (permanent, mpris) notification under the clock is barely visible on my not that old Ilyama monitor. The subtler variant of the highlight user over the icons is IMHO somewhat hard to spot.

title: Make `gnome-shell-extension-prefs` the main way that extensions are managed
description:
Currently, Software allows people to install extensions, view which ones they have installed, and also remove them. It doesn't do a fantastic job at this, and it's another type of software for it to have to care about.

As a result, we've talked about removing the extension support from Software and adding some of the required functionality to `gnome-shell-extension-prefs` instead.

The rough idea is:

 - Software continues to handle updating extensions that are packaged (essentially treating them as part of the OS)
 - `gnome-shell-extension-prefs` becomes the "Extensions" app, which must be installed for people to add their own extensions
 - There will be no extension installation in the Extensions app - they must be installed from extensions.gnome.org
 - The new Extensions app will allow extensions to be removed and updated

There are some initial mockups for what the Extensions app could look like, [here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/app-mockups/blob/master/extensions/extensions.png).

The UX advantage of this would be that we'd remove some bad and potentially confusing UI from Software, and have a nicer way to update and manage extensions for those who care about them.

title: OSK french layout not activated on standard configuration
description:
Using GNOME 3.34.1 with a standard french installation, the OSK is showing in qwerty/english

It seems GNOME does a strict matching of the locale/keyboard layout names, which means that the french 'azerty' layout is only correctly picked by the OSK when an 'fr' layout is configured. The problem is that 'fr' is an old and unmaintained layout which has been replaced years ago by 'fr+oss' which is nowadays the default layout when you do a french installation in Debian, Fedora or Ubuntu (and probably other distributions as well).

Unsure what would be the right fix there, having a mapping table for such cases? Generating a fr+oss layout in addition of the fr one?

title: Bring back dark mode toggle, or at least don't mess around it everytime user changes theme
description:
I have long heard gnome people are a bunch of retards yet your level of retardness still amazes me.

I have read this pile of [bullshit](https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=783666) and all your reasoning is this feature doesn't work **sometime**. What a persuasive argument! By that logic the whole GNOME project should cease to exist in the next major release.

I know you guys don't have such a person called UX designer so all you can rely on is the instinct of your not well-functioning brain but how hard it is not to deliberately breaks some functioning feature? Many themes, as you're constantly breaking things, are long abandoned and won't get any update until the end of time. And then you mercifully give them a whole half of year to migrate or they won't work as intended **all the time**.

What's funnier is that for a change with huge impact, all that documentation is in one of your guy's personal blog and the [api](https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/GtkSettings.html#GtkSettings--gtk-application-prefer-dark-theme) isn't even marked as deprecated or get any warning, so everyone google `GNOME dark mode` and they will get what exactly is happening in GNOME, just except that some dude choose to overwrite it at some time.

Further more, as of today the major two desktop system support light/dark mode switch, many cross platform applications such as browsers need to know it to blend in. Especially browsers who even has a api for webpage to query. And guess what? In Linux they choose to rely on `gtk-application-prefer-dark-theme` as their base. So, this trending api which getting used in many popular sites like https://overreacted.io/ and functioning well in many systems, becomes completely useless just under GNOME just because some maintainer feels like it. Your guys had supported the possibility of this api for so many years and abandoned it like it's totally useless. What a unique achievement! So I feels like to write this to congratulate and to express my respect for this insightful action.

title: 'gnupg' present but 'pinentry' missing from flatpak runtime 'org.gnome.Platform'
description:
`elements/sdk-platform.bst`: Application `pinentry` seems to be missing from the flatpak runtime `org.gnome.Platform` version `3.34`.

The flatpak runtime for Gnome 3.34 is used in the [flatpak package for Claws-Mail](https://github.com/flathub/org.claws_mail.Claws-Mail/issues/5). `gnupg` fails at times when `pinentry` is required. I'm not sure if this is the right place, but the file mentioned above seems to match.

For me it's not clear what the solution would be:
- Should `pinentry` be added?
- Is some configuration missing? Maybe in the depending flatpak?

__Update__: I'm looking into adding `pinentry` to the Claws-Mail package. So maybe confirmation that `pinentry` does not belong in `org.gnome.Platform` is sufficient.

title: Remove libcroco dependency
description: We should delete libcroco.bst after the next gnome-shell release.

title: DzlSuggestion: Support secondary icon
description:
In Epiphany we need support for a secondary icon within DzlSuggestion/Row to:

 - fix a regression introduced with the libdazzle switch (Bookmarks are no longer marked with a star on the right side)
 - Jump to tab could make use of an icon and use the subtitle as address (fixes another open bug)
 - Indicates jump to windows option

I do have a patch ready for libdazzle, in case you want to add it.

title: Cannot install SDK error: no logs to pinpoint the issue?
description:
I've asked Builder to start project by clonning https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-control-center, but it is missing Gnome SDK.

1. A popup is displayed "Install missing SDK?"

![image](/uploads/c82cddf24b3e287a75e2d30b8990e026/image.png)

2. I select install but it *apparently* fails silently. The run button is grayed out, and if I click on top bar, I can see:

![image](/uploads/6fd81d37895dfdbd8a61f5af1a95d2fb/image.png)

3. Unfortunately, and even started with `gnome-builder --verbose`, I cannot see any logs anywhere to pinpoint to the root cause, except this:

> ide-build-manager[ 376018]:  MESSAGE: Failed to prepare runtime: Failed to install runtime for build

4. I also went to Settings -> SDK -> Flatpak execution environments and tried to install one by clicking the install button, but again nothing happened:

![image](/uploads/b670f401824f8645eaaf92c82a085eab/image.png)

5. (a bit offset) Everytime I stop & restart Builder to test something new, I have to reopen my project manually. It is not listed on Builder welcome page?
 
A few questions here:

1) Is that normal that `gnome-builder --verbose` does not log anything useful?
2) Is that normal that the UI is not triggering any warning/error when these operations fail?
3) What is the real underneath issue here? (but I guess it has to do with my flatpak installation or so - I believe I can fix this on my own). **edit: I indeed fixed it by removing all flatpak stuff and reinstalling gnome-nightly with org.gnome.Sdk from gnome-nightly**

title: Assigning languages to custom file endings
description: Some applications use custom file endings to differentiate special files from regular language files. Xilinx’ Vivado for example uses the ending `.xdc` for constraint files even though they’re just TCL files. Would be great if we could pass that information to Builder! Having that in an `.editorconfig` would be even better, but it seems that this option does not exist there.

title: Vala: Replace current implementation of vala-pack for IdeIndenter and IdeIndexer
description:
As for #1074 in order to replace current Vala-pack plugin, a new version in Python should be implemented. So there are two ways to go:

* [ ]  Keep current Vala version and re-use it in Python plugin. A GObject Introspection GIR and Typelib is required, so the Python version can use it.
* [ ]  Create a replacement in Python. Issue #1097 is stopping its development and fixing.

title: Plugins: Python is not backtracing errors for debug
description:
Python Plugins, like the one for GVls at !230 requires an implementation for, for example, `Ide.Indenter` and `Ide.CodeIndexer`, but in order to find issues and debug, Builder should output backtraces one errors are raised.

This is a must go for Python based plugins.

This is #1074 related.

title: LSP: Symbol Tree is not showed up correctly
description:
GVls is providing the current symbol tree, but Builder is not showing it correctly:

![Builder-symbol-tree-GVls-issue](/uploads/5698d8a4c4d723f656371472f7555ba8/Builder-symbol-tree-GVls-issue.png)

This is #1074 related.

title: LSP: Diagnostics position is showed up in a wrong position
description:
LSP is 0 based on line and column (character), so when GVls return the diagnostics it is using the same convention, but Builder is showing in them in the wrong position.
![Capture-10dic2019-GVls-Builder](/uploads/de1ad3ef7ed55462ed02ba1ddd55dad5/Capture-10dic2019-GVls-Builder.png)

title: Builder needs reboot after installing a new runtime
description:
3.35 Flatpak nightly, but the issue is quite old.

After installing a new Sdk/runtime for some project, running the program gives this error:

`bwrap: execvp {name}: No such file or directory`

until Builder is restarted.

title: Markdown preview not working / broken
description:
1) clone https://github.com/ansible-community/ansible-bender
2) Open file README.md
3) open the preview
-> does not render anything

1) Open file docs/configuration.md
2) open the preview
-> document partially rendered, it improves a bit if you select the text.

![builder-preview-md](/uploads/3e2346055cdf6287f421fd7b6e48a817/builder-preview-md.png)

build_info
3.34.0-106-g039a93da6
flatpak-nightly

title: workspace unreadable with darker theme + tango
description:
Set the dark theme, activate grid and the tango color scheme you end with an unreadable workspace.

![build_dark_grid_tango](/uploads/aeca9a19e619a78af8197b54ab3de623/build_dark_grid_tango.png)

title: LSP: allow access to project's information
description:
LSP Client requires to setup the server with the build environment, at initialization or in response to `workspace/configuration` request.

One way is accessing meson, for example, build options, dependencies and arguments, but my imporession is that current implementation has no access to Builder's current project's information.

title: LSP: Client Capabilites: notify workspace/configuration support
description:
This is required to allow LSP server to send `workspace/configuration` notification and response for, for example, build environment provided by LSP plugin.

This is related to #1088

title: LSP: improve Client Capabilities response at initialize
description:
In order to make Builder's LSP Client better suitable for LSP servers, is important to notify its own capabilities, based on [specification](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-3-14/#initialize):

* [ ]  workspace: configuration support for `workspace/configuration` #1089 
* [ ]  workspace: workspaceFolders
* [ ]  workspace: symbol: dynamicRegistration
* [ ]  workspace: symbol: symbolKind: SymbolKind[]
* [ ]  workspace: executeCommand: dynamicRegistration
* [ ]  workspace: didChangeWatchedFiles: dynamicRegistration
* [ ]  workspace: didChangeConfiguration: dynamicRegistration
* [ ]  workspace: applyEdit: in response for `workspace/applyEdit`
* [ ]  workspace: workspaceEdit: documentChanges
* [ ]  workspace: workspaceEdit: resourceOperations
* [ ]  workspace: workspaceEdit: failureHandling
* [ ]  textDocument: synchronization: dynamicRegistration
* [ ]  textDocument: synchronization: willSave
* [ ]  textDocument: synchronization: willSaveWaitUntil
* [ ]  textDocument: synchronization: didSave
* [ ]  textDocument: completion: for `textDocument/completion`
* [ ]  textDocument: hover: for `textDocument/hover`
* [ ]  textDocument: signatureHelp: for `textDocument/signatureHelp`
* [ ]  textDocument: references: dynamicRegistration: for `textDocument/references`
* [ ]  textDocument: documentHighlight: dynamicRegistration: for `textDocument/documentHighlight`
* [ ]  textDocument: documentSymbol: for `textDocument/documentSymbol`
* [ ]  textDocument: formatting: dynamicRegistration: for `textDocument/formatting`
* [ ]  textDocument: rangeFormatting: dynamicRegistration: for `textDocument/rangeFormatting`
* [ ]  textDocument: onTypeFormatting: dynamicRegistration: for `textDocument/onTypeFormatting`
* [ ]  textDocument: declaration: for `textDocument/declaration`
* [ ]  textDocument: definition: for `textDocument/definition`
* [ ]  textDocument: typeDefinition: for `textDocument/typeDefinition`
* [ ]  textDocument: implementation: for `textDocument/implementation`
* [ ]  textDocument: codeAction: for `textDocument/codeAction`
* [ ]  textDocument: codeLens: for `textDocument/codeLens`
* [ ]  textDocument: documentLink: for `textDocument/documentLink`
* [ ]  textDocument: colorProvider: for `textDocument/documentColor`
* [ ]  textDocument: rename: for `textDocument/rename`
* [ ]  textDocument: publishDiagnostics: for `textDocument/publishDiagnostics`
* [ ]  textDocument: foldingRange: for `textDocument/foldingRange`

title: Vala: goto definition is not working using GVls
description:
While GVls server response with the URI and position where the symbol is defined, Builder just no open the file and put the cursor at.

This is related to #1074

title: LSP: incorrect handling for textDocument/definition response
Opening Preferences can lock up for 30+ seconds
description:
Reproducer:

1. Open configured WebKit project
2. Open preferences
3. ....

It only happens the first time and future opens are near instant.

Reproduced on stable and nightly flatpak (3.34.0-85-gef8657d5b).

title: Vala: improve highlighing
description:
Currently this is how Highlight show a Vala source code when using GVls: ![Builder-GVls-Highligth](/uploads/632dbc8ebd7f782204096697cc98de20/Builder-GVls-Highligth.png)

As you can see, Symbol, being a GVls.Symbol, should be highlighted in bold dark blue (I think) in order to distinguish from other but types defined in current project.

title: Vala: trigger completion using the dot character
description: If GVls is active, completion should be triggered once the user has wrote a `.` character, so the LSP can search for symbols. Currently to use GVls completion suggestions, `CTR+SPACE` should be used.

title: Broken nightly Flatpak
description:
I get this error running Builder nightly Flatpak on a vanilla Solus 4 3.34.1 install:

```
flatpak run org.gnome.Builder/x86_64/master 
gnome-builder: error while loading shared libraries: libvte-2.91.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```

Shouldn't it use Flatpak's libvte by default?

title: Bug: Find in Files loses focus in certain projects
description:
I've noticed that in some projects, the Find in Files panel looses prominence when I select a search result. This seems to be related to the type of file I open. *.cpp* files give issues, *.txt* files don't.

## Setup
Builder 3.34.1
Fedora 31

I've also reproduced it with the nightly.

## Test case
I used a non-GNOME, GPL licensed, C++ project: [SLADE Doom editor](https://github.com/sirjuddington/SLADE). This makes it easy to reproduce.

- Clone the git project
- Open the project with GNOME builder
- Search for contents

## Video
![Builder_3.34_2019-11-28_18-16](/uploads/e871a5251bab6dd74a6e566c2a525103/Builder_3.34_2019-11-28_18-16.mp4)

title: VMs fail to start
description:
So I've scouted the issues list for a while and still can't figure out what's wrong. I try to start the VM and it fails with the logs below. 

For reference, I'm on Zorin 15 (Ubuntu 18.04 base), both flatpak and apt install versions tried with the flatpak getting further than the apt install version. 

Yes, I've added myself to the kvm group as well as changing the /etc/modprobe.d/qemu-system-x86.conf and /etc/libvirt/qemu.conf to have group=kvm. I'm not sure what else to try. I know that this works on Zorin because I got it to work a month ago before I wiped my computer yesterday. Can't seem to figure out the issue this time. 

Logs from running the Flatpak via the terminal:

https://pastebin.com/JtYYq8FT

title: Only root hard drive available to Add a Box, Select a File
description: Using the latest flatpak version (3.34.2), when trying to add a VM (Add a Box, Select a File), the file browser only allows me to browse my root/home hard drive, not other internal drives or external drives.

title: can't boot .img files
description:
GNOME Boxes should have already the possibility to boot image files (dd images of hdd for example).

Works with QEmu, GNOME Boxes doesn't accept this file format (even if named as .iso)

title: Windows 10 crash install on host AMD Ryzen 7
description:
I tried to install a Windows 10 virtual machine with Gnome-boxes on a AMD Ryzen 7 / Linux 4.19.88-1 host, but I had a crash.

The error I've got on the logs is:

`Domain id=22 is tainted: host-cpu char device redirected to /dev/pts/1 (label charserial0)
 qemu-system-x86_64:This family of AMD CPU doesn't support hyperthreading Please configure smp options properly or try enabling topoext feature `

 And the Windows machine is telling me:

`SYSTEM THREAD EXCEPTION NOT HANDLED`


I found those related issues, but I still can't figure how to solve:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/qemu/+bug/1703506
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1592276

I'm running Gnome-Boxes in version 3.34.2.

Please tell me if you need more information about my config.
Thanks.

title: Corners cut in animation of the "Create a Box" dialog
description:
![Capture_d_écran_de_2019-12-13_07-57-22](/uploads/e0f05d65d0fae221c3405ff9e7125959/Capture_d_écran_de_2019-12-13_07-57-22.png)

We have a widget in libhandy which solves that just by having it as the root of the titlebar, but if you want to fix it without depending libhandy, you could just mimick its behavior: it's a bin which draws a background and has the "headerbar" CSS name.

title: No information is shown when using incorrect VNC password
description: There should be a popup when the password is refused allowing the user to change the password.

title: Add ViewOnly option for VNC
description: It would be very nice to support a view only option for VNC so you don't send input. Other clients such as `vncviewer` support this.

title: Import/Export boxes
description:
This is a brand new issue so we can start fresh discussions about the feature.

https://gitlab.gnome.org/Teams/Design/app-mockups/blob/master/boxes/boxes-import-export.png

title: Fedora 31: Still Cannot Get Full Screen in Some Box OSes
description:
Now to be fair, with some OS installations, ie: Ubuntu,  I can get full-screen in Boxes, but with others, I cannot, ie: Linux Mint. I too, have perused Google for a solution, with no result. All I get is videos telling me how to install various OS in Boxes, without addressing the full-screen issue. 

And, yes, I have looked under Boxes-->Settings, but these appear minimal and also, do not address the issue at hand.


Again, to be fair, I have had a similar issue with VMWare [which I hate] and it offers something called Guest OS 'Tools' which sometimes work and sometimes do not. 

Interestingly, this article claims there *is* a setting for adjusting the screen size, a 'double arrow' under Display,  but, for some reason, my version of Boxes doesn't have it. 

https://www.lifewire.com/guide-to-gnome-boxes-2202073

I'm thinking it might be a video drive issue--my video card = NVIDIA GEforceGT 625. Video chip = Intel HD Graphics 4400/4600

Thanks!

title: PyGObject installation error (Package 'libffi' has no Name: field)
description:

Python 3.6.5

`brew install libffi`

libffi found in:

`/Applications/Adobe Dreamweaver CC 2018/Adobe Dreamweaver CC 2018.app/Contents/Resources/gems/rubygems/gems/ffi-1.9.18/ext/ffi_c/libffi-x86_64-darwin15/libffi.pc
/Applications/FreeCAD.app/Contents/Resources/lib/pkgconfig/libffi.pc 
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/usr/share/xcs/xcsd/node_modules/nodobjc/node_modules/ffi/deps/libffi/libffi.pc
/Applications/Xcode8.2.app/Contents/Developer/usr/share/xcs/xcsd/node_modules/nodobjc/node_modules/ffi/deps/libffi/libffi.pc
/Users/filippo/egpu/lib/pkgconfig/libffi.pc

/usr/local/anaconda3/lib/pkgconfig/libffi.pc
/usr/local/anaconda3/pkgs/libffi-3.2.1-h475c297_4/lib/pkgconfig/libffi.pc`

path added to `PKG_CONFIG_PATH` in .bash_profile:

`PKG_CONFIG_PATH="/usr/local/Cellar/libffi/3.2.1/lib/pkgconfig"

title: Use Gtk.Widget Method instead of Gtk.Button for set_focus_on_click
description:
`Gtk.Button.set_focus_on_click` was deprecated in GTK 3.2, and replaced by `Gtk.Widget.set_focus_on_click`. Gtk.Button inherits from Gtk.Widget, but if you call `Gtk.Button.set_focus_on_click` it introspects to `gtk_button_set_focus_on_click` instead of `gtk_widget_set_focus_on_click`.

What this results in for a simple example is:
```
button = Gtk.Button()
button.set_focus_on_click(False)
DeprecationWarning: Gtk.Button.set_focus_on_click is deprecated
    button.set_focus_on_click(False)
```

You can work around this by directly calling the Gtk.Widget method like:
```
button = Gtk.Button()
Gtk.Widget.set_focus_on_click(button, False)
```
Could we modify PyGObject so that it doesn't call the deprecated method at all?

title: DATADIR may point to wrong directory in Python 3.7+
description:
In Python 3.7+ (or in their updated distutils) a `pip install` builds a "dist_wheel" first and then installs that.

This breaks the DATADIR resolution in https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/meld/blob/5fe6a0849228f1f2e48bfd7924f4ab76237869f0/meld/build_helpers.py#L380: The `--prefix` option is not given to a bdist_wheel build so it will always point to `sys.prefix` (fallback path) which may then be incorect.

Example with log: `pip install --prefix=/tmp/mycustommeldfolder --no-deps --ignore-installed --no-build-isolation -v .`

```

  Created temporary directory: /tmp/pip-wheel-26ld43gj
  Building wheel for meld (setup.py) ...   Destination directory: /tmp/pip-wheel-26ld43gj
  Running command /sw/installed/Python/3.7.2-GCCcore-8.2.0/bin/python3.7 -u -c "import setuptools, tokenize;__file__='/tmp/pip-req-build-ln28xqoa/setup.py';f=getattr(tokenize, 'open', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('\r\n', '\n');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, 'exec'))" bdist_wheel -d /tmp/pip-wheel-26ld43gj --python-tag cp37
  running bdist_wheel
  running build
  running build_py
  creating build
  creating build/lib
  creating build/lib/meld
[CROP]
```

As you can see: bdist_wheel command is executed.

Meld will then fail to e.g. load `DATADIR/meld/meld.css`.

Possible solution: Check for `meld/meld.css` in some locations, first the configured DATADIR, then in a relative-to-current-file path.

title: Gnome
Cannot open on Windows via commandline - cx_Freeze in check_requirements (with workaround)
description:
## Problem

If you try to open Meld via cmd in Windows, you are greeted with a python error `cx_Freeze: Error in main script`, which is caused by a failure to link to `libgi`.

![image](/uploads/5bb10bb96920be89e932809793af5c42/image.png)

## Workaround

Copy `C:\Program Files (x86)\Meld\lib\libgirepository-1.0-1.dll` to `C:\Program Files (x86)\Meld\libgirepository-1.0-1.dll`.


Credit to [this stackoverflow thread](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/55123873/git-running-meld-as-merge-tool-fails-check-requirements-import-gi)

title: Incorrectly rendered file
description:
Imagination's icon (https://sourceforge.net/p/imagination/code/HEAD/tree/trunk/icons/scalable/imagination.svg) is not rendered correctly by librsvg: when converted with librsvg-convert I get this:

![imagination](/uploads/14f20d34c58314b15c9c2f0d03c68c20/imagination.png)

Gwenview and Inkscape render it correctly:

![imagination_correct](/uploads/a6b3fac7dd68332140120d2d29614b18/imagination_correct.png)

As most gtk based desktop environments use librsvg this prevents imagination's desktop file from displaying the right icon.

title: Images with relative paths are not loaded
description:
Let's say we have the most basic SVG like this:

```xml
<svg id="svg1" viewBox="0 0 80 80" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
    <image x="8" y="8" width="64" height="64" xlink:href="../image.jpg"/>
</svg>
```

`rsvg-convert` exits with `Could not render file test.svg`.

Does it not supported or external files should be enabled explicitly?

Surprisingly, if we try to load the same image via `feImage`, it will be simply ignored. No errors.

Version 2.47.1

title: RFC: Provide library to handle icon themes
Misrendered objects
Perserve unused classes when rendering
text rendering requires restart to detect new fonts
description:
It looks like rendering text requires a restart to pick up changes to the fontmap when using fontconfig. Is this correct?

The font map is initialized with a FontMap::get_default() call and from there on out it seems like it does not recheck the cache?

Maybe calling FcInitReinitialize followed by pango_fc_font_map_config_changed would fix this issue.

title: Port rsvg-convert to Rust
description:
[Rsvg-convert](rsvg-convert.c) is the only executable we build; it's a small command-line program still done in C.  It should be ported to Rust and made to use the [librsvg crate API](https://gnome.pages.gitlab.gnome.org/librsvg/doc/librsvg/).

Since a bunch of external tools depend on `rsvg-convert`, we should make sure that the exact behavior of the command-line arguments is preserved.  I think structopt can do this with no problems.  Ideally we should have tests for the `rsvg-convert` binary to ensure that it works in the same way as the C version.

title: Gather data from OpenWeatherMap.org
description:
There is a "limited" amount of locations to gather data from on AWC stations list. This is a problem for example in Serbia since there are only three locations to gather info from whereas on OpenWeatherMap data can be found for each city. This would cover most of the problems with Gnome Wheather app, which is suffering from lack of weather data for specific cities.

OpenWeatherMap has an open API for gathering data so that part of the work is already done. It'd be great if this would be implemented. I'd like to help as much as I can.
