title: Changes in files in the Music directory are not registered until restarting the application
description:
In GrlTrackerWrapper, the source’s `content-changed` signal is connected to `self._batch_content_changed`. However, when I debug the app and remove or add some files to my Music directory, this function is never actually called, even though running `tracker search` confirms that tracker is already aware of the changes.

I’m not sure whether this is a bug of gnome-music or grilo-plugins.

title: Provide documentation to help fix split albums
description:
it happens that the same album is split in several albums (often due to id3 tags).
Having some explanation why and how to fix in the help would be nice.

If you give me some input (like the correct tracker command) I can write the documentation.

title: Allow favoring an entire album
description:
As far I see this is not possible to favourite an entire album (not each song of the album but the album).
Is it something you think it could be implemented ?

title: Add a volume slider
description:
Right now the volume of Gnome Music can only be controlled with `pactl set-sink-input-volume <number of the gnome music stream (can be found with pactl list sink-inputs)> <volume>` or by using pavucontrol et al.

This is a very tedious workaround for what should be a simple thing in my opinion.

title: Add OCR for pdf output
description:
When I scan administrative document saved as pdf, i want to be able to search document by word. 

One solution is to have a gnome search provider they use tesseract to index scanned pdf files. The big issue of this solution, it's impossible to select good language for each file.

An other solution is to embedded the text of the document in the pdf. To do that, I want to have an option to launch an OCR between the scan and the save action.

title: Preserve rotation and Live view
description:
I'm upgrading my h/w and was running simple-scan 3.20.0 on Ubuntu 16.4 LTS. \
Now running Linux Mint Tara and upgraded to simple-scan 3.35.2. (In the hope it would fix these issues found also on the Tara version 3.28.) \
My scanner is an Epson Perfection V39

Two issues I encounter:
- I used to have live view while the scanner is running, now I have to wait till the scan is finished. \
Since I have to clip all my scans, it was really handy to start clipping, before the scan was completed.

- The old version kept my rotation setting from last use. \
Now it gets reset, even at "Start Again..." \
I would like to see an option to preserve the rotation, as for me the default scan is 180 degree rotated.

Thank you, LinuxLover.

title: Auto move windows extension doesn't work correctly
description:
Hi.

There seems to be an issue with some applications and auto move windows.

I have 4 static workspaces. I've configured different applications to open in different workspaces but basically only two applications (from the ones that I wish to move to specific workspaces) work as intended (Chrome opens in workspace 2 and Skype in workspace 4).
I've setup terminal and files (nautilus) to open in workspace 1 but if I open them while being in another workspace then they open a frozen window in the workspace that I'm at and also in workspace 1.
I've setup Spotify to open in workspace 3. It works as much as opening the window in the right workspace but the focus doesn't switch to that window/workspace.

I disabled all other extensions to troubleshoot the issue but it still doesn't work correctly.

Pop!_OS 19.10, gnome 3.34.1.

if any additional info is needed then let me know.

Thanks.

WOW! ... way to completely and utterly shatter my confidence in 'calendar' !!! 

I entered a reminder for March 1st 2020 (no repeat) .. and it duplicates to all previous months, mostly all on the 1st of the month, but some on 29th.

If I go to previous months, and click on the duplicated entries, it displays the correct entry date '01.03.20'(UK) ...so why is it entered on February, January, December ... etc.

DAMN, that is a MAJOR BUG! ... I am stunned that it exists in such a SIMPLE application! 

It has made me question Fedora, and I certainly will NEVER be using this calendar again, that is shockingly SHAMEFUL! 

Seriously! ... a calendar!?

![fedora_calendar_BUG_ERROR_01](/uploads/87172c7a0a4f97731fd0234d957fd76c/fedora_calendar_BUG_ERROR_01.png)

![fedora_calendar_BUG_ERROR_02](/uploads/daecee4178d167110eb982ee6f127747/fedora_calendar_BUG_ERROR_02.png)

![fedora_calendar_BUG_ERROR_03](/uploads/57dc870a8d8fcf2d32bc074f5f5a2031/fedora_calendar_BUG_ERROR_03.png)

![fedora_calendar_BUG_ERROR_04](/uploads/68654224b219bc931a27b158a897f0fa/fedora_calendar_BUG_ERROR_04.png)

title: Gnome Calendar in Language Papiamento of Curacao
description:
Hí, I would like to give my congratulations for developing a calendar that uses my mother tongue as one of the displayed languages. Very nice!! It's the first time I see this. Maybe it exists for a while already, but this is my first experience with Ubuntu. 
I just wanted to report a small error in the abbreviation of the week days. These have been switched for the days Wednesday and Thursday. It should be "ra" for Wednesday and "we" for Thursday. It is no big deal if it stays like that, but I just wanted to contribute with this comment to make the calendar app even better. Thanks a lot for the nice work. 
Sincerely,

Mrs. Palacios.

title: Deleted event from series reappears
description:
This happens with nextcloud 17.0.0.2 calendars on Gnome Calendar 3.34.2-1+b1

If I delete a event from a series it reappears after gnome toast (Event deleted) vanished.

related: #503

title: Feature Request - Open Minimized
description:
Detailed description of the feature. Put as much information as you can.

This is hopefully a very simple-to-understand request. I would like to ask if it is possible to add a command line parameter to Calendar to permit it to launch in a minimized state.

The idea would be to allow me to add Calendar to the "Startup Applications" list of my GNOME (Mint Linux Cinnamon) desktop. The result would be that Calendar would auto-launch at system startup time, but do so minimized to the task bar. This would mean that scheduled events and reminders will trigger as desired. Without the auto-launch feature it's necessary to remember to activate Calendar, but it would be significantly neater to allow it to launch directly in the system tray. 

Proposed Mockups:
I don't believe this will be necessary for this proposal.

(Add mockups of the proposed feature)

title: Deleted/cancelled event from a series of events is still shown
description:
I'm using a Nextcloud calendar for my events (gnome-online-accounts integration into gnome-calendar (3.34.2) and webDAV sync to my smartphone, using Etar as an Android-App). Part of this calendar is an event which recurs each week. Sometimes I delete/cancel one of the events of the series, as I can't attend the event as of this week. If I delete the event using Etar on my smartphone, the event is marked as cancelled in my Nextcloud and Etar hides the event inside the app. In contrast in Gonme Calendar the event is not marked as cancelled nor is it deleted (both would be fine for me). I'm regularly confused seeing the event normally scheduled in gonme-calendar, but not on my smartphone.

What I actually expected:
The cancelled event is either not shown anymore (e.g. deleted) or marked as cancelled (e.g. crossed out).

title: Some unicode characters in display names cause issues
description:
A user in the `#test:matrix.org` room with userid `@grin:grin.hu` has a fancy display name using the power of Unicode: `𝓰𝓻𝓲𝓷`. Several things happen with it in Fractal:

* the name displayed in history before their message is `grin` in regular characters
* the space after the display name in the typing notification is not visible (there might not be much we can do about this one)
![Capture_d_écran_de_2019-12-06_16-12-13](/uploads/3d2629d7c004e146db79273ce38cceba/Capture_d_écran_de_2019-12-06_16-12-13.png)

Failed to connect to task list: The name is not activatable
description:
I am using Fedora Silverblue (rpm-ostree based) and just upgraded from Fedora 30 to Fedora 31. I was using gnome-todo in Fedora 30 through the official Flatpak (org.gnome.Todo) and it was working fine. With the upgrade to Fedora 31, it does not work anymore. gnome-todo is locked in a spinning state loading the todo lists.

There are errors on the console:

```
$ flatpak run org.gnome.Todo

(gnome-todo:2): Gtk-WARNING **: 11:29:09.840: gtk_window_present_with_time() should not be called with 0, or GDK_CURRENT_TIME as a timestamp, the timestamp should instead be gathered at the time the user initiated the request for the window to be shown

(gnome-todo:2): GtdProviderEds-WARNING **: 11:29:09.904: Failed to connect to task list '24e1b34875cd294454b7d6e177c954019c3b2037': Unable to connect to “calcul meubles”: The name is not activatable

(gnome-todo:2): GtdProviderEds-WARNING **: 11:29:09.913: Failed to connect to task list 'fd3dc1d7a6c328259f4278316c9a50bddf6d8802': Unable to connect to “CODDE - EIME”: The name is not activatable

(gnome-todo:2): GtdProviderEds-WARNING **: 11:29:09.918: Failed to connect to task list 'system-task-list': Unable to connect to “Personnel”: The name is not activatable

(gnome-todo:2): GtdProviderEds-WARNING **: 11:29:09.919: Failed to connect to task list '8ff9bbbc71600f3ce8b6016c2e2ee940f6dae367': Unable to connect to “cambuse (whilelm)”: The name is not activatable

(gnome-todo:2): GtdProviderEds-WARNING **: 11:29:09.924: Failed to connect to task list '2facf60dff9c37146771b00e4d1f528c736f9dd4': Unable to connect to “Équipage (rezine)”: The name is not activatable

(gnome-todo:2): GtdProviderEds-WARNING **: 11:29:09.941: Failed to connect to task list '210a1cc930402c9f9e5a2435efcd20ab615a0a3a': Unable to connect to “Personal”: The name is not activatable
```

I suppose that there is a service missing on dBus

gnome-todo is running version 3.28.1-3.28.1

When I inspect the dBus, I see the following names registered:

```
$ qdbus | grep -i evolution
 org.gnome.evolution.dataserver.AddressBook10
 org.gnome.evolution.dataserver.Sources5
 org.gnome.evolution.dataserver.Calendar8
 org.gnome.Evolution-alarm-notify
```

The version of evolution-data-server installed on the system (Fedora 31) is evolution-data-server-3.34.2-1.fc31.x86_64

While writing the issue, I found that it seemed to be a version mismatch between the flatpak version and the system version that are incompatible. it has already been reported to the flathub maintainers at https://github.com/flathub/org.gnome.Todo/issues/8

I'm leaving this issue there to help other people find it.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open GNOME To Do

title: Add memory counter profiling
description:
# Description #
We want to have some way to make memory usage visible in GJS applications (and particularly gnome-shell). I have an experimental branch that adds a `System.memoryInfo()` API which gnome-shell could consume, and an experimental branch of gnome-shell to make it visible in Looking Glass. However, @feaneron's idea was to use [`sysprof_capture_writer_set_counters()`](https://github.com/GNOME/sysprof/blob/mainline/src/libsysprof-capture/sysprof-capture-writer.c#L1207) and thereby remove the need to incorporate some sort of graphing; we can just use Sysprof for visualization. That also makes it unnecessary to settle on a `System.memoryInfo()` API that we have to stick to.

# Prior Art #
- the about:memory page in Firefox
- the Task Manager in Chrome

title: gjs-symlink script is incompatible with distro builds
description:
I tried switching gnome-build-meta to use the meson build, but it is broken:

```
Installing /buildstream/gnome/sdk/gjs.bst/installed-tests/debugger/finish.debugger.output to /buildstream-install/usr/
libexec/gjs/installed-tests/debuggerTraceback (most recent call last):
  File "/buildstream/gnome/sdk/gjs.bst/build/symlink-gjs.py", line 26, in <module>
    os.symlink('gjs-console', temp_link)
OSError: [Errno 30] Read-only file system: 'gjs-console' -> '/usr/bin/tmpzfg0nr0u'
```

Problem is distro build systems (not just buildstream, but all distro build systems) install into a temporary destdir, then copy everything into the final location. I'm not actually sure how this is supposed to work, but I will keep squinting at it for a bit longer. I know we've dealt with issues like this in the past, so someone else from release team will likely know.

title: GObject: Add override for GObject.handler_block_by_func
description:
Seem that GJS miss the GObject.handler_block_by_func() function. 
This is useful to avoid recursion when programmatically add text to an editable. [1]
The only way to avoid recursion seem to be with GObject.signal_handler_block() and a search for the correct handler_id with GObject.signal_handler_find() [2]

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40074977/how-to-format-the-entries-in-gtk-entry/40163816#40163816

[2] https://discourse.gnome.org/t/how-to-avoid-recursion-on-a-entry-validator/2192

title: Unable to connect to Freenode; possible server authentication error (v3.34.0)
description:
**Summary**: Polari 3.34.0 is unable to connect to Freenode network and asks for Freenode password even after the correct password has been given.

**Description**: The Freenode network was selected from the "Add Network" dialogue (Fig. 1). The user is prompted to join a chat room (Fig. 2). However, no chat messages are loaded.

A key icon appears next to thenetwork name, presumably indicating that Freenode has requested a password for the requested nickname. After setting the desired nickname in the "Properies" dialogue (reached by secondary-click on the network listing), the user enters the correct pssword for that nickname (Fig. 3). (The accureacy of the password was verified by successfully logging into Freenode on Weechat using the specified nickname and password.)

The key icon is replaced by a "loading" (spinning disk) icon for a few seconds (Fig. 4), before reverting back to the key icon (Fig. 5). _All attempts to connect to Freenode using Polari will result in an endless loop of being asked for a password._

**Screenshots**

_Fig. 1_ ![fig_1](/uploads/435f64f9f37464248462f4e3a77f1e8b/fig_1.png)

_Fig. 2_ ![fig_2](/uploads/7c665b861203b26e253fa5a208f8a29d/fig_2.png)

_Fig. 3_ ![fig_3](/uploads/3af19ce6be758d4d6d78b0c2d2f5ed52/fig_3.png)

_Fig. 4_ ![fig_4](/uploads/a2238d330db0b1f7fbdfd4ab7e2f0911/fig_4.png)

_Fig. 5_ ![fig_5](/uploads/93d9c6174767ee05d8f9b91edd167aa0/fig_5.png)

**Details**
* Polari 3.34.0
* GNOME 3.34.1
* Pop! OS (Ubuntu) 19.10

title: Stuck on the « Join a room using the + button » screen
description:
I'm using Polari from Flathub on a Fedora 31 host.

Since a few days (not sure what changed then), when I start Polari all I can see is the list of channels on the left, and the main panel with this:

![Screenshot_from_2019-11-30_09-41-04](/uploads/6b8dcd9308aee8dbf62d2dc395325b58/Screenshot_from_2019-11-30_09-41-04.png)

Polari stays this way no matter which room I select.

I receive messages from NickServ and other such bots. I receive messages from other people. The room names become bold when someone says something in one of them, as usual, but since I can't read messages they remain bold. The list of people in each room seems to be correctly populated.

But I can't type any message, and I can't actually read other people's messages, because I'm perpetually stuck on the « Join a room using the + button » panel.

title: <data>:1:85: Parse error: invalid string constant "grep transferred | cut -d", expected valid string constant
description:
As the title discribe, I encountered this error. The original data is as follows:
{"KeyResults":[{"Name":"test_name","Type":"shell","Value":"grep transferred | cut -d"(" -f2 | cut -d")" -f1"}]}

This json string is generated by json generator and using json_generator_to_data to get the json string. 
I know the problem is caused by the double quotes, yet I wander that why there is no escape functions in json_parser function collections. 

A json generator generated json string could not be parsed using json parser? I think this should not happen. It is not consistency.

Best wishes.

title: Gnome on Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS text copying triggers apparently useless file writes
description:
Crossposted here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nautilus/+bug/1836960


---------------------

Description:

I recently noticed a strange behavior on my (pretty vanilla) Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS. Every time I copy some text from GNOME Terminal, using keyboard or mouse, it triggers a little hard drive activity.

Intrigued, I decided to see what was going on (persistent clipboard data?). After some investigation, I found out that the activity is due to a file being written to whenever I do a copy in GNOME Terminal (or in other apps):

    ~/.config/nautilus/desktop-metadata

The small file seems to record the nautilus view settings and the trash icon state, has no apparent relation to functions of the clipboard, and does not mutate following each write (the content stays unchanged).

I also tested to see if the same happens on a different computer running 18.04.2 desktop live usb, and the answer is yes. So this shouldn't be something particular to my system.

--------------------
Steps to reproduce:

* Boot your computer using live CD or usb created with:
ubuntu-18.04.2-desktop-amd64.iso

You can obtain it from:
http://releases.ubuntu.com/18.04/

last modified: 2019-02-10 00:27

sha256: 22580b9f3b186cc66818e60f44c46f795d708a1ad86b9225c458413b638459c4)

* Start Gnome Terminal, copy some text from there, and note the current time when you perform the copying

* Check the timestamp of ~/.config/nautilus/desktop-metadata and observe it's been modified at the same time you did the copying

* Repeat as many times as you like

--------------------
Expected behavior:

Copying text in Gnome should not trigger writes to some arbitrary file (and should not trigger any disk IO at all).

title: MimeType= entry in desktop files is not respected in open with context menu.
description:
```
 * Nautilus version (nautilus --version): GNOME nautilus 3.32.3
 * Distribution - gLinux
 * 64 bit
 ```

## Issue
MimeType associations from desktop files don't show up in the right-click context menu in Nautilus, only associations from `mimeapps.list`.



## Steps to reproduce
Create a new .desktop file called `test-entry.desktop`, with the following contents:

```
[Desktop Entry]
Version=1.0
Name=Test Entry
Icon=/usr/share/icons/hicolor/256x256/apps/gedit.png
Exec=/usr/bin/gedit %F
Terminal=false
MimeType=text/plain
Type=Application
```

**Note:** According to the the [spec page](https://developer.gnome.org/desktop-entry-spec/#mime-types) the `MimeType` entry should indicate that the application can handle files with the text/plain mime type.

**Note:** I'm using gedit as an example. Also, the desktop entry doesn't seem to work unless the icon is valid.

Install the desktop entry by running the following command:

    xdg-desktop-menu install test-entry.desktop

Check that the entry was installed correctly by searching for "Test Entry" in the menu/launcher. Opening it should launch gedit.

Create a new text file `foo.txt`. Right click on this file in Nautilus. 

![nautilus-no-option](/uploads/d1468150a187920a85b9fe7d0fec973c/nautilus-no-option.png)

**Expected behaviour**
Test Entry should be a recommended option for opening `foo.txt`. The below screenshot shows what happens in the Dolphin file manager (which is correct, as I understand it).
![dolphin-option](/uploads/840357f9a5ddd5675f656d389df6fc54/dolphin-option.png)

## Additional Information
Nautilus does seem to know that test-entry.desktop can handle files (I believe it looks for the `%F` argument to `Exec`), just not the types it can actually handle (i.e. it shows up in the Other Applications section of the open with menu, not the Recommended Applications section). It could just be that I'm misunderstanding how this is meant to work.
 
To test that the handler is registered with properly, I listed the output of `mimeopen` for `foo.txt`
![mimeopen output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7678024/71220657-6b555680-231d-11ea-8181-636005a04503.png) and `Test Entry` is listed as an option.

Nautilus seem to use the `[Added Associations]` in `mimeapps.list` to determine what applications to show in the open with menu. This is somewhat inconvenient, as there is no easy way (that I could find) to edit this via command line tools (you can change the default application with `xdg-mime default text/plain test-entry.desktop` but not add/remove associations).

I filed a similar bug against Nemo here: https://github.com/linuxmint/nemo/issues/2277

title: Support hidden files in the XDG_TEMPLATES_DIR to populate the "New Documents" right-click menu
description:
I'm not sure where the best place to put this issue report would be, since I'm unaware if this is a problem with a freedesktop.org spec (or other standard), or instead with the implementation in Nautilus and other similar browsers, but I thought this would be the best place to open a discussion.

Right now, if I place a file beginning with a period (.) inside the XDG_TEMPLATES_DIR (typically ~/Templates), Nautilus ignores that it's there and doesn't present it as an option in the "New Document" menu that is visible when right-clicking in other directories. 

### Use cases

There are many times when I want to generate a specific type of new, hidden file. The couple examples that I would personally use, though not an exhaustive list, include:
* A new .gitignore file in a new git repository
* A .nomedia file to tell Android to ignore media files in a given directory


### Desired behavior

Nautilus should ignore the hidden nature of these files, and present them as options for "New Documents" in the right-click menu.


### Benefits of the solution

It makes it quick and easy for users to generate needed hidden files without having to create a new empty document (or having to use a "non-hidden" version of the template file), right-click, rename, and set a new name with the period at the beginning to make it hidden.

### Possible drawbacks

The only drawback I can think of is that a new file generated from a "hidden" template would not be immediately visible if hidden files are disabled, however I don't anticipate this being a real issue because people who use this feature would reasonably expect such behavior.

<!-- Ignore the text under this line. -->

title: Show full file path on external locations
description:
The scenario is the following: I am connecting to my server with Nautilus over SSH to access the file system on this device.

When manually connecting using "Other Locations" by typing in the protocol and IP address it drops me in the root directory, which is where I need to be. However the quick access entry which appears after connecting to the server points to the home directory of the user I am logged in as. So when using the quick access entry in the menu after closing and reopening Nautilus I will be unable to reach any folder on the server below my user's home directory.

Due to this the only way for me to get to the folders below the user's home directory on the external device is by either manually navigating to the it's location via "Other locations" by typing the protocol, IP address and port all over again, by manually adding a quick access entry pointing to root on the external device or by browsing to it's mount point.


The solution doesn't have to be what I am suggesting here, a dropdown button containing all folders before the current shortened file path could potentially also work.


### Desired behavior
The full file path from root should be shown when connecting to external devices over SSH/SFTP to allow access to any part of the file system.


### Benefits of the solution
Improved navigation on external connections over SSH/SFTP.


### Possible drawbacks
Would make the interface less clean on external connections due to the longer file paths in the navigation bar while in the user's home directory.

    2. Copy and run the following command in a Terminal:

title: group/ungroup multiple windows in tabs
description:
### Use cases
I have multiple nautilus windows openned. I want to groupe all of then in a simple window, by tabs. 
Or I have multiple tabs oppened in a single window, and i want them to split in windows view

### Desired behavior
Clic on the hamburger menu -> group all windows in tab view

Clic on the hamburger menu -> ungroup all tabs in windows view


### Benefits of the solution
Better windows management

Currently it just warns that a file with that name already exists.

title: Missing DnD from "Other locations"
description: Currently it is not possible to DnD volumes in the "Other locations" tab, which means it is not even possible to bookmark a volume in the sidebar until it is mounted and the (undiscoverable) "Add to Bookmarks" button in the top/location bar is used.

title: Increase default thumbnail generation size to a value higher than 10MB
description:
The current thumbnail generation size (v3.34 on Fedora 31) is just 10 MB. That means even many small length videos, reasonably small PDFs don't generate thumbnails. Increasing it to 100 MB makes more sense IMO.

![Screenshot_from_2019-11-17_16-54-37](/uploads/f15fe120c7e1efad0d70fd1cdb3c6489/Screenshot_from_2019-11-17_16-54-37.png)

title: Enable "Sort folders before files" by default
description:
![Screenshot_from_2019-11-17_16-54-22](/uploads/055f3ecd54ee95de22f9883065ccb4b5/Screenshot_from_2019-11-17_16-54-22.png)

A mix of folders and files looks noisy and it becomes harder to visually identify the correct file/folder one is looking for. Setting folders to be visible in a view first followed by files solves that.

title: Give/record helpful feedback if a drag & drop action fails
description:
### Use cases
<!-- Describe what problem(s) the user is experiencing and that this request
is trying to solve. -->
When dragging and dropping a file from Nautilus into another program, if the action can't be completed then the icon moves back to the Nautilus window with no further feedback regarding why. It could just be simple user error, or it could be a more complex issue involving permissions, or either app, or their libraries...

Examples: dragging an image file into GIMP, to either open it or add it as a new layer, but it won't go; dragging an image into MusicBrainz Picard, to update a resource's cover art, but it won't go and there's no other mechanism to add it.

### Desired behavior
<!-- Describe the desired functionality. -->
It's probably not a good idea to display a modal dialog with the relevant information for every failure, especially in the case of simple user error ("Why are you dragging a .jpg into Sound Converter? Don't do that. [OK]").

It would be really helpful if, at least, the failure and the text of any corresponding errors were logged somewhere for further investigation. Taking it further, maybe there could be an error-reporting widget in the top of the Nautilus window, temporarily displayed like the transient file-copying widget, which similarly expands to display recent pertinent information or open the log when selected?

### Benefits of the solution
<!-- List the possible benefits of the solution and how it fits in the project. -->
Users would get a better idea of which drag & drop operations are appropriate for their system, and which aren't.

Users could also use the logged information to search and further diagnose changes in behaviour which worked before, but don't anymore due to updates or conflicts or other differences.

### Possible drawbacks
<!--
     Describe possible drawbacks of the feature and list how it could affect
     the project i.e. UI discoverability, complexity, impact in more or less
     number of users, etc.
-->
If the user is a prolific dragger, this could fill up the logs with a lot of cruft.

An extra widget at the top of the Nautilus window could get annoying if it happens a lot, potentially leading to users frustrated with it and wanting to get rid of it.

<!-- Ignore the text under this line. -->

title: Max path bar container width is unnecessary limited
description:
# Current behavior
Since ~~3.30, IIRC~~ fade3e5d, max path bar container width is unnecessary limited. This is especially painful when dealing with deeply nested folders on high resolutions screens, where there is plenty of space for displaying unnecessary truncated paths. 

Example of a truncated path on a high resolution screen:
![example_of_a_truncated_path_on_a_high_resoluton_screen](/uploads/f1d12859c92c54eb21779de7c9e5b12f/example_of_a_truncated_path_on_a_high_resoluton_screen.png)


# Expected behavior
Path bar should expand to fill the remaining free window space when necessary.

title: Network folder caching
description:
### Use cases
<!-- Describe what problem(s) the user is experiencing and that this request
is trying to solve. -->
When exploring a remote location (in my case a Samba filesystem) I frequently open a folder, see that what I'm looking for is not there, and go back up to check other folders. Every time I go back the contents are fetched again which takes more than 10 seconds, making the process extremely slow.

### Desired behavior
<!-- Describe the desired functionality. -->
The contents are extremely likely to remain unchanged, so they should be cached and shown instantly. New contents can be requested either manually via F5. Alternatively, they can be requested automatically and replace the cached contents when the request completes (although this could result in an issue of the user clicking right after the new contents are shown and going down a wrong folder if contents did change).

### Benefits of the solution
<!-- List the possible benefits of the solution and how it fits in the project. -->
Exploring network shares over a slow connection ~~stops being a torture~~ becomes twice as fast, and more, depending on the user's folder access pattern.

### Possible drawbacks
<!--
     Describe possible drawbacks of the feature and list how it could affect
     the project i.e. UI discoverability, complexity, impact in more or less
     number of users, etc.
-->
New contents for cached folders are not shown right away. However, if the user expects the contents to change, they can use F5 manually.

<!-- Ignore the text under this line. -->

title: windows close unexpectedly after moving/copying files using Alt+drag on Wayland
description:
I'm running Nautilus 3.34.1 on Ubuntu 19.10.

If I hold down Alt and drag a file to a different Nautilus window, then a context menu appears allowing me to move, copy, or link the file.  (This is a nice feature, by the way.)

Under Wayland, after I choose any of the actions from the context menu, both the source and destination windows close unepxectedly.  (This works fine under X.)

description:
I'm running Nautilus 3.34.1 on Ubuntu 19.10.

Under Wayland, I can't use Ctrl+Shift+drag to create a symbolic link to a file.  Instead, the file is moved to the destination location. (This is a bit dangerous since it's easy to think you that you've created a link, and not realize you've moved a file by mistake - this just happened to me).

This works fine under X.

title: Should _get_review_score() factor in review date?
description:
Looking at the reviews on (for example) Calibre, the ones listed at the top of the reviews list in gnome-software are from 2017 and 2016, 3–4 years ago. They’re likely for quite a different version of Calibre by this point.

Should the calculation in `_get_review_score()` factor in the age of a review, and slowly degrade the scores of reviews over time, so that newer ones get a chance to be read and upvoted/downvoted?

Currently, the algorithm seems to be based on a Wilson average of the upvotes and downvotes, which (I think) will tend towards a stable state where a few reviews have received a higher proportion of upvotes, so will bubble to the top of the list of reviews, and hence will be the ones that most people see, so will receive proportionally more upvotes (than reviews which are hidden under the ‘Show More’ button in gnome-software), and hence maintain their position.

There are some hardcoded penalties for reviews for old versions of apps, or on other distributions, but I think they’re only equal to one downvote, which doesn’t seem like very much.

(This report is all based on my reading of the code being that `_get_review_score()` essentially determines the order of reviews as shown to the user. Please correct me if I’m wrong!)

title: Proxy seems to be preventing accessing subgroups via GitLab API
description:
I've noticed this first when researching [an issue](https://github.com/release-monitoring/anitya/issues/763#issuecomment-564018770) for https://release-monitoring.org.

To access subgroups of a group, you have to separate them by `%2F` in the URL of the endpoint. Apparently, a proxy decodes that to `/` making the GitLab backend instance not find it, e.g. for [World/OpenPaperwork](https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/OpenPaperwork):

````
nils@gibraltar:~> http get 'https://gitlab.gnome.org/api/v4/groups/World%2FOpenPaperwork'
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Cache-Control: no-cache
Connection: close
Content-Length: 33
Content-Type: application/json
Date: Tue, 10 Dec 2019 12:35:30 GMT
Server: Apache/2.4.6 (Red Hat Enterprise Linux)
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=15768000;includeSubdomains
Vary: Origin
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
X-Request-Id: Fvx8we3AQy2
X-Runtime: 0.033270

{
    "message": "404 Group Not Found"
}

nils@gibraltar:~>
````

GitLab upstream has configuration snippets for various web proxies here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-recipes/tree/master/web-server

title: Cannot view files using URL-encoded paths
description:
When I go to https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk/find_file/master, type `gtk.h` and click the first selected item it goes to `https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk/blob/master/gtk%2Fgtk.h`, redirecting me to `https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk/tree/master` and flashing the following message:

> "gtk%2Fgtk.h" did not exist on "master"

This is pretty annoying as I cannot even tweak the URL manually. And since no file under a subdirectory can be accessed using the *Find file* tool, it makes it pretty useless.

This is most likely caused by incorrect web server configuration, as gitlab.com and salsa.debian.org instances seem to load URL-encoded paths just fine, see for example `https://salsa.debian.org/gnome-team/gtk3/blob/debian/master/gtk%2Fgtk.h`.

Most likely introduced by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/issues/62055

title: Fujitsu fi-4120C no duplex results in 1.3 on linux
description:
Hi @jflesch, in https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/OpenPaperwork/libinsane/issues/26#note_669868 you said that the duplex scan for the above model should already work in 1.3. 

However, I am running 1.3.0-2 from the arch community repository, where paperwork does not display two scanned pages when scanned in duplex. However, the setting for the source results in significantly different scan time either for duplex or front/back, so the scanner itself is most likely doing the correct thing, what I also can see from the logs. Back and front separately are also correctly scanned. Somehow in a duplex scan paperwork seems to ignore the second scanned picture.

I noticed also in ironscanner when I submitted my scanner data, it did report that it scanned two images, but in ironscanners result, only the first one has been submitted as an image.

I see one suspicious warning after the scan:

title: Add option for the scan mode (lineart. halftone, gray, color)
description:
I noticed that paperwork has only a setting for the scan resolution. I used to scan documents with `gscan2pdf` using the *lineart* mode to get large batches of double sided documents processed fast. 

![image](/uploads/3599ef8aac493c971102bd180451a53e/image.png)

Could you add such a drop down list?

milestone.description: 2.0 will introduce plugins. Now it's time to use them.

title: Paperwork 2.X GUI
description:
@mjourdan 

Hello,

I'm about to start rewriting the UI code for 2.0. It's a good opportunity for me to try to match your new designs as much as possible.

I had a look at the various tickets regarding UI changes and the paperwork-design repository and those mockups look great, but I must say I'm a little confused :/. What are the latest recommended versions ? Are they [the mockups in experiments-2.0](https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/OpenPaperwork/paperwork-design/tree/master/experiments-2.0) ? If so, there seem to be some contradictions between some of them. For example: the top left part of the main window doesn't appear to be the same in those 3 mockups : [1](https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/OpenPaperwork/paperwork-design/blob/17d23b31636baa9bcf538c8cc4db5d6197d49c29/experiments-2.0/3-columns-layout-switching.png), [2](https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/OpenPaperwork/paperwork-design/blob/17d23b31636baa9bcf538c8cc4db5d6197d49c29/experiments-2.0/3-columns-layout-switching-2.png), [3](https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/OpenPaperwork/paperwork-design/blob/17d23b31636baa9bcf538c8cc4db5d6197d49c29/experiments-2.0/add-paper-import-from-file.png). Does that mean we still have to decide what we actually want ?

title: "Simple" document list mods take too long
description:
Activities like
* create a new document
* delete a document
* change a document's date
currently take a long time when you have many documents, as the whole list is recreated.

This can be sped up a lot by adding and/or deleting the appropriate entry directly.

title: Document view should be centered
description:
1.3.0-10-ge6d00bc4 (Flatpak)

Currently, the document view is left-aligned, would be cool if that could be changed to center them!

![Bildschirmfoto_von_2019-12-08_00-33-06](/uploads/627bfca4d45c6003321878915ff6a2c3/Bildschirmfoto_von_2019-12-08_00-33-06.png)

title: Do not create ~/papers by default
description:
1.3.0-10-ge6d00bc4 (Flatpak)

I installed and ran Paperwork and without having scanned one document, I see a `paper` folder in my home directory. Please do not trash user’s home directories – if every program would act like this, it would be a total catastrophe! Please change that to maybe a dialog box at first scan or anything like that.

Regarding the Flatpak: Shouldn’t direct access to user’s home directory be banned by the Flatpak sandbox? I would expect a portal request for any access to anything outside the application’s very own folders. And that all application data would get saved in those appdata folder somewhere in `~/.var/app/work.openpaper.Paperwork/`.

title: Indexing a large document base fails w/ out of memory
description:
I have approx. 3500 documents. After re-indexing 30% I had to kill paperwork because it took up 10G of memory.

I suspect that is because it's caching all the PDFs instead of, say, only the last ten or so.

title: Scanning error in OpenPaperwork with networked Canon CanoScan 9000F flatbed scanner
description:
I have a networked scanner (a Canon CanoScan 9000F flatbed). The app recognises it which is great! However, if I try 'test scan', leaving the resolution at the default of 300bpi, I always get an error:
 "error while scanning libinsane-quark: Libinsane opt[resolution]-> set_value() error : 0x40000003, invalid value (4)" 
(I previously and mistakenly added this error to a previous issue, and, as requested, I am now opening a new issue for it. I will post the comments kindly made before)

Jerome replied:
"Probably a Libinsane bug. Can you submit a test scan report with IronScanner please ? (you can submit the report even if the test scan has failed)"

So, I tried to use the Linux pre-compiled? version of Iron-Scanner from https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/OpenPaperwork/ironscanner#linux but it failed - quite spectacularly! However, I was able to build from source (at the same URL) and Iron-Scanner worked and sent a test scan, as requested. Hopefully, this will be useful in determining the error cause? Thanks for all your assistance!

title: [SANE] if device is busy hangs forever (until device becomes free?)
description:
##### Way to reproduce:
0. Hang device (I just tried to scan until previous scan session wasn't ended)
1. Try to scan using this device

##### Result:
All hang forever, back trace is:
```
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff79a7384 in __libc_read (fd=141, buf=0xc0000ba000, nbytes=65536) at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/read.c:27

```

##### Expected result:
Error after some timeout, similar `scanimage`:

title: Does not build with `-O2 -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2` compiler options
description:
Debian automatically applies some hardening flags to produce safer binaries.

Among the different default flags[^1], the combination of `-O2` and `-D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2` raises a compilation error since version 1.0.3:
```bash
[...]
[55/104] ccache cc -Isubprojects/libinsane/src/14d7ecf@@insane@sha -Isubprojects/libinsane/src -I../subprojects/libinsane/src -Isubprojects/libinsane/include -I../subprojects/libinsane/include -fdiagnostics-color=always -pipe -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -Wall -Winvalid-pch -Wextra -Werror -g -DOS_LINUX -DCOMPILER_GCC -O2 -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -fPIC -pthread -MD -MQ 'subprojects/libinsane/src/14d7ecf@@insane@sha/multiplexer.c.o' -MF 'subprojects/libinsane/src/14d7ecf@@insane@sha/multiplexer.c.o.d' -o 'subprojects/libinsane/src/14d7ecf@@insane@sha/multiplexer.c.o' -c ../subprojects/libinsane/src/multiplexer.c
FAILED: subprojects/libinsane/src/14d7ecf@@insane@sha/multiplexer.c.o 
ccache cc -Isubprojects/libinsane/src/14d7ecf@@insane@sha -Isubprojects/libinsane/src -I../subprojects/libinsane/src -Isubprojects/libinsane/include -I../subprojects/libinsane/include -fdiagnostics-color=always -pipe -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -Wall -Winvalid-pch -Wextra -Werror -g -DOS_LINUX -DCOMPILER_GCC -O2 -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -fPIC -pthread -MD -MQ 'subprojects/libinsane/src/14d7ecf@@insane@sha/multiplexer.c.o' -MF 'subprojects/libinsane/src/14d7ecf@@insane@sha/multiplexer.c.o.d' -o 'subprojects/libinsane/src/14d7ecf@@insane@sha/multiplexer.c.o' -c ../subprojects/libinsane/src/multiplexer.c
../subprojects/libinsane/src/multiplexer.c: In function ‘build_base_name’:
../subprojects/libinsane/src/multiplexer.c:66:4: error: ignoring return value of ‘asprintf’, declared with attribute warn_unused_result [-Werror=unused-result]
   66 |    asprintf(
      |    ^~~~~~~~~
   67 |     &n_base_name, "%s:%s", base_name,
      |     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
   68 |     input_implementations[i]->base_name
      |     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
   69 |    );
      |    ~
cc1: all warnings being treated as errors
[...]
```

To reproduce:
```bash
mkdir build && cd build
CFLAGS='-O2 -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2' meson --werror --warnlevel 2 --prefix=/usr/local ..
ninja -v
```

I'm not sure which are the specific options that trigger this error but an easy fix would be something like that:
```c
nb_bytes_written = asprintf(
    &n_base_name, "%s:%s", base_name,
    input_implementations[i]->base_name
);
if (nb_bytes_written == -1); {
    lis_error("Could not allocate name string");
}
```

In that case the compiler detects returned value is used.

Another possible fix is to add (on the packaging side) the `-Wno-unused-result` flag which disable the unused return values warnings.

It depends on whether you prefer to fix it in the library code or not.

[^1]: the full list for this package is the following:

```
CFLAGS=-g -O2 -fdebug-prefix-map=/build/debian/libinsane=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security
CPPFLAGS=-Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2
CXXFLAGS=-g -O2 -fdebug-prefix-map=/build/debian/libinsane=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security
FCFLAGS=-g -O2 -fdebug-prefix-map=/build/debian/libinsane=. -fstack-protector-strong
FFLAGS=-g -O2 -fdebug-prefix-map=/build/debian/libinsane=. -fstack-protector-strong
GCJFLAGS=-g -O2 -fdebug-prefix-map=/build/debian/libinsane=. -fstack-protector-strong
LDFLAGS=-Wl,-z,relro
OBJCFLAGS=-g -O2 -fdebug-prefix-map=/build/debian/libinsane=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security
OBJCXXFLAGS=-g -O2 -fdebug-prefix-map=/build/debian/libinsane=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security
```

title: Device ID may change
description:
for instance:

```
sane:plustek:libusb:002:079
```

may become later

```
sane:plustek:libusb:002:080
```

The application should try to select the closer scanner ID it can find if the exact scanner is not found.

title: Allow forcing scanner option values through environment variables
description:
Users could force option values through environment variables.

It would help for debugging or to workaround issues.

Example: B&W and Lineart are not yet supported in Libinsane+WIA2, Libinsane+TWAIN and so Paperwork provides no option to set it. However it works fine with Libinsane+Sane. Letting users force the option `mode` to `Lineart` would let them scan in B&W for the time being.

```
export LIBINSANE_FORCE_OPTS=mode:Lineart,resolution=100
```

title: Documentation: Is it guaranteed that "resolution" option is always DPI?
description: Cant it be any other unit on any platform?

title: [Sane] discrepency between resolutions scanimage and Libinsane
description:
Is it ok that max resolutions of same device are different on different systems? For example the max resolution is 600 on widnows and only 300 on linux on Canon i-SENSYS MF3010.

##### WIA:
```
resolution(Scan resolution)[Sets the resolution of the scanned image.] Type: `int64` Constraints: `[75,150,300]` Unit: `PI` Capabilities: `LIS_CAP_AUTOMATIC|LIS_CAP_SW_SELECT`
```
##### Sane:
```
resolution(xres)[Horizontal Resolution] Type: `int64` Constraints: `[50,75,100,125,150,175,200,225,250,275,300,325,350,375,400,425,450,475,500,525,550,575,600]` Unit: `NONE` Capabilities: `LIS_CAP_EMULATED|LIS_CAP_SW_SELECT`
```

title: Windows: Scan failed with Unknown error
description:
My OpemPaperwork didn't scan on Windows, so I updated it by just installing the latest version (without uninstalling).

Now, in "scanner calibarion" it scanning:

title: Sane/WIA/TWAIN Should area options be normalized?
Documentation: is option `br-x` bottom left or right?
description:
https://doc.openpaper.work/libinsane/latest/libinsane/howto_general.html
```
Scan area options:

    tl-x: Top left corner of the area that will be scanner. X coordinates. No guarantees regarding the type of its value.
    tl-y: Top left corner of the area that will be scanner. Y coordinates. No guarantees regarding the type of its value.
    br-x: Bottom left corner of the area that will be scanner. X coordinates. No guarantees regarding the type of its value.
    br-y: Bottom left corner of the area that will be scanner. Y coordinates. No guarantees regarding the type of its value.
```
Is it correct, that `br-x` and `br-y` are about bottom left corner?

title: [WIA/TWAIN] Non-connected scanners should not be listed
description:
When using Sane on Linux, non-connected scanners cannot be listed with `impl->list_devices()`. Therefore they shouldn't appear either when using TWAIN or WIA2.

Documentation should mention that too.

title: Windows: call impl->get_device() while scan causes app crash with code "Access violation - code c0000005 (first chance)"
description:
##### Way to reproduce:
1. Starct scan process in another program from the device
2. Call `impl->get_device(impl, dev_id, item)`

##### Result:
app crushes with exit code -1073741819 (0xC0000005)

##### Expected result:
`get_device` returnes LIS_ERROR

title: Sane/WIA/TWAIN: call get_device while this device is scanning causes LibInsane internal error
description:
##### Way to reproduce:
1. Start long scan session in first application with the device (dpi = 2400 in my case)
2. Try to call `lis_api->get_device` with the same device id in another app

##### Result:
`LIS_ERR_INTERNAL_UNKNOWN_ERROR` is returned

description: May be there are some recommendation to make right choose? On what should buffer size depend? What about mention it in documentation?

title: WIA: network scanner connection problem causes endless hang
description:
##### Way to reproduce:
0. "Remote" network scanner and troubles with network (scanner is unreachable). Scanner is detected as local by libinsane.
1. Call `lisErr = impl->get_device(impl, "wia2ll:{6BDD1FC6-810F-11D0-BEC7-08002BE2092F}\\0002", correct_pointer);`

##### Result:
Call hangs forever (30+ minutes)

##### Expected result:
Call returns error 

##### Additional info:
For example another program returns such error:
```
NAPS2.Scan.Exceptions.ScanDriverUnknownException: Ошибка драйвера сканирования. ---> NAPS2.Scan.Wia.Native.WiaException: WIA error code 8021000A
   в NAPS2.Scan.Wia.Native.WiaDeviceManager.FindDevice(String deviceID)
   в NAPS2.Scan.Wia.WiaScanOperation.Scan(Concrete source)
   в NAPS2.Scan.Wia.WiaScanOperation.<>c__DisplayClass26_0.<Start>b__0()
   --- Конец трассировки внутреннего стека исключений ---
   в NAPS2.Scan.Wia.WiaScanErrors.ThrowDeviceError(WiaException e)
   в NAPS2.Scan.Wia.WiaScanOperation.<>c__DisplayClass26_0.<Start>b__0()
   в Microsoft.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   в Microsoft.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccess(Task task)
   в NAPS2.Scan.ScanDriverBase.<>c__DisplayClass30_0.<<Scan>b__0>d.MoveNext()
   в Microsoft.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   в Microsoft.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccess(Task task)
   в NAPS2.Scan.ScanPerformer.<PerformScan>d__7.MoveNext()
```
`Ошибка драйвера сканирования` is `Scan driver error`

title: Ironscanner won't start on arch linux
description:
I wanted to help by contributing to the scanner db. Using Arch linux, ironscanner always crashes. It complains about a missing `/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/gdk-pixbuf-2.0/2.10.0/loaders/libpixbufloader-png.so`, which seems to be the location on debian based systems, but not in arch linux, where it is in `usr/lib/gdk-pixbuf-2.0/2.10.0/loaders/libpixbufloader-png.so`

title: Update to libhandy 0.12
description: libhandy 0.12 was [released](https://source.puri.sm/Librem5/libhandy/-/releases) recently with lots of exciting changes. Would be cool to be able to use those from the rust bindings soon.

title: Update to new gtk-rs stack release
description:
The gtk-rs project had a [new release](https://gtk-rs.org/blog/2019/12/15/new-release.html) recently.
Would be great if this crate could be updated to work with gtk-rs again.

Currently I'm getting lots of
```
the trait `glib::object::IsA<glib::object::Object>` is not implemented for `libhandy::auto::leaflet::Leaflet`
```
and similar errors.

title: Context menu stays open after double click
description:
Using GNOME 3.34, the context menu stays open after doing a double-click action

![Peek_2019-12-26_22-17](/uploads/ede8188c5cb832535a8886724138dce1/Peek_2019-12-26_22-17.gif)

Expected behaviour: the context menu closes after opening a folder, viewing an image or running a script via double click

I've tried to fix this myself but I'm not experienced enough to make it work

title: Desktop icons return to their default position after refresh
description:
On Fedora 31, desktop icons always return to their default position after logging in again, creating a new folder or delete the existing one.

![Screencast_from_10-12-19_21_40_28](/uploads/2dcf75d179837ccacc62f291fcc7934f/Screencast_from_10-12-19_21_40_28.webm)

title: Icons dissapear when trash icon is enabled
description: Icons dissapear when trash icon is enabled

title: Builder: wrong semantics in "delete command"
description:
"delete command" was translated as "Löschbefehl"("command to delete") instead of "Befehl löschen"("delete this command")

Already patched [here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-builder/merge_requests/235#note_668724). (but at wrong place)

title: Broken translation of four-in-a-row user docs in Catalan
description:
https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/four-in-a-row/commit/ceaf86c1ae74973cb9dd82ffa0b49a201933c172 introduced a string with broken markup:

```
msgid ""
"When the computer makes a winning move because of your last move or when you "
"accidentally make the wrong move, you can undo your last move and change it. "
"To undo your last move, press the <gui style=\"button\">Undo your most "
"recent move</gui> button in the header bar or press "
"<keyseq><key>Ctrl</key><key>Z</key></keyseq>. You can now drop your marble "
"at a different row in the game area to change your move."
msgstr ""
"Quan l'ordinador fa un moviment guanyador a causa del vostre darrer moviment "
"o quan accidentalment feu un moviment equivocat, pot desfer-lo i canviar-lo. "
"Per desfer l'última jugada, premi el </gui> botó a la capçalera o premi "
"<keyseq><key>Ctrl</key><key>Z</key></keyseq>. Ara pot moure la seva bola a "
"una fila diferent de l'àrea de joc per tal de canviar el seu moviment."
```

title: TODO: cache colorthief color or remove feature
Syntax highlighting for <code> blocks
description:
Some technical blogs intensively use the `<code><pre>` (for instance, the [rust lang blog feed](https://blog.rust-lang.org/feed)). At the moment those blocks are displayed with a monospace police, but I would love them to have syntax hightighting too.

The difficulty might be to guess the language of the code to display. The rust blog use a css class in the code block `<code class="language-rust">` but I do not know if it really is standard. I know there are some syntax-highlighting tools that can guess the langage too.

What do you think?

![gfeeds](/uploads/ea5772828d36578c55915bd3444b74e8/gfeeds.png)

title: TODO: replace box.pack_start/end with add and hexpand vexpand
Keep active article visible in feed sidepane regardless of read/unread status and "Show read articles" setting
description:
Situation: I prefer to have "Show read articles" unchecked, but the current behavior of marking an article read when the article is selected makes it difficult to a) glance at the article sidepane and see where you currently are in the listing, or b) to easily save or mark the current article as unread if intending to come back to it later. 

Would it be possible to keep the active article entry visible in the sidepane regardless of its read/unread status?

title: Do not open double copies of files.
description: For situations when while tau is running and started from command line, do not open files twice.

title: can't copy(or cut) and paste into a new/unsaved/untitlled file.
description:
Copy/cut and paste works fine when copying or cutting and pasting into another existing file, but if i try to copy or cut and paste into an untitled/new/unsaved file it locks Tau up and i have to forcibly quit.

i saw this in the journal: 

`tau[2746]: Drawing a gadget with negative dimensions. Did you forget to allocate a size? (node image owner GtkSearchEntry)`

don't know if it's related.

btw, i'm using Tau 0.9.3 in openSUSE TW.

thanks

title: Portals
description: For security reasons, it would be idea if Tau used [Portals](https://flatpak.github.io/xdg-desktop-portal/portal-docs.html).  However, based on the Flatpak profile, it looks like it may be doing that under-the-hood?

title: Release 0.9.4
description:
I'd like to draft a 0.9.4 release soon, but I'd like to have a few things in the release:

The new gtk-rs release of !386. Not quite sure if all of !386 can go into the release, it should only need a bit of polish, like a hiding widget.

I'd also like to get !392 in the release. Do you have other things you want to get in the release, @tomsteu ?

title: File Browser Pane
description: Similar to what gedit has. If no one is working on this, I would be willing to. Tau could be a decent editor for Markdown if it had a file browser panel and live preview. It could also be a decent code editor with a file browser and terminal.

title: [FR] option in settings to always restore "session"
description:
It would be nice is there were a setting to have Tau always open with the files that were open when it was last in use. Many times i have files open as part of a task and something interrupts my session (graphics card resetting this last time) and when i open Tau i don't remember all the files i was working on. It can really help you remember *how* you were planning to solve a problem. Atom does this by default, and i think it's a nice feature. 

Thanks

P.S. If i get back to learning Rust i'll try to contrib code when possible. I was contemplating making an editor from scratch with Rust one of these days anyways, b/c it was needed, assuming no one beat me to it.

title: can't install from OBS repo in arch
description:
when following directions on the Tau readme for using the OBS repo from Arch i get: 

```
error: failed retrieving file 'Cogitri_Tau.db' from download.opensuse.org : The requested URL returned error: 404
error: failed to update Cogitri_Tau (failed to retrieve some files)
error: failed to synchronize all databases
```
thanks

title: Allow opening system/hidden files
description:
It would be nice if Tau would let me open .env and other hidden files for a project i'm working on if set to "shown/unhidden" in the system's default file manager/browser, instead of having to go use another text editor, or use the file manager and "open with"->"Tau". I'm not sure how it works in the background with linux distros and the file managers, but Atom has a bad behavior where you can open hidden files when they are set to be shown in the file browser but once you do, the file browser gets set to hide them again (IIRC how it happens). I only mention this so that hopefully Tau can avoid that issue when/if implementing.

thanks

title: Show full path of current tab's file in window title and for any tab when hovering.
description:
Right now, i'm not seeing any way to know where the current file came from. This can get tricky when working on different versions with the same filename. Just showing the full path in the window title would solve that. It would also be nice to show the full path on hover of any tab, so you can decide which tab you want to click on. This title tooltip should be as quickly rendered as possible, IMO.
thanks

title: file open dialog should start in location of current tab's file
description:
so, if i'm working on a file in /srv/http/superapp/app/controllers and i need to open a new file, i want the File Open window dialogue to start in /srv/http/superapp/app/controllers. This feature is the first thing i notice when trying out a new editor and i can't use an editor that doesn't have it. I would really like to use a light weight and simple editor written in rust instead of the currently available alternatives. 

thanks

title: Backups are extremely slow and don't take advantage of multi core systems
description:
I run a backup of most of my /home directory (approx. 200GB) to an external USB3 SSD and notice that it takes a long time (approx. 2 hours).

There appears to be a bottleneck in that I have 4x cores but only 1x core is at 100% for a lot of this time.

I know that GnuPG (gpg) as used by this package is not multi core capable [Debian Bug 848951](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=848951) and I also know that GZip is not parallel/multi core.

I'm wondering if we enable use of `pigz` (parallel implementation of GZip) if this will fix the issue completely. Compression does take a long time after-all. I'm absolutely willing and able to help but would need some small amount of assistance (never touched Vala and my C/C++ is rusty, but workable).

title: Resume later not working as expected
description:
Clicking on "Resume later" while creating the first backup of a directory just deletes all files that were already backed up and starts over from the beginning.

For me, this is counter intuitive: I expect the program to continue where I wanted to take a break.

Is it possible to implement this? For me, this would be very important: I have a 2TB disk I'd like to back up. Unfortunately, my computer is quite noisy and stands next to my bed... It would be great if I could stop the backup, shut down the computer and continue in the morning without losing the progress of the evening.

title: Deja Dup doesn't track duplicity instance after closing dialog window
description:
Fedora 31, rpm pkg ver 40.6 1.fc31

Steps to reproduce:

1 — Start fresh instance of "deja dup backup tool".

2 — Configure your backup: directories, target storage etc.

3 — Go to "summary" page and click "create backup" button.

4 — Application opened "creating backup" dialog. It has no close button in the headerbar, only "cancel" and "continue later" buttons. BUT you can still literally close the window using context menu from window manager/shell. Close the dialog this way.

6 — Close main window of Deja Dup.

Current state:

5 — Deja Dup keeps `duplicity` instance alone in the background and shows "there are no backups" message in summary section.

7 — After closing the whole app, `duplicity` instance is working in the background without any control.

8 — When you start Deja Dup again, it does not know about that `duplicity` instance.

Expected:

5 — Deja Dup should allow to keep the job working in the background. Or should warn that job will be cancelled.

7 — Deja Dup should close `duplicity` instance.

title: Backup did not start with error 'Could not log into Google servers OK'
description:
Since two days my backup to gdrive stopped working with always the same error message.

`Could not log into Google servers OK`

deja-dup: 40.3

I tried to force deja-dup to re-authenticate by switching to a local backup folder and back but that does not lead to a re-authenticate.

Also running `env DEJA_DUP_DEBUG=1 deja-dup` does not bring up any logs.

How can I find out what the issue is to continue to backup my files?

title: Backup fails due to incorrect size reported of Google Drive location
description: I have an unlimited Google Drive storage account through my school, and I'm trying to back up around 50GB of files. However, deja-dup reports that the target doesn't have enough space for the backup. I imagine something is wrong with the way deja-dup is trying to measure how big a remote directory is.

title: [RFE] Improve snapshot scheduling by adding snapshot levels
description:
It would be great if Deja Dup would offer a more advanced snapshot scheduling.  
Currently, it only offers on snapshot level (either daily or weekly). It would help, if there are more snapshot levels, allowing to configure individual times before deleting from this level as well as being able to specify how many snapshots to keep from this snapshot level.  

Timeshift handles this pretty well. This is what they offer:
![Screenshot_from_2019-12-01_12-01-10](/uploads/739c420a74b231f012420d47e7269d06/Screenshot_from_2019-12-01_12-01-10.png)

title: Inhibit sleep when shortwave is running
description:
I launch shortwave and does not touch to my computer then.
After a while the computer goes to sleep due to the inactivity. Usually media applications inhibit sleep using a dbus call.
I'm not fluent is rust but I saw there is a crate [`logind-dbus`](https://docs.rs/logind-dbus/0.1.1/logind_dbus/) that permit to do that. I can't provide a patch because I tried to make it works but failed. :)

title: Shortwave not starting on Debian 9
description:

I've done some troubleshooting on it, but I'm not familiar with Rust or Rust errors. By running ``RUST_BACKTRACE=full flatpak run de.haeckerfelix.Shortwave`` I got the following log:
```

(shortwave:3): dbind-WARNING **: 16:21:10.149: AT-SPI: Error retrieving accessibility bus address: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.ServiceUnknown: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.ServiceUnknown
thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: D-Bus error: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.ServiceUnknown (org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.ServiceUnknown)', src/libcore/result.rs:1165:5
```

This was on a Debian 9 64-bit installation (Fully updated). It has the following hardware:

title: Translatable string needing context
description:
In the file https://raw.githubusercontent.com/haecker-felix/Fragments/master/data/screenshots/3.png we can see the word "Queued" in two places. First the group name for queued torrents (in src/fragments-window.vala), and the status of an individual torrent (in src/fragments-utils.vala).

In Swedish, and possibly in other languages as well, these two occurrences have different translations, so it would help translation if they could be split apart by a context so they can be translated individually.

title: Extra word in plural form creates duplicated words in sentence
Pause torrents on metered connections
description:
If on a metered network connection (`g_network_monitor_get_network_metered()`), where the user pays per unit of data transfer, it would be useful to automatically pause the user’s torrents so they don’t accidentally keep downloading/seeding and end up with a large data bill.

The user could always manually unpause the torrents if they want to continue torrenting despite being on a metered connection.

(Corresponding issue filed against Transmission: https://github.com/transmission/transmission/issues/1074)

title: Other albums by artist do not show when artist has exactly two albums
description:
### Environment
- Lollypop version: 1.2.16
- GTK+ version: 3.24.13
- Operating system: Arch Linux 64-bit

### Bug
Following these steps:

1. Open _Artists (list)_ from the sidebar.
2. Select an artist that has exactly two albums.
3. Click one of these albums.
4. Underneath the tracks, the other album is not listed.

For artists with three or more albums, a bar is displayed with the artist name, with other albums by said artist showing underneath, allowing you to quickly switch between them.

Not really sure if this is a bug - perhaps it's intended - but I'd expect this bar to show when there is more than one album, instead of more than two albums, which made me suspect it's an off-by-one bug.

Thanks!

title: Can't find Lyrics on genius for songs with a period in the title
description:
### Environment
- Lollypop version: 1.2.16
- GTK+ version: 3.24.13-1
- Operating system: Arch Linux

### Bug
Lollypop can't find lyrics with a "." in the title when Wikia is disabled by Genius is enabled

### Steps to reproduce
Enable network access and disable Wikia, and enable Genius (for lyrics).
Play a song with a period or "." in the title and head over to the lyrics tab.
The lyrics won't be found.
If you enable Wikia, lyrics will be found.

### Images (attached)
Image 1 shows lyrics displaying from Wikia
Image 2 shows that I was indeed using Wikia to get the lyrics
Image 3 shows lyrics not found from Genius
Image 4 shows that I was indeed using Genius to get the lyrics

The song I used an example does have lyrics on Genius
https://genius.com/Nine-inch-nails-mr-self-destruct-lyrics

I also tried it with a song called "Starfuckers, Inc." (Sorry for explicit name) from Nine Inch Nails and had the same issue.

title: Automatic playback: skipping album loops if album is listed twice
description:
### Environment
* Lollypop version: master / ae2f2d6d5fd40c428d560f7959d71121aae61b9f
* GTK+ version: 3.24.12
* Operating system: Debian testing

### Bug
1. Album A was playing, with the `Automatic playback` mode.
2. I hit `Ctrl+N`, which added Album B and started playing it.
3. I hit `Ctrl+N` again, which added Album A a second time and started playing it. (Both instances of A show up highlighted in `Playing albums`.)

At this point, every time I hit `Ctrl+N`, it alternates between playing A and playing B, instead of adding a new album and jumping to that.

title: Weird behavior when albumartist tag has ';'
description:
### Environment
- Lollypop version: master / ae2f2d6d5fd40c428d560f7959d71121aae61b9f
- GTK+ version: 3.24.12
- Operating system: Debian testing

### Bug
Many of my albums have albumartist tags with ';', because MusicBrainz uses that to separate composers from performers for classical albums. I've noticed two surprising things with those albumartist tags:

1. Looking at one of the album's detail page shows the album artist 'A; B, C' as 'A, B, C' instead.
2. Some of the album detail pages show no tracks. E.g., for an albumartist 'A; B, C', if I go to the 'Artists' tab on the left, there's an artist 'B, C'. Clicking on that artist and then an album shows the album by 'A, B, C' but with no tracks at all.

title: Opening the "Playback options" menu is slow
description:
### Environment
- Lollypop version: master / ae2f2d6d5fd40c428d560f7959d71121aae61b9f
- GTK+ version: 3.24.12
- Operating system: Debian testing

### Bug
When I click on the "Playback options" menu button, there's a noticeable delay before the menu opens. Commenting out https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/lollypop/blob/ae2f2d6d5fd40c428d560f7959d71121aae61b9f/lollypop/toolbar_end.py#L146 makes the button much more responsive, so I assume the bottleneck is somewhere in `__init_party_submenu`.

Likely related:
```
$ sqlite3 ~/.local/share/lollypop/lollypop.db 
SQLite version 3.30.1 2019-10-10 20:19:45
Enter ".help" for usage hints.
sqlite> select count(*) from genres;
421
```

title: org.gnome.Podcasts.svg persists as menu icon despite custon Icon in org.gnome.Podcasts.desktop
description:
# Steps to reproduce
cd ~/Downloads && curl https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/podcasts/-/archive/0.4.7/podcasts-0.4.7.tar.gz | tar xz && cd podcasts-0.4.7
sed -i "s/0.0.11/0.0.10/" meson.build
meson build && ninja -C build && sudo ninja -C build install

sudo sed -i "s/@icon@/radiotray/" /usr/share/applications/org.gnome.Podcasts.desktop

Reproducible in:
gnome-podcasts-0.4.7
- Flatpak unstable: yes

# Current behavior
org.gnome.Podcasts.svg persists as menu icon despite custon Icon in org.gnome.Podcasts.desktop
radiotray.png presents as icon in Planky

# Expected behavior
radiotray.png should present as menu icon rather than org.gnome.Podcasts.svg


# Additional information
Ubuntu 19.10 Budgie

title: Doesn't honor dconf window size constraints
description:
# Steps to reproduce
<!--
    Explain in detail the steps on how the issue can be reproduced.
-->
1. close Podcast
2. open dconf-editor
3. set persist-window-geometry-maximized to false, set all other geometry related keys to comfortable values
4. restart Podcast

Reproducible in:
<!--
    Please test if the issue was already fixed in the unstable version of the app.
    For that, follow these steps:
    1. Make sure Flatpak is installed or install it following these steps https://flatpak.org/setup
    2. Install the unstable version of the app following, flatpak bundles can be found in the CI artifacts.

    If these steps failed, write in 'Other' the distribution you’re using and
    the version of the app.
-->
- Flatpak unstable: yes <!-- Write "yes" or "no" after the semicolon. -->
- Other:

# Current behavior
<!-- Describe the current behavior. -->
Podcast starts maximized, forcing the user to spend time and frustration to resize the app window to preferred size.


# Expected behavior
<!-- Describe the expected behavior. -->
Honor the dconf settings: window top, window left, width and height is what the user wants.

# Additional information
<!--
    Provide more information that could be relevant.
    
    If the issue is a crash, provide a stack trace following the steps in:
    https://wiki.gnome.org/Community/GettingInTouch/Bugzilla/GettingTraces
-->
It seems that Podcast completely ignores the dconf settings, because I deleted all the keys, but upon restart, no new keys are created. I've also looked around for any configuration files where I can set the geometry, but to no avail. Now I'm stuck. This is ruining the whole experience, because window size should be something that "just works".

<!-- Ignore the text under this line. -->

title: Double-click the episode item to do the next possible action (Download -> Play)
description:
### Use cases
I would like to just do the next active action ("Download" if the episode is to download, "Play" if the episode is downloaded) by double-clicking anywhere in the episode widget.


### Desired behavior
see above


### Benefits of the solution
Don't to move the pointer to the tiny button widget on the right which is always too far away.

### Possible drawbacks
discoverability, seems to good as far if there is only one possible action.

title: Being notified of new episodes even if Podcast is not running
description:
### Use cases and Desired behavior
I don't want to have to open the application to check if there is new episodes, so that could be nice that a small agent could be started from time to time (once a day, ..) to check there is a new episode available.
If so a notification could be display and ask to launch podcast to play it.

### Benefits of the solution
Not to have to launch application to check new hotness.

### Possible drawbacks
Too many notifications
